So was quite excited that Canon was getting into waterproof cameras.The camera is great - great images, easy to use, great video, etc. But water leaked in rather quickly and at about 8 feet in a pool and then later in the ocean.Each time it leaked, the LCD display would go off and there was water in the lens area. I was able to leave it alone for a few days each time and it would "repair itself" as it dried out. But this last time (the third time) it refused to turn on any longer. So I begrudgingly sent it in.It's been about ten days now and I got my camera back today - a new one! I think it may be slightly updated as well. I'm very excited to have it back; it has come with perfect timing.So yes, I do actually recommend this camera (despite the leaks) because Canon handled it well and it really is a great item.

Reviews.Title: Does the Job
Reviews.Content: i don't know what the problem is? i had purchased this camera for a huge family vacation at the Bahamas. I read the reviews and the problems that might occur, (water seeping into camera etc) i did research and came to the conclusion that this was the best camera for price. After reading reviews regarding warrenty etc, i made sure i followed instructions carefully and made sure ALL CLOSURES were closed (battery flap etc)turned out to be an excellent camera and would recommend it. Made the vacation snorkeling and swimming that much better!

Reviews.Title: Incredible underwater camera, decent above-water too.
Reviews.Author: P. Breakfield IV "Tom Steele"
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about this camera at first, but after taking it to Jamaica and snorkeling with it for three days, it is worth every penny.  It is a little less flexible than the S series and it is harder to get good indoor shots with this camera, but underwater, poolside or outdoors it is outstanding.  I couldn't be happier with the results.While it is a VERY GOOD underwater camera, I wouldn't expect it to be your everyday camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Pendlay
Reviews.Content: I picked up this camera to use on the bass boat. Several years ago I ruined a digital camera on the boat and have not taken one out since and was missing a lot of great photo opportunities.I have used it twice on the boat and I am really impressed with the pictures it takes, I do have to do some post processing to boost clarity and vibrance but I don't consider that a problem.My main digital camera is a Nikon DSLR so the reviews saying the D10 is a bit big and bulky are funny to me, I think it is tiny. :)On the way in the other night there was a beautiful sight of the sunset behind a big cloud, we were going 50 mph on the water and bouncing quite a bit. I never dreamed the shots would turn out but I tried anyway and they are great clear shots. The LCD screen is also bright and crisp and easy to see even in bright sunlight.I highly recommend this camera for anyone who wants a waterproof shockproof digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Cannon d10 Great on white water kayaking trip
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so that I could take pictures and video during my white water kayaking trips. I've taken the camera out on the river 7 times so far and kept it in my pfd when not in use.  Waterproofing is great.  Despite ample time under water the camera's seals have held up very well -- no leaks to report so far. I haven't bee using a protective case or anything but the screen and glass over the lens have no scratches. Battery life is good. I was taking a lot of video with the camera but had plenty of battery life for the whole day. I recommend getting second battery though because you can find generics that work and only cost like $10. Image and video quality are outstanding as compared to the olympus tuff. My buddies have the tuff but a key difference is the optical stabalization. The tuff produced very jumpy video but this camera is great at smoothing out the shakes. I think this is the best waterproof rugged camera available right now.

Reviews.Title: 24 days, in the ocean 6-8 hours each day, AWESOME
Reviews.Author: ohionaturegirl
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to San Salvador, Bahamas on a scientific research trip for 24 days.  The heat was intense - never under 80 degrees F.  The camera was in the water with me 6-8 hours every single day and NEVER malfunctioned.  What is even more amazing is that about 6 other people on the trip also brought underwater cameras (all Olympus) and every single one of them malfunctioned or quit completely during the trip.  My camera was the sole survivor.  I took over 1500 pictures and several videos as well.  This camera was also the sole reason I was able to complete my research because I needed photos to track what I was studying.  The only problem I had was out of the water in the heat, the screen tended to condensate but the problem was solved by keeping it tucked under my shirt and out of direct sunlight.  This camera is a workhorse and completely dependable.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Victoria L. Evans
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera almost a year ago, and I LOVE it!  It has been underwater in Key West, with manatees in Crystal River, FL, in waves in the Gulf of Mexico, and in hot tubs, pools, waterfalls, showers, bath tubs, and in the rain! It also goes everywhere to take pictures when I am NOT under water. ;-)  It is easy to use, has very good battery life, and is shock resistant so I do not worry about it.  My 6 year old niece loves using it too, and takes great pictures with it.  Software is super easy to load, and you just plug USB cord from camera to computer to upload pictures from camera to computer.  Features are great.  Love black and white, sepia, and color accent features.  Sunset, kid/pets, and night scene are modes I use a lot.With all my cameras in the past, I had to worry about not taking my camera in kayaks, canoes, or to the beach, or had to risk ruining the camera if I did take it.  Now this camera goes everywhere.  It has a cool "submarine" look.  My brother bought one after I loved mine so much. We bought an accessory kit (which I would definitely recommend even though it is expensive) and put the camo color panel on his to replace the bright blue. The accessory kit also has optional carry straps which I have found to be useful, and a cool neoprene case.Everybody asks me about this camera--where can they get one, and so on.  I would highly recommend it.  A few "cons" or suggestions:  1) I am very careful with the seals, and never open the battery compartment or USB door if camera is damp, or if I am outside near dirt or sand.  2) This camera is not as tiny as some, which was a drawback for me.  However, it gets far better reviews as far as picture quality than any of the other waterproof cameras I have seen or heard about, and I have not been at all disappointed with my choice! It fits easily into a purse or backpack of course, you don't even feel it.  It just isn't tiny enough to fit comfortably into a pocket.  3) It only has a 3.0 x optical zoom.  This was a drawback for me.  However, the photo quality is amazing to me even with digital zoom to 12.0 x.  (Probably would not be if blowing up big enlargements.)  4) Flash is too bright to me when close up.  Really wish it had a soft flash, or half flash.  However, camera takes photos without flash in all but the lowest light.  5) Battery life is great.  However, it doesn't give you much notice about battery being low before it goes completely dead. I also bought an extra battery--got one for great price on Amazon--and this makes a huge difference...I always have one battery charged.Buy the camera, and have fun!

Reviews.Title: Sand, water, bumps, and still going!
Reviews.Author: MK
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I was looking for a waterproof camera that would also take video. I am an avid snorkeler when I go on vacations, and I have tried other methods of capturing my underwater adventures (disposable underwater cameras were ok, but no image stabilization and no video, and the Dicapac bag enclosure made my camera lose lots of its functions,including the LCD screen!). So, this time I splurged on this camera, and could not be any happier. Like other reviewers, I didn't know the great pictures this camera would take outside of the water (it is a Canon after all), so I brought two cameras with me on vacation, the D10, and my older Canon 890. I could have just stuck with the D10 the entire time, because it was able to take quality pictures in all situations. Fantastic videos, great image stabilization for those active fish, and the ability to be bumped around a bit. It got some scratches from being used, mostly because it does not float and got bumped around rocks in the water. Still worked like a charm. I never opened any of the compartments until the camera was completely dry, as I didn't want to take any chances on water getting in there. I loved the underwater setting, it picked up the colors perfectly. This is a setting my 890 doesn't have, of course, so even with an underwater housing for it, I don't think it would have captured things as beautifully as the D10. Don't hesitate to buy if you want amazing underwater footage of your adventures, or if you just want a camera that you aren't scared to get wet or bumped around a little. I swear, this thing got scratched on rocks, got buried in sand, even got lightly stepped on by my flipper...and it did not stop functioning. Perfect for the adventurer.As another reviewer mentioned, this camera does not do well with the transition from water to land. You will have some water spots in your pics if you are directly coming from the water, and it does take the lens a while to completely dry off afterwards on its own. If you are going to take land pictures directly after underwater pics, make sure to have a dry cloth on hand to really dry the lens first.

Reviews.Title: It worked well for me
Reviews.Author: Wesleyan Hsu
Reviews.Content: Earlier this year my extended family was planning a trip to Cancun in March. I thought it would be nice to have a waterproof camera for underwater shots as well as not having to worry about it getting sand on it or it bouncing around when it hit the water, etc.I did my research and none of the current options jumped out at me as the clear winner. The Canon was in the lead for me because it had better picture quality. But, it was large and has an absurdly priced accessory kit. What I thought I wanted was one of the many next generation models, especially from Panasonic, as I really like my DMC-TZ5. But, all of the new models were being released in April... one month too late! After reading so many reviews about all of the cameras leaking, I was hesitant, but I needed something, so I bought the Canon D10.On paper, it's specs put it in the middle to the end of the pack. 3X optical zoom, "large" camera body. VGA video. Certainly nothing to drool over. But, its water proof rating is to 10m/33ft, while many of the competitors were only good to 1/3 that.It performed admirably during our 6 days in Cancun. It was the first time I had a camera with me while on the beach and in the ocean and pool without having to even worry about it. I got pictures that I would have never been able to before. And, most importantly, it didn't leak at all. I was VERY cautious about making sure the battery/memory card door's rubber seals were perfectly clean, etc.I also completed my scuba certification while in Cancun, but I didn't take the camera with me. First, I didn't need any more distractions while learning the ropes of basic diving techniques. And, while we only dove to 30 feet, I didn't want to take the camera down to its advertised limits, since Canon doesn't stand behind its waterproof rating in its warranty. ANY water damage is NOT covered. That makes no sense to me. How can a company state that a camera is waterproof to a certain depth and yet not back up that claim in their warranty? But, it is, what it is, so I didn't take the chance when I went diving.I would recommend this camera, as it does take pretty good pictures (for a waterproof point and shoot). But, I would encourage everyone to consider the latest generation of waterproof/rugged cameras first. I'm sure the price of the D10 will drop as the next generation models are released, so if cost is a concern, you should definitely consider the D10. Just skip the $130 accessory kit. C'mon Canon... price it appropriately at about $30 and I would have had no problem adding that to my order.

Reviews.Title: Cool Little Camera
Reviews.Author: momwithlotsofcameras "Amy"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my husband for his birthday/ cruise to the Caribbean.  We also brought a small Canon the fits into everthing and my large SLR.  We ended up using the D10 for practically everthing.  There was a sense of relief carrying that around knowing that it could get bumped, dropped, and splashed with out worry.  I think the only thing that it didn't do was get dropped, but it was in the ocean, pool, sink, bath (we have 2 little kids).  There were also no worries handing the camera over to either the 7 year old or 5 year old.  The only thing we wished it would do would be to be able to stand up on a table.  Because you can change the wrist strap to any corner of the camera (kind of neat feature), it does not have a flat bottom to set down.  Only a minor issue but something to keep in mind if you are the type of person that puts the camera on a table, runs around front and takes a picture of yourself.  Otherwise, great handy camera for everyday and trips.

Reviews.Title: A Fantastic Camera!
Reviews.Author: AlaskasLiberty
Reviews.Content: What an amazing camera. My husband and I bought this camera for a snorkeling trip to Kauai. It takes fantastic pictures both in and out of the water. I'm a professional photographer and this was the only camera we took on our trip because I didn't want to be packing my big camera around with me. The picture quality of this little guy is amazing. The huge screen really came in handy underwater and I loved that you could move the strap to any of the four corners. The video quality underwater was great, too. When I opened the battery/sd compartment after several hours of being submerged during our snorkeling trip it was dry as a bone. Not a drop of water in it. If you take it in salt water, though it's very important to soak it for a while in fresh water as soon as possible afterward. Otherwise the salt will ruin it very quickly. I'm so happy that we bought this camera. It's great to stick in your purse when you think you might want a camera. The size is very convienent. And I love the blue color! Overall, this was a great purchase and I would highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Shoeaddict
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I was going on a trip to Belize with a class and I really needed a waterproof camera because a majority of the trip was snorkeling. I was really nervous about buying a waterproof camera because I know stuff can always happen and something could always go wrong. I decided to take a leap of faith and I am so happy I did. When I first put it underwater I was in a swimming pool. The pictures were amazing. Crystal clear and no water leakage. I finally took it to the coral reef and I was amazed at what came out. The pictures were rarely blurry and the colors were amazing. I took over 1200 pictures and videos on a 11 day trip. Not only are the pictures great quality, but the video is amazing. People with other waterproof cameras could not believe how crystal clear my pictures were. The quality of the pictures was so great that I could zoom in all the way on one picture and it would still be perfectly clear. I will upload some pictures and people can take a look. I would definitely recommend this camera for anyone who is taking a water-related trip.

Reviews.Title: Excellent all weather camera
Reviews.Author: Paul R.
Reviews.Content: We purchased the D10 specifically for the cruise to the western Caribean and the snorkeling tours.  Very easy to use.  Rarely had any picture that was blurred.  Simple to rinse off after being in salt water and then dry with a towel.  Easy to edit pictures.  Very nice feature is that you can secure the rope to any of the four corners of the camera - makes it compatible whether you are left or right handed.  We recommend the D10.

Reviews.Title: More Great Canon Quality
Reviews.Author: Norman Walker
Reviews.Content: March 15th 2009:I am going to start out with my initial thoughts then will add my comments as time goes by.  I just got the D10 today, I had it shipped to my work so that I could get it earlier in the day!  I had all ready purchased an Maximal Power DB CAN NB-6L Replacement Battery and a car charger so I would have a fully charged battery to play with.  Turns out that the Canon battery has some charge all ready on it so I didn't need the other battery right away.Taking it out of the package I was very impressed with how well put together it is and how solid it feels.  I have had many of the Canon Powershot cameras starting with the S210 way back in 2003.  This is the 4th camera in the Powershot series that I have owned.  From my initial take this is really a good camera.  Due to the waterproofing it feels very solid and seems to be well made.  Since the camera is more rounded they were able to place buttons in areas that are easier to reach such as the zoom and zoom out buttons are now on the screen side of the camera and are easier to manipulate then on my SD750.  It also seems that they beefed up the brightness of the screen due to the fact that this camera is meant to be used outdoors more then most cameras.  I was only able to take a few test shots so I can comment too much on the most important feature of the camera but from the few random test shots in bright sunlight it seemed to do very well.March 16th 2009:Well we got the camera to the pool to put it through it's paces.  The pool has large indoor kids play area with water slides and stuff to play on.  We got a fair amount of light in from the windows so we could take some shots without the flash if we were on that side of the pool.  Before going in the water I opened both doors and visualy inspected the seals for any foreign substances that might make the seal not work properly.  I plan to do this everytime we use it in the water to be 100% sure that we don't have any leakage issues.  I would venture a guess that most people that have had their camera leak ended up with a small hair or other foreign material on the seal.  I was really happy at how well the flash worked on the D10.  I do have a SD450 that I bought a waterprrof enclosure for but I could never get the flash to work like it should.  Since this camera is not that bulky the flash worked very well.I was also impressed with the scene modes.  I had a few issues with non flash indoor shots until I switched it to the indoor scene mode, at that point my pictures looked much better without the flash.  Controls are easy to use, I like where the zoom keys are it is just taking me a while to get oriented to which button does the zooming.  My wife was a litte bit skeptical that we needed another camera but she is a big believer now that we have it.Monday March 22:Wow the 3200 ISO Scene mode is really amazing!  I took some low light shots of my sons while there were napping that were really amazing given the low amount of light in their room.  I also used the fireworks mode to take a few shot of a cars on the highway.  These turned out really nice and show how well this camera adapts to what you want to do with it.  Yes it is an undewater camera but it can do so much more then just get wet.

Reviews.Title: I really loved this... until water ruined it!
Reviews.Author: Skai
Reviews.Content: I'm so sad... as I really loved this camera. That was before the battery compartment somehow came open and sea water got in and ruined it completely.I bought this camera in August 2009 and took it with me on diving and snorkeling trips to Bonaire, Hawaii, and Thailand. The camera features were great and it was extremely easy to use. I also loved taking videos of my underwater adventures. All in all, I would have been the first to give this a 5 star rating.However, one day of snorkeling I had the camera out and realized it didn't work. I popped up above the waves and saw the battery compartment open, my battery gone, and water in both the LCD screen and lens. Aaaargh!!! I had to buy those crappy disposable waterproof cameras for the rest of my trip, which resulted in with almost-worthless photos.I counted all the times I went into the water and realized the door seal had failed on the 14th day of use. That's just not cool. I'm trying to get a refund via my Visa, as Canon says "water damage is not under warranty" and Amazon doesn't take returns after 30 days.I'd really suggest you get a waterproof case and just use a cheap digital camera instead.-----UPDATED 10/18/10I'm bumping this from a 2-star to a 3-star, as I was able to get the camera replaced by Canon (so yay for customer service).HOWEVER, please note that this brand new camera got its microphone damaged after a 2 week scuba diving trip to Fiji and Australia. There's now NO audio for my videos. As almost all of my videos are underwater where audio is unnecessary, I guess that's okay. But sheesh!At least this new one is waterproof (so far), as I am uber cautious about checking the seals EVERY time I get near water.I haven't found anything better, so "meh."

Reviews.Title: D10 is king for portable underwater digital camera
Reviews.Author: travel23
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a waterproof camera to take on my Hawaii vacation and originally stumbled on the Fuji Z33WPFujifilm FinePix Z33WP 10 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Black), the price was right but the reviews I was reading on the photo sites were not very good.  I wanted a camera that can be used in the water AND on dry land and still produce good pictures!  After more online research I decided to order the D10, I have had numerous other canon powershot cams so I was familiar with the menus and layout.The camera is slightly bulkier than your standard powershot camera and not as easy to pocket.  I had no problem with size as long as I was wearing shorts or pants that were not jeans.  You do need to be careful since the lens and back screen are always exposed so I used my old A70 case to transport my D10.  Battery life was good, we used the D10 at the pool, ocean, snorkeling and never killed a battery.  The camera buttons were easy to use underwater while snorkeling. The button layout is slightly different than other powershot cams but you get used to it really quick!  The video and photo came out very, you can even use the flash underwater and it provides some decent detail on close subjects like coral.The wrist strap that comes with this camera is sturdy and has an adjuster knob so you can tighten so it wont fall off!!  Great feature that no longer comes on the powershot cams!Overall - the D10 was almost double the $$ over the Fuji but after this trip i was pleased i spent the extra money on it!

Reviews.Title: CANON poweshot D10 12.1MP waterproof digital camera
Reviews.Author: elli girl
Reviews.Content: purchased this camera as a birthday gift for my boyfriend,,,,,he is in the ocean everyday and it seemed the perfect fit for him...after a month of normal use, it has stopped working properly and has become a frustrating situation...we havecontacted CANON and they are suggesting we send it to them,,,,it will take some time to work on and the tech guy saidthey have been having problems with this camera...so, it was at first a wonderful tool for his ocean activities, but nowit is useless...bummer.

Reviews.Title: this product works
Reviews.Author: J. E. Belschner
Reviews.Content: I received this product for christmas, to be used during an upcoming trip to the Yucatan. Knowing how expensive the Kodak Underwater cameras are (with the price of processing), this was a no brainer. On the second day of the trip we went SCUBA diving off the reef and the fellow divers were pretty jealous of the capabilites of this camera. We went right down to 30-35ft (12-14m) and the camera perfomed perfectly. Having the piece of mind knowing that this camera can hold up to the elements and even take a minor beating makes it worth every cent. Many problems that occur with this camera are operator error, people tend not to check the doors to the ports and then the camera will fry. So if you are alert with it, it will last you.

Reviews.Title: We were the envy of our scuba and snorkel trip with this camera!
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: Prior to buying this, I was considering the waterproof housing for my Powershot S880 IS for a trip to Hawaii.  I really like my 880 IS. And despite the great reviews for the housing, you have to admit that it's a $150 piece of plastic that does only 1 thing.  For some more money, I thought it made more sense to have a waterproof camera that also could serve as a backup.Took a few test shots just to get used to the settings and the camera, and they turned out fine. The real test was the manta ray scuba dive, and my wife took it down to 35 or 36 feet, which is 10% more than the recommended 33 feet.  It kind of made me nervous as I heard her say she went that low, but those Canon engineers clearly know what they are doing.  The camera worked like a champ!  After setting it to underwater mode, the pictures (plus sound!) came out beautifully!  The other people on our dive boat were amazed and asked if we would share the still pictures and videos with them.  We quickly became the envy of the dive.  I also took it to Kealakekua Bay, watching dolphins and tropical fish in the bright sunlight (but underwater) and once again, the results were fantastic.  You can zoom in/out while you take video with this camera, and I know some cameras do not allow that.  If the camera suspects someone may have blinked during the shot, it will display a small icon as you review the picture.  I found this feature surprisingly accurate.  The camera will turn the LCD screen on in playback mode, if you press and hold the play button.  (Other Canon cameras probably do this, but I discovered this by just playing around with the D10 one day.)What's also great about this camera is that it's good for everyday use.  The D10 has auto vs. program modes as well as the usual special ones like portrait, sunset, indoor, etc. and it's a 12 MP camera!  (My 880 IS is only 10 MP.)  The macro function also worked very nicely as I strolled around one of the botanical gardens in Hilo, taking good close-ups of the flowers.  The strap has a unique feature where you can move and replace it at any of the 4 corners of the camera.Buy a big memory card if you want to take this underwater, because you'll want to mix the still pictures with video and we quickly started to run out of room.  The minimum I would recommend is 4G.  Also, it was hard to find a good camera case because this camera's lens does not collapse flat.  It's got 1 shape (which I totally understand since it needs to stay sealed.)  I took the camera to different stores just to make sure it would fit, and ended up with a basic one that I purchased from Target, but about 80% of the camera cases could NOT fit this camera, so be careful on this part.Otherwise, I consider this money extremely well spent and hope you will, too.  I feel bad about the person whose camera leaked... Hopefully just a model with a small defect.  Mine worked great!

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Larry Fasnacht
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it much, but I like it.  Some folks have complained about the size.  I didn't have a problem with it.  I noticed that the fill flash is a joke, coming from DSLR's where I use it a lot.  Also I was a little dissapointed in the battery life.  I am replacing an old Casio Exlim 750 on which the battery hardley ever went dead.  In just a few hours of shooting, about 60 photos, the battery indicator was showing one tick off of full.  I have found that the battery indicators are usually not very accurate.  I usually change the battery shortly after I see it starting to go down.  Maybe this one is better.  It did continue to shoot.It is pretty quick on start up and shutter lag.I am not familier with the Canon menu system (Nikon guy), but I got the hang it pretty quickly.I  would love to have the accessory lanyard kit, but $99 COME ON!Overall I like it and will use it in circumstances where my DSLR is not appropriate.

Reviews.Title: Wow!  Love this camera
Reviews.Author: R. Wolf
Reviews.Content: We bought one after I took pictures with the Canon and two competitors at a photo store, uploaded the pictures, and compared them side by side.  When I asked the photographer and other customers which images they liked better, hands down the canon image quality was the best.  After using the camera for a few days, I ordered a second for my wife.  She is now using the camera more frequently than she uses her Rebel.  We bought both for a family cruise, and ended up buying a third so we could take pictures underwater, and video throughout the cruise.  Pictures are terrific, and the video easily downloaded to the MAC, so I had the movie done on the plane ride home.  This is a terrific camera if you want memories of your family vacations, snapshots of various events, and basically want pictures of real life.  It does not replace my D300, but I do carry it with me in my briefcase, just in case I run across that terrific scene, or want to capture the image of a whiteboard, or run across some other memory making event.  Waterproof, drop proof, rugged - the perfect camera for on the go.

Reviews.Title: Best waterproof point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Aaron Fort "Nurseman21"
Reviews.Content: Prior to buying this product I had purchased the Olympus waterproof and had 1 fail within a week, then with my 2nd realized how poor the picture quality was,.,, having owned a canon before I knew of the superb picture quality and ease of use so I am very glad that the same quality was maintained in this waterproof product! Picture quality is great, awesome zoom, and this camera is very durable! I have taken it diving and it works great underwater and the pics turn out great too! I love the feature of being able to easily move the wrist strap for convenience!On another note: I have had 2 issues, once I was having a "memory card error" message intermittently when I would power the camera on, but removing the card and reinserting it would fix the problem for a picture or 2.. this problem only occurred afew times in 1 day and not again since!Another time I was having a boot failure message, which again only happened a couple times!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera for a Snowball Fight
Reviews.Author: Valley Pounder
Reviews.Content: A well equipped, experience and talented photographer in our hiking group researched and selected the D 10 after many in our group experience camera mishaps on the trail due to rough handling and wet weather. Following many weeks of satisfactory performance and exceptional photos by our friend, we purchased the D 10. We find it ideal for not only spectacular mountainscapes, but for kayaking and family photos as well. Based on our experience, two more people in our ten-person hiking group are planning to purchase it soon. Maybe the D 10 will eventually get a sweep. Canon should make the D 10 in more colors so the happy hikers can tell them apart. It is the perfect camera for a snowball fight.

Reviews.Title: Great ruggedness and, well, it's a Canon
Reviews.Author: JB83
Reviews.Content: We were getting ready to go on a cruise, and this had just hit the market.  I loved the idea of an underwater camera, but was hesitant as I was not impressed by the picture quality of others I had seen (Olympus).  The d10, far exceeded my expectations.  Yes, it is a bit bulky, and the controls require a bit of re-learning, but the pictures are phenomenal.  Underwater and above-water, the images are sharp.  It takes better quality images than my old Canon s500, and absolutely takes better images than my wife's Casio and Nikon.If you are looking for a portable, easy to use camera, find another Canon.  But if you like being outdoors and capturing the experience, this camera it the way to go!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for those getting those creative shots.
Reviews.Author: Camera Wise
Reviews.Content: This camera was an improvement on my Olympus 770 WS.  I found the shutter delay and start up to be quite slow.  I missed a lot of shots.  I thought the Canon D10 was a great camera but not perfect and of course being the photo fanatic I am I carry it everywhere.  I had a chance to test some features such as the waterproof,  freeze-proof and shock proof but it was protected in the case.  I operated well at 26 degrees Centigrade with the snow and ice. There were no camera problems after a protected light fall.  Also it continue to operate after getting wet from the rain and the snow.  It has fast start up and a short shutter delay which enables you to get those quick shots.  The time between or delay between shots could be improved.  I found it difficult at times to catch action shots or movement from animals without some blur but I think I need to work with the camera a little more or ask the dogs to stop and pose for me.  I did some outdoor landscape shots and was pleasantly surprised.  If you want action photography we are talking about using an SLR for best performance with a quick lens.  If you want a shorter delay between pictures and when actuating your shutter you also need an SLR. Also the camera had a high ISO of 3200 which really helped with those low light shots and made the photograph look brighter in darker conditions.  Of course the only drawback was the noise or a grainier look.. In regards to the accessory kit I could only use two of the included items and they were the camera case and the neck strap.  The attachments for the wrist strap and the neck strap were a little too proprietary for me.  I would have liked an attachment adapter so that you could attach  another type of neck strap.  The case worked well but I would have liked a place for extra media and battery.  The neck strap was a little awkward and I had a little difficulty in getting to lie flat on my chest but it did work and was waterproof.  The next strap and wrist attachment to the cameras' four ports was secure, reliable, and was without fault.  Overall it is a great back up, hiking and/or outdoor activity camera which does water like snorkeling.  I think the accessory kit should have been divided up so that you can buy the camera case and neck strap separately.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera with a few minor adjustments
Reviews.Author: M. McDaniel "MNM"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera because A. It is the only one that can go down to 33' of water without housing. Olympus can only go to 10'. B. It takes awesome land pictures as well, and C. the price was right. I love that its a 12.1 mega pixel and the auto display automatically picks the right scenic mode. Like if you were shooting a flower you don't have to go to menu select "foliage" it automatically picks it. The shape could be an improvement. Its very bubbly and hard to hold at times. The speaker is on the bottom and thats where I rest my thumb to hold it. The volume can improve...when we play back videoes I can hardly hear it. The charger is compact and convenient to carry with you. Overall, this camera ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: Canon D10 - Great little underwater camera
Reviews.Author: R. Brown
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera about 3 weeks ago - just in time for our vacation to Hawaii. Now that we've had a chance to use it while snorkeling, we've found it to be everything we'd hoped for. The underwater photos are clear and bright. Previously we bought and used an Olympus underwater camera (the first maker of this class of camera) and found the photos dull and, due to shutter lag - often missed our subject. But this camera is very responsive and most photos look just like our view out of the face mask. We're very happy with our choice and sure that you will be too.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: We looked at the Olympus Tough and the Canon and went with the Canon because reviews said the picture quality was better and no one mentioned leaks. I was skeptical when I threw the camera in the ocean for the first time, but the waterproof claims held true. Underwater pictures are awful unless you are in underwater mode (it took me a minute to figure that one out). Beach pictures are orangy in underwater mode, but we often left it in this mode for ease of use. Video quality is also very good, and with an 8GB SDHC card we could hold over 3000 pictures.We were in Jamaica and spent every day on the beach. This camera never left our side. Whether its on the beach, kayaking, snorkeling, water skiing or sailing, this camera makes the perfect vacation companion.Definitely get a floating strap though, just in case.ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the adventure type....
Reviews.Author: Scott C. Morrison
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera ive ever owned hands down!  If you want an SLR your in the wrong section but you prolly are here to look for a good all around rugged camera.  Not only does it take GREAT outdoor shots, but great pics under water, and video.  I bought this for my trip to Hawaii and was the best money spent cause now i have so many wonderful, beautiful pictures, and videos of my trip.  Its rather small, so i was surprised at some of the reviews saying its bulky, well ya if you compare it to those little pocket cameras that only have digital zoom.  This thing is for the outdoorzy person, or even someone on a trip that wants great photos.  The battery life was good, had it on the highest setting and took pics of everything, and by afternoon or eveing had to change it out, but  I took pics of almost everything, being my first trip to Hawaii.. lol.. And took lots of underwater pics, and videos, never leaked and we went 20 to 30 feet down.  Just read how to keep it leak proof, and take care of it, and it will work forever!Ps, the video underwater is sweet, and it pics up sound as well, so when we were sucking down air scuba diving you can hear you breath, and the sound of my girl friend screaming when i handed her a sea star, this video is priceless to me now..!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: E. Read
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to Hawaii to get married. We went snorkeling almost everyday and this camera was a hit. We joked about getting another so we wouldn't have to take turns. I'm a botanist and I take a lot of close ups. I love the automatic macro which saves me from having to press another button. All buttons are easy for me. We took 3000 photos in 13 days. Movies are really nice. Great photos both above and underwater. Our photos came out way better than those I saw in the reviews before I bought it. Not one problem since I bought it in June 2009.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: M. Kiser "Explorer"
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with this camera. The photo quality is excellent. It has some added features that allow you some additional flexibility that other point and shoot digitals don't (or at least my previous camera did not).  I have used it in the water and have had no problems.  Its only down side is that it is a bit chunky, but I think that is minor considering the photo quality, and that it is waterproof and shockproof.It has been with me hiking in Mount Rainier National Park, canoeing and swimming in the Great Salt Lake in Utah - (it got wet, but not submerged there) and recently on a tubing trip down the Potomac where it was submerged and took great water shots and video while tubing! I don't think you can go wrong with the Canon Powershot D10.

Reviews.Title: Great all weather, rugged digital camera!
Reviews.Author: Devon Hubbard
Reviews.Content: I had pre-ordered a D10 as a gift for my wife.  She hasn't had a good digital camera in a few years and has historically been pretty hard on them in the past.  Tossing them into bags of stuff, dropping them off the kitchen table, etc.  The D10 seemed ideal being waterproof and generally rugged.  We've had the camera since it came out in May and absolutely love it!  We've had it at the lake in wet situations without any problems.  The picture quality has been great and the camera features are more than adequate for our needs.  Some of the features have been difficult to discover and use, and my wife still gets confused about finding some settings sometimes.  But overall, it's been one of the best digital cameras we've purchased in years.About the only thing I can say against the D10 is Canon's ridiculous accessory kit.  At $[...], it's almost half the price of the camera itself.  For a couple plastic covers, accessory cords, and a camera case?!  What in the world is Canon thinking pricing this accessory kit like that?  At half that I wouldn't have given it a second thought and bought the accessory kit.  But at Canon's price!  NO THANKS!  We found a small camera case that holds the camera nicely for a 1/3 of that price.  Thanks for a great camera though.  :-)

Reviews.Title: Had it for 2 months, just love it.
Reviews.Author: Fadi ELCHAMI "fadibou"
Reviews.Content: better than expectations, for an adventure camera, it has everything, its like a trekking shoe.

Reviews.Title: Powershot D10 Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Ray
Reviews.Content: All in all a pretty nice camera. Great for underwater shots and video. Nice not having to worry about damaging a camera every time you get near water or drop it out of your hand. Picture quality is pretty good, not as crisp as cameras without the waterproof protection but certainly good enough for vacation pictures and close up shots of your favorite people. If you're looking for a camera that takes amazingly sharp pictures this one won't be it, but if you're looking for one that takes good pictures and you don't have to worry about damaging every time you take it out this one is worth the money.Easy functions to understand and the "Auto" setting works great for most shots. Automatic light adjustment and face detection works very good most of the time, buy an 8 gig memory card and you can take enough double shots you won't have to worry about whether you got that good shot or not. SD and SDHC memory a plus as they are pretty cheap these days. Battery life is very good. Worked for me for three days without a recharge but if you're going to take hundreds of pictures a day you might get an extra battery. It is a bit too large to carry in your pocket most of the time so you'll need to carry around a case or strap it to your wrist. All in all a pretty good camera. I would recommend it for anyone who wants a camera that kids and adults both can use without worry.Can't comment on the software that comes with this camera as I use a memory card reader and photoshop to edit pictures and haven't installed the program or drivers that came with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error - Fatal
Reviews.Author: G. Duchak
Reviews.Content: This D10 seemed to work as advertised for a short while.  While taking pictures indoors in a benign environment, I got "lens error, please restart"  I've tried for several hours restarting and removing & replacing the battery to get the camera to work again without success.  The camera has NOT been abused but is apparently much more fragile than Canon will admit.  DO NOT BUY THIS PAPERWEIGHT!

Reviews.Title: Almost five years later, this camera still reliably takes nice pictures in harsh conditions
Reviews.Author: Nate Hartmann
Reviews.Content: We've taken this camera rowboating in Lake Michigan, up Mount Fuji, down many rivers in kayaks and canoes, swimming in heavily chlorinated pools. It's been dropped, submerged in dirty lakes, frozen, and it still takes very nice pictures.It also takes good looking videos when submerged which is very neat.If I had to find a criticism, it'd be that the optical zoom is typical of the PowerShot line (mediocre).

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: YASSINE TAHRI
Reviews.Content: This camera has been great. It is one of the best camera interms of price. Waterproof and great item to have on vacation.

Reviews.Title: It WILL leak and destroy itself sooner or later -
Reviews.Author: Jeff Coryell
Reviews.Content: I Have had this camera for about 4 years.  Over which time I used in underwater maybe 4 - 5 times.  I read a lot about them leaking, but this never happened to me, UNITL..............last week While I was in the Caribbean, we went on a snorkle trip.  As soon as I got in the water it leaked immediately and destroyed itself.  Lucky my memory card was OK, and my previous pictures weren't lost.  I am always super careful before going in the water.  It's just a matter of time.  Of course it is out of warranty, so it would cost $225 for Canon to repair or replace.  I guess 4 years is not too bad, but I only actually used in in the water maybe 5 times.  Really a shame because it was a great camera up to that point.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot D10
Reviews.Author: Star Bocsi "Star"
Reviews.Content: I have owned a few Canon camera models and loved them all, until I purchased the Canon PowerShot D10 camera on September 4, 2010.  I wanted an underwater camera  and I trusted Canon because of my previous experience with their cameras.  Unfortunately, this particular model of theirs was absolutely HORRIBLE!When we first bought the camera, we had only used it a couple of times outside of the water.  Then in May 2011, we finally had an oportunity to use it under water.  It worked for a little while but then stopped.  The LCD screen would not display an image.  When we returned home, we sent the camera in for repair to Canon as it was still under waranty.Canon repaired the camera and sent it back to us.We had not used the camera again after receiving it back from repair until we went on vacation on August 1, 2011.After 2-3 pictures, the camera stopped working again.  It was the same issue! The LCD screen would not display an image and the camera didn't appear to even turn back on.  I could not tell whether it was on or not, if it was on, whetheraa it was in picture or video mode mode, nor what the settings were because the viewfinder LCD screen was just black.We couldn't take pictures of our vacation with it so we had to buy a disposable and that thing took horrible pictures.  So we were left with the choice of horrible pictures of our vacation or NO pictures of our vacation because we could not use our Canon camera!We sent the camera in to Canon again for repair. Canon "fixed" the camera again (2nd time) and sent it back to us.  Since then, the camera does not work.  We have the same problem with it.  After getting it back the second time, it took a couple of 2-3 pictures (not even under water) and then the LCD screen went black and it would not display an image, the settings, nothing.We haven't bothered to send it in for repair again.  There seems to be no point.  I will chalk this up to an expensive learning leson. Maybe this one just happened to be a lemon, but I know we will NOT BUY a CANON underwater camera ever again!

Reviews.Title: 3 years and going strong
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Champlin
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend. We had been breaking a powershot camera at a rate of about 1 every six months. They jumble around in her purse, get dropped, wet, dirty, and its not long till they die. Not this bad boy. It doesn't have the best sensor or autofocus available today, but at least it works and takes sharp pictures after trips to the beach, being dropped a dozen times, getting caught in the rain, or having drinks spilled on it. HIGHLY recommended camera for kids, or reckless adults. There is a reason they've been making this camera for like 5 years, while all the other models change with the moons. IT'S A TANK!

Reviews.Title: been a great camera!
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: My first under water camera. Love it! Have had for 4 years now. Take on every trip because of its durability. Great pics under water and has made such fun and funny memories!

Reviews.Title: Too many issues!
Reviews.Author: JayDee
Reviews.Content: I have had many issues with this product.  The camera was typical of an underwater camera, but the issues and service were not.  A year after getting the camera there was an error with a sensor that required service.  Canon charges about $190 for service, regardless of how simple the issue is to solve.  I fixed it and thought that would be the end of the problems.  I had not exposed the camera to the water since the Canon factory service.  On our honeymoon, I checked the seal and went into the water to snorkel.  I brought it into the water has I had before the service and it would not turn on; I looked at it carefully and was horrified to find that water was inside the camera.  I inspected the seal and could find no cause. The camera was ruined.  We have come to the conclusion that when the Canon serviced the camera it did not retain the waterproof quality.  I have spent hours dealing with rude representatives and getting the run around.  In the end, Canon refused to stand behind their work and I refused to pay for their mistake.  I recommend spending your money on a different brand's waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot D10
Reviews.Author: C. Kopec "cjktx"
Reviews.Content: Takes nice pictures in and out of water; however, within one year started having frequent electronic problems requiring the camera to be reset by pulling the battery.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Tracie M. Kasper
Reviews.Content: This is perfect for my day hikes! It's suitable for rugged terrain in case I drop it , and of course, best yet, takes pictures underwater! Worth every penny! Very durable. Easy to transfer photos to computer. I recommend getting an SD memory card to hold photos as the camera holds maybe 2000 Or so. If you take tons, like I do, the 16G memory card was Necessary. Haven't tried the video feature yet. Photos are very clean and sharp, even underwater !Love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Vbrob
Reviews.Content: I have had my D10 for over two years and it is a constant companion on our trips. It's my go to camera for snorkeling or in adverse weather conditions. It has never failed me except for one minor detail that took me a bit of time to resolve. Before I bought the camera I had read owner reviews which described a lens error problem - in fact one owner returned the camera because he couldn't eliminate the problem. If the lens error appears the camera is rendered useless. I didn't experience the problem until recently.I can reproduce the problem when the camera is in the playback mode - simply press the shutter button and the lens error appears. I'm sure that this has happened to others by accident. The way to resolve the problem is to turn off the camera, remove the battery for a few minutes, replace the battery and turn on the camera. Repeat if it doesn't clear the first time, wait a few more minutes before replacing the battery.It may be a minor annoyance but the camera is not broken.Other than that minor issue the camera has been flawless within its limits - as has been noted by others this is not an expensive DSLR and does have limitations. But it will take good quality shots in better light conditions.I have always had Canon cameras and will remain loyal when I want a replacement.

Reviews.Title: WOW! Just Ordered my 2nd
Reviews.Author: AM
Reviews.Content: This is the best small, point and shoot (that can also snorkle) - I had a Nikon AW100  and it was not evem close to the picture/video quality above/below water or in/outdoors!You rock Cannon!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: justkiding
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in 2009.  In the first month or so I did have to exchange it for another one due to some malfunction (can't remember what it was), but the second camera has been flawless.  I use it all the time, and have taken a few photos underwater.  I love the picture quality both in and out of the water.  What I like most is that I can use it and not worry if it is going to get wet, be dropped in a pool or even a snow bank!  I have a few friends who have seen my camera and loved it so much they have purchased it.I did purchase a screen protector for the back LCD, something I would recommend doing if you purchase this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Ghengis
Reviews.Content: We have been using this camera for about three years now.  It seems to always do the job.  I bought the camera for our trips to the beach and lakes for its water features.  I  did not have high expectations for picture quality.  Ever since then I am continually impressed by the camera's picture/movie quality.  We just discovered it is really good at catching pictures of fire works.The camera has been great with kids.  The camera is small enough to fit most places.  It is not too small that my big hands cannot hold it.  It's shock features and movable hand strap are really functional for a variety of conditions--especially kids.Our only wish is that there was a mode to force the flash to fire.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price with all the features.
Reviews.Author: Dean Lovsted "Dean Lovsted"
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. even after reading a lot of reviews of busted seals and other issues i still decided to get this camera, and i am glad i did. the underwater feature works great  have had no issues with it yet make sure you check and make sure all the locks are in place and double check seals before going underwater that way you don't spring a surprise leak. the indoor picture quality is a little dark but lets be honest this isn't meant for indoor photos. outside with all the different advanced automatic internal features this thing will take crystal clear pictures every time and underwater pictures are just as beautiful i cant wait to take this to the Bahamas in august and see how it handles 4-10 hours in the water i will write and update when i get back but as it stands this camera is amazing.after 8 days of brutalization in the Bahamas i have to admit this camera is the best camera i have ever owned it was thrown into the ocean dropped of a rock dragged through a cave dropped in sand layed in sand etc etc and never once had any issues with it. the only thing i recommend is definitely getting the accessory kit so you have the floaty strap and extra battery as the standard battery only lasts about 500 or so pictures underwater so about a whole day and if you plan to be going on a long tip an extra battery is absolutely helpful.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, until it leaks (again)
Reviews.Author: Super Dave
Reviews.Content: We have been through THREE of these cameras now- all have leaked eventually.  The first time may have been our fault-  after seeing a fellow Scuba diver with the same camera at 100 feet (and still working!), we took it to 60 feet on a few dives- and the camera did just fine.  We were stoked!  Then a few months later it took on water.  We sent it back to Canon and they replaced it.While waiting for the replacement, we bought another one (so once the new one arrived we had two of the D10 cameras).  Both just abruptly quit working eventually.  One definitely took on water, despite never having it more than 5-10 feet below the surface. The second didn't seem to have water inside it anywhere upon inspection- but it stopped working while in a pool.  We obviously pushed the camera's limits- use it in the water regularly- with our son, or surfing pictures, and our son will pick it up and drop it.  But the last two cameras that died never were taken out of the "limits" of the camera's advertised capabilities (water depth or drop height).While the pictures and videos are pretty good- and we have been happy with the camera prior to it breaking each time, I think it is time we "moved on" to a different waterproof/shockproof camera.

Reviews.Title: The best waterproof camera for under $200
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Young
Reviews.Content: I know there's a new model of this out (Canon PowerShot D20 12.1 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens a 3.0-Inch LCD and GPS Tracking (Blue)) but honestly, I don't want to spend $300-400. The truth is, you're always taking a risk when buying waterproof cameras. I've owned an Olympus, Panasonic, and FujiFilm, and they have all failed on me between 3 months and 1 year. If you actually use this underwater, the seals simply won't last. In fact, read the manual and you'll find that some of them actually state that the seal will deteriorate in about a year!Anyway, on to this camera. So far after about month of heavy usage (>1000 pics), I've found this Canon to take the best pictures of the four waterproof cameras I've owned. I've taken my cameras hiking in rainforests, laying at the beach, skiing, and playing around the pool with my kids so I'm very experienced with them. Here are my initial thoughts on the Canon D10:PROS- Pictures are very crisp for this category (sub-$500 waterproof)- Not great in low light but also the best in this category; more than adequate in most outdoor situations- Waterproof up to 33ft is nice even though I won't go down that deep; it means that it's likely better at holding pressure (and keeping water out) than the cameras that go up to 10ft- Easy to use and very intuitive, just like any Canon- Love that I can connect the strap in any of the four corners of the camera; I like the strap on one side when taking landscapes but I prefer it on the other side when taking self picsCONS- Battery/SD compartment is secure but doesn't have an extra safety lock like other cameras (e.g. Panasonic Lumix); not a problem if you're careful and ensure it's completely closed- Very bulky - no way I would use this as my everyday camera since I can't slide it in my pocket without it creating a bulge since this camera is deeper (length and height are a little long too) than any compact that I've ever used- Wish it came with a rubber shell (i.e. Panasonic Lumix) that I can put on when I need to; I can see this camera taking a beating on its shiny caseOVERALLI love this camera for what I intend to use it for, outdoor and underwater pics (namely places where I don't bring my SLR). Hoping this lasts me over a year! If you want the newer, slimmer version of this, then go for it but I'm telling you if the depth of the camera is not an issue for you, this is the better value.

Reviews.Title: LOVE Canon. Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: L. Cothren "leslwc"
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera underwater, on a cruise, in the sand at the beach, in the pool, the kids have used it, I take it every time I go on my jet skis and it's wonderful! The reviews online when I bought it were mediocre, but I wouldn't trade it for the world! Works perfect.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: William R. Adams
Reviews.Content: We used these snorkeling in the Caribbean and got some great pictures as a result. So much better than the underwater disposables we used previously. You'll get better pictures out of a much higher prices camera, but for this price range they worked well above expectations. We also take these when we don't want to risk our new Rebel and got some great shots from them was well.

Reviews.Title: Canon D10
Reviews.Author: watto51
Reviews.Content: Great camera that takes great shots above and below water level without an exterior housing! Very reliable and easy to use in any weather conditions.

Reviews.Title: Maybe a Lemon....?.
Reviews.Author: R. Walker
Reviews.Content: I inspect homes for a living.  I take cameras places most people never want to go.  I take a lot of pictures - around 350 per day... every day.  At one point I gas 4-5 conventional cameras.  All Canons.  The dust and mud in crawlspaces was always mucking up the lens mechinism.  Every time I bought a new one I got the extended warranty - because I knew the lens would lock up - sometimes in as little as a week or two.Finally, I decided to try an D10.  That stopped the issue with buying 2-3 cameras a year.  However, the camera is not perfect.  I loose about 5-10% of my pictures to focus problems.  Imagine spending 45 minutes crawling through tight spaces on your stomach, taking 30, 40 even 50 pictures.  Then when you get home, you find the one you really need is way out of focus.  This is very frustrating.  I think I have narrowed the issue down to the macro focus.  Autofocus seems so sensitive, that it will try to focus on dust and spider webs in the air.  I am still not sure what to do about it... I was online tonight looking to see if others have the same issue.  Not seeing it.  My application is unique and the conditions I work in are extreme.  Maybe I just have a lemon.  No matter what, I need to do something.  I like Canon image quality and prefer to buy another model... So far no D10 successor and the one I have is driving me crazy.

Reviews.Title: Best Underwater Camera Ever!
Reviews.Author: Terri L. Floyd "loves2read"
Reviews.Content: compact but a little heavy.  Pictures are awesome.  Travels well.  This is my second one.  First one was about 4 years old and got water in the battery pack.  Loved it so much bought a second one.  Have a Fuji but even though it works, had to have a Canon as they are the best.

Reviews.Title: Water Leak!!
Reviews.Author: evenmorebooks
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great many times for about six months.  We used it at the beach, ice skating, in the pool and at a water park.  Great Pictures and easy to use during activities.  The 4x zoom pictures were grainy beyond 4x6 prints, but I think that is to be expected with a point-and-shoot.  Then on our first splash on our first day of a week long cruise water leaked in the camera.  The camera was closed and we were using it properly.  I took it back to the cruise ship, took everything out and hoped that it would dry out during our cruise so we could get some water pictures.  We did have our DSLR (Nikon D7000 love!) so all was not lost, but still.  The Canon did dry out enough to get power, but not enough to take a picture.  There was no warranty on this low end camera and since it was used it could not be returned.  I tried it periodically for another six months hoping that it would dry out enough to shoot.  It didn't.  I thought perhaps we just had a bad unit. I contemplated getting another Canon D10 Powershot because when it worked it was great.  Then I read reviews and realized that many people had water leaks.  I will buy another one when Canon acknowledges there is a problem and makes a better unit.

Reviews.Title: Caribbean Fun Camera
Reviews.Author: dano
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as Christmas gift for my daughter's St. Maarten's trip - she loved the camera and it survived eight days of young adult beach-partying!

Reviews.Title: Sorry to say, this great camera does not last.
Reviews.Author: Mbahan
Reviews.Content: I had this camera 2 weeks before the LCD went black and without an optical viewfinder taking pictures becomes a tricky thing. Thankfully it was covered under warranty but I had to pay shipping both ways and it took 3.5 weeks to get the camera back. The camera is now 15 months old and the LCD went black again. I have done some searching around and found this to be a common problem with this model. Not under warranty it will cost me $180 plus $20 shipping to repair. For a long time now I have preferred Canons for their picture quality and user interface and the D10 definitely held to that.  Unfortunately in the end, the D10 ended up being a big disappointment.  Point of interest, I was told by the Canon customer service pro that Canon is no longer making this model of camera.

Reviews.Title: A Waste of Money
Reviews.Author: Princess
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in April of this year and right now the camera is at the Canon factory waiting to be repaired. The first time I used the camera everything went well with it - my friend had also purchased this camera and from day one her camera was faulty. In May the camera started to malfunction with lens error repeatedly showing up when it was powered on. The power light would come on, blink twice and then the lens error message would be shown on the screen. My last attempt to use the camera proved futile and the camera refused to power on! I tried changing the battery (thinking the battery was faulty) but this did not work. After paying over $300 for this camera and having it fail less than one year after purchase is a huge disappointment!The camera is great for underwater use and produced some great shots but I suggest giving this product great research before purchase. I know there are a few bad apples in every group but for my friend and myself to get faulty cameras of the same type is really quite alarming. I had an Olympus Camera before this one and it lasted for years and I am really sorry I decided to switch to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Please buy an extended warranty - Camera prone to be damaged
Reviews.Author: Maria Perez Savelli "Conscious Shopper"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on March, 2010. I used it mostly out of the water, and maybe 2 or 3 times at the beach or pool. The photo quality is good as well as the features. BUT, there is a big but, the camera seems to have a problem with the LCD. Read other reviews and you will see. Mine failed during a short vacation on July 2011, just 4 months after the regular warranty expired. This camera never suffered any shocks, leakage, or anything. It was only used by me. My previous camera was an almost 9 year old Olympus 560.The best part, the repair estimate is $189,00 (plus any applicable tax) for $80 more I can get a brand new one. But no, I will buy any other waterproof camera. This is a very common problem, the LCD screen failing, everything else works... there should be a recall.

Reviews.Title: Died two weeks out of warranty--Canon quoted $203 to repair
Reviews.Author: AH "AH"
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to describe how disappointed I am in Canon.  This camera was used very lightly, and one year and two weeks after purchase the camera simply didn't turn on one day.  We charged the battery, changed the battery, etc., but nothing.  We called Canon, and they said they do not honor the warranty, even one day past the one year.  So we sent in the camera to their repair department--the repair dept responded that the error was "no power", and would cost $203 to fix.  One, the camera cost $270 initially, so a $203 repair is outrageous.  Two, we didn't do anything to the camera--it was sitting on a desk, and simply didn't turn on.  I've dropped my share of cameras and would confess had anything happened to it.  Three, how does Canon repair "no power"... what is that, and why did it happen?!  So, I am very disappointed in the longevity of the camera, and even more disappointed in Canon (a company I formerly had a high opinion of).  I will not be fixing this camera, nor will I buy another Canon anytime soon.  The good news is the camera took excellent pictures for that one year...)

Reviews.Title: Leak now
Reviews.Author: Tintin
Reviews.Content: Actually it's good when I used it in Hawaii, get very good quality pictures.But, when I brought it home and sink it in water to clean it, leaked...

Reviews.Title: Amazing battery life and very good images
Reviews.Author: Threepenny Opera
Reviews.Content: We live aboard our sail boat for 9 months of the year cruising the Bahamas and the Caribbean. Being on the water, under the water and in the water is an integral part of our life. We use the Canon D110 almost exclusively any time we are in our dinghy or out snorkeling. The pictures that we get are very high quality and the images from the D110 that we use on our blog rival those taken by our Nikon D300 at screen resolutions.The battery life of this camera is amazing and even more so considering the clarity of the LCD which is truly bright and direct sunlight viewable. When we are in the water, we leave the camera on all the time so we can literally point and shoot. Other cameras we've used had such limited battery life that we had to turn them off between shots if we wanted to use it for more than an hour. With the Canon we've left it on for well over an hour and there is still plenty of life in the battery. Just in case however we always carry a fully charged spare.The underwater mode does a good job of filtering out the blue, so the tone of the images appear natural and pleasing. The dynamic range could use a little work, but under water the conditions are pretty harsh so contrast is more extreme than on land. Used as a normal surface point and shoot the images are fine.There have been comments about the bulkiness of the D110 and while it isn't as easy to carry in our pocket as our Nikon S3, in the water, which was the whole point of the camera in the first place, the bulk actually makes it easier to hold and manipulate the controls. Macro mode works well so our coral pics are great.We have completed a full year using this camera and there have been no major issues with it so far. There is a little pitting around the strap ring, but that is likely due to being in a salty environment all the time. We noticed the corrosion early on, and have been more careful about rinsing it with fresh water after diving and the situation seems to have stabilized. You won't be making wall sized enlargements but for the price you'll get quality underwater and in water images that will rival much more expensive SLRs. And any image is better than no image at all!

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera that works on land as well!
Reviews.Author: Gloabtrotter
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera almost 2 years ago specifically to go snorkling with.  I have since been on 2 snorkling trips with it, and am entirely satisfied with it.  It takes great pictures underwater as well as above, and is packed with different settings and functions that you can play around with to achieve different results with your pictures.  A great buy!  Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Took a chance but like it!
Reviews.Author: Walter Woods
Reviews.Content: I won't do an in-depth technical review as many others have already done this. I researched this carefully before purchasing. Actually I was waiting for the $299.00 price to drop but it never moved. As I was going to Calabria, Italy  an every August trip) and wanted to take photos under water. The sea there is very clear and I have seen fish multiple times before but as I need corrective lenses to see underwater and I needed a camera that was waterproof, I carefully research both. I purchased Hilco goggles with a corrective lens insert and the Canon D10. I must be honest - Being a Nikon guy, I wanted a NIKON equivalent but none was available. I would have preferred NIKON with "RAW" capabilities, as I am a D300 user. I read the D10 positive reviews as well as the negatives. There seemed to be several who complained about water leakage, so I was hesitant. So I waited until the last minute before leaving for Calabria. I decided to take a chance and bought the Canon D10.I was very impressed with the camera. The corrective lens in the HILCO mask was great. It allowed me to see what I could not before. My best photos were of Jelly fish. They were high quality. I did find that even setting the camera to underwater "white balance", I still needed to use software to adjust the colors. However, that was no issue for me, and the clarity was amazing - We could detect the tentacles and the "stinging cells".I was a bit paranoid about the negative reviews stating water leakage. After each use, I religiously dried the camera first, removed the SD card, dried the door latch to be certain there was no moisture, double-checked that each of the closing latches were really closed, and put the camera in a bucket of Tap Water for several hours. I dried the camera carefully to get it ready for the next day's use. On one day's use, I kind of panicked because I noted moisture that appeared on the inside of the viewing screen. I was terribly afraid that those negative reviews were actually correct. After taking every precaution, why was there this moisture appearing? Was I going to experience a $300 loss? Back at home base, I opened the battery and SD card compartment and allowed it to sit in the sun hoping the moisture, if present, would escape (It is hot in Calabria). Whether that helped or not, I do not know, but the next day's pictures were great also. It is still working well, and I think the pictures taken on land were of high quality. So much so, that I think it takes better photos than my SD980. I carry the portables in my pocket when traveling anywhere -- for that opportune photo -- Hard to put a D300 in your pocket.Yes, the D10 has some bulkiness but I also bought the "Chums" wrist band that allowed for my ease of keeping the camera floating. It is somewhat bulkier than my SD980, but that may be the price of having something that is waterproof. So - Bottom-line-- Yes I would recommend it for anyone wanting those underwater photos at a moderate depth. If there is a way to attach a photo example, I would do it.

Reviews.Title: Won't get fooled again
Reviews.Author: fishpic
Reviews.Content: My D10 is currently at the Cannon service center for its second round of repairs for the Lens Error.  Luckily the first time it was under warranty.  It is not now under warranty.  I called and complained and got them to reduce the estimate by half.  After reading many other reviews regarding this same issue I don't think I will have them repair the camera.  I don't think I will be buying another Cannon camera; Cannon you let me down.

Reviews.Title: camera is not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Daniel Cushing
Reviews.Content: Camera died second time it went into water.  It was never more than a foot or two below the water's surface.  Inspecting the camera, it is evident that water entered through the USB port into the inside of the camera.  The gasketing around the usb port is pretty skimpy, and was not sufficient to prevent water entry.I think that this camera is advertized misleadingly.  Spash-proof, maybe.  Waterproof, absolutely not.This is without a doubt the worst camera purchase I have ever made.  Don't buy this product.

Reviews.Title: The camera leaks
Reviews.Author: champ1105
Reviews.Content: I got the camera Canon D10 for a Christmas present in 2010.  I love to snorkle and it seemed ideal.  I used it in the summer of 2010 in St. John, USVI -- and I really enjoyed it.  Got some great photos - the camera worked like a charm.  One year later (summer 2011) I was back in St. John  camera in hand.  Once again -- it was great fun --  for sure the D10 is not a professional level camera -- but it gets good shots underwater.  Then on the 8th day of my vacation -- the camera leaked.  I could see water in the view mode (the screen you look at to take photos) -- and it would not take a photo.  It was just full of water.  I was lucky in that I quickly got the memory chip out -- and when I got home I was able to salvage most of the underwater photos I had taken.So this great little camera has a real flaw.  For $290 it should work more than one season -- but it didn't-- it leaked and stopped working.  I'm going to send it back to Canon and see what they do.  A darn shame -- like the camera when it works -- but it leaks.  And I am a top of the water snorkler -- didn't violate any of the depth regulations.I hope they can improve this camera.  Right now I would say -- don't buy it.  When it works it is great fun -- but then it stops working.

Reviews.Title: Fatal Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Demasi "Mike D."
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera in 2009 and absolutly loved.  Took great pictures in and out of the water but after one year, just when the warranty was up I started getting "Lens Error" messages.  When the camera is first turned on it stops working and you get this message.  It tells you to restart the camara, which you cannot.  The only thing to do is remove the battery and pray that the camara works when you reinsert it.  Sometimes it does and sometimes it doesn't.  For the past year I found that if you give the camara a couple of slaps the lens will open and it will work. The worst part is not knowing if the camera is going to work at all! Cannon still refuses to acknowledge there is a problem so you are on your own.  It is very expensive to fix.  Recently the camara has stopped working altogether which I am very grateful for.  I can now throw it in the garbage and get a different camera.  Needless to say it won't be a D10.  Do a search on D10 Lens error and see what comes up.

Reviews.Title: Lens error received after only 28 days
Reviews.Author: jc
Reviews.Content: After much consideration, I decided to buy this camera despite the lens error problems reported. Thought surely this won't happen to me. I've been pleased with other digital Canons and was needing a new waterproof camera. Used it for 28 days (took over 1000 pictures) then got "lens error." Tried powering on/off, changed battery, memory card, etc. still dead. Returned to Amazon for full refund.  Very disappointed...now looking for a waterproof camera that is reliable (again)...

Reviews.Title: Canon stood by their product
Reviews.Author: Captain Bones "i'd rather be sailing"
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Canon D10 in June 2010.  It has been fantastic on our trip to the Caribbean and also other beach trips.  The underwater modes does a great job catching the true colors underwater (which is a big problem for our earlier camera that was in a waterproof housing).  Also made extensive use of Beach and Sunset modes and the camera does a great job for all around picture taking.  In July 2011, after a trip through the Bahamas and Dominican Republic, with extensive use in the water, including going from humid air to cool mountain water, I started to see water spots on the screen in the back of the camera.  The screen still worked fine, and the water spots dried out, but I was concerned.  Canon said it might just be from the temperature changes, but suggested I send it in to have it checked out.  5 days later, I had a new replacement camera in my hands, even though my camera was more than a month out of warrantee.  Thanks Canon for standing by your products.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Little Performer
Reviews.Author: J. Moro "JM"
Reviews.Content: This is/was an excellent little camera!  I say was because I purchased it as a gift for my daughter on March 17th.  Today, she texts me from Virginia Beach where a huge rogue wave took it from her with all her vaca pictures on it.  Shame.  So I just ordered her a replacement, identical model.  In the time she did have it we used it while boating on the lake, and in our pool.  The camera functioned flawlessly.  The images were crystal clear, sharp and vibrant.  The videos were also excellent.  I'm a photographer with much more expensive equipment and I am impressed with the image quality of this little camera.
