You can check my other reviews here on Amazon.  The build quality and look is excellent.  The camera is a tad bulky to put in pants pockets but otherwise, it's so neat.  I am so  impressed that like I said, I just re-ordered another one for her to replace the washed away camera.My only complaint is that, like most other digital waterproof cameras it doesn't float.  I have an older Canon Elph, APS film camera that we used to take to the beach, lake and pool.  The entire camera floats!  I purchased it in 1998 and believe it or not it still works, and still has the original battery, keeps time and just keeps on going.  But the best part is it just floats forever.  Gotta love Canon.Anyway, this is an ideal camera to have anytime you will be around water.  However, I suggest you purchase at least a floating camera strap for it.  I just did that as well == the "CHUM" brand bright yellow camera strap.  I won't make this same mistake twice of giving the camera, and using it around water without a floating strap.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera 2 days before we left for Hawaii and as stated in shipping details, it arrived the next day.  We took 3000+ pictures with our new camera and the only ones that weren't all that great were ones  that someone took accidentally ... floorboard of the car and stuff like that!  The waterproof factor is excellent.  As suggested in the accompanying manual, I soaked the camera for a couple of hours every night after using in salt water/sand conditions.  About a third of the pics are underwater in the ocean.  Yep, I am very pleased with the camera.  Grateful to Amazon for getting it here in time for the trip!

Reviews.Title: So great, I bought it twice!
Reviews.Author: Chelsea
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this camera for a trip I took to Ecuador.  It survived the Andes and the Amazon without a scratch, and gave me a multitude of beautiful photos and videos.  The things this camera can do with lighting . . . Wow.  Now I know why Canon is the camera of choice!  The only thing that kept me from completely giving up on my DSLR is that the macro on this isn't as nice as an actual macro lens (though the pictures are much sharper and closer than any other point and shoot I've used.)  Unforunately, it was stolen from me in Aloasi.  I loved it so much, though, that I simply had to buy a second one as soon as I could afford it.  If you're looking for a great camera for everyday use and travel, you've found the right one.

Reviews.Title: Bought two of them
Reviews.Author: E. P. Schlaikjer
Reviews.Content: We had a sequence of Pentax Optio waterproof cameras. They were waterproof, but slow with poor quality images.  For a trip to the Caribbean, I bought my father a D10. We enjoyed it so much in the surf that I bought another one for ourselves.  My daughter has appropriated this camera. It goes on all her school trips and is almost always in her surreptitious hand. She did a great sequence of underwater self-portraits in a swimming pool. She also loves the color tricks that you can play with the camera. Macro/close-up shots on the D10 are fantastic.  On family trips, we always get a thrill when we lower this camera into a pond or stream. Waterproof! But good images, too.  And, though I have a Nikon D300s and a Sony HD video camera (we are not a Canon family except for the D10), the D10 adds value with movies that would not otherwise have been recorded.  The D10 is still not SLR-quality. Quite a few images come out blurred or badly exposed. But it is brilliant for its niche. I find that pocket telescoping cameras invariably get killed by dust or grit. Not so the D10. And it is fast to start up and shoot.UPDATE: Dead with "Lens Error" just under two years later. Not fixed with a new battery or gentle taps. Have just bought a Nikon AW100 to see how that compares.

Reviews.Title: Awesome underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Whittington
Reviews.Content: This camera took great pics in and out of the water.  Had no problem with leakage.  Took the camera down to about 30ft and still functioned properly.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Corona1782
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were a little nervous using the camera for the first time on our honeymoon but we walked away with a great camera and LOTS of beautiful underwater videos/pictures.  The camera worked great underwater, was easy to use, and never leaked once!  The picture and video quality turned out great.  Many of our friends comment on the quality of underwater pictures we took.  We followed the instruction manual on how to care for the camera after a day at the beach and never had any leak problems.  Thanks to Canon for making an affordable and great quality underwater camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot D10
Reviews.Author: Laura Anne Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I purchased this before vacation and have been very pleased. The camera is easy to use and the pictures turned out great. Having the camera in the water was great for pool and water shots. I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Nellis
Reviews.Content: I had read that some people had problems with this camera, but I've had none. I took it to Jamaica with me and took awesome underwater photos. I love that you can also video underwater. It''s very cool. Really great quality and we didn't have any problems.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: A. DOBRSKI
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera!  I love the images, ease of use, and video!  The only thing I would change is making it a bit smaller and better images in very dark light.  I took this to my Mexico trip and loved it in the ocean, pool, and on the jetski!  I also took it skiing and tubing, the video and pictures all turned out excellent and it is very durable!!!!!!  Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Look for something else!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this product because my dad liked the ruggedness of the camera and it hasn't broken yet. One of the cool features is that you can go underwater with it and it did this well also. My problem with this camera (and All Canon's for that matter) it the dreaded E18 (lens error, restart camera) error. Had the camera just under 1 year now and just got it, now every time I want to use the camera I have to shake it so the lens will unjam. I checked it out online and I guess this is quite a common issue and canon doesn't cover it with it's warranty, which for a $300 camera pissed me off. So spend your money else where and avoid the hassles i had to deal with.

Reviews.Title: kauai-bound
Reviews.Author: K. mcgarity
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is pretty good for waterproof cameras but, the speed of the taking the picture seems slow, sometimes even missing a shot.  All in all, the camera is of good quality.  Still getting to know all of it's features.

Reviews.Title: Camera has performed very well for 3 years
Reviews.Author: C. Brown
Reviews.Content: Just want to add my experience using this camera for hundreds of hours snorkeling over the last 3 years.  Not a single problem.  I am very careful about changing batteries frequently, and taking great care to avoid getting any water or sand in the battery/flash card compartment ---- in fact I usually dry the comnpartment briefly with a blow drier just to avoid any buildup of moisture or humidity in the camera.  The camera has produced thousands of underwater photos and hours of video without a single hiccup.  Obviously, one can receive a bad camera that fails immediately.  Also, using this type of camera does take some special care about about keeping the one compartment seal clean and dry.  But, for me, it's been perfect.  Very easy to use.  Very robust.  I put an extra long strap on it that I can attach to my wetsuit, and then tuck the camera inside the suit.  Keeps hands free while swimming.  All in all, a terrific package at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: Canon's D10
Reviews.Author: R. Sauder "Amateur Photographer"
Reviews.Content: A great little camera that can really go underwater and handle so abuse from reef shore lines or rocky point entries!

Reviews.Title: The best vacation camera ever
Reviews.Author: Juloca "jhiggins60"
Reviews.Content: I seem to buy a new digital camera every time we go on vacation.  I haven't liked any of them until now.  Many of our vacations are in the water, so I have tried multiple underwater cameras as well.  I bought this Canon Powershot D10 and took it to Tahiti and Moorea for 11 days.  It spent about 5 hours a day in the water, and I am so pleased with how it performed!  I did not try video and only used it to about 12 feet in depth, but underwater, the shots were clear, the lighting seemed better than usual, the focus was good.  The macro shots were incredible.  I was able to get within 3" of these really cool tube worms and get perfect shots. The battery life was pretty good, too.  It ran out after about 5 hours, (although I did not have the power on continuously). Above water, picture quality was just as good.  I took many pictures of my kids jumping off a platform into the water, or throwing things in the air, and the camera caught the action perfectly.  It was very easy to use.  I did soak it each evening in fresh water as directed and had no problem with leaks.  My only small nits (3):  1. Like many other reviewers, I don't understand why there is no lens cover when the power is off.  Because of that, I constantly had sunscreen fingerprints or other debris on the lens, especially if my kids were handling the camera.  If I was in the water when this happened, I didn't have any means to clean the lens.  2. I did not like the light from the flash underwater--it seemed to lend an odd color cast to my pics.  Not a big deal because the camera worked well even in slightly dim conditions, so I just turned the flash off when underwater.  Above water, the flash was fine, but I do wish there was a manual means of turning the flash on (there is a manual "flash off" command), to counteract silhouette for example.  3. Although the camera itself is quite hardy, the finish could be hardier.  My 6 year old tested the hardiness of the case while scrambling around on rocks trying to photograph crabs.  The case came back very scratched.  I know that is a rough test for a camera, but a realistic one.  If you want a camera that will take a little rough handling and a lot of great pics both under and above water, this is a great choice. All in all, the best vacation camera I have found.

Reviews.Title: Greatest Waterproof Camera currently on the market!
Reviews.Author: Ercadm "http://tpsconsulting.com"
Reviews.Content: I had used the kodak camera and found it to be only good for movies as the still image quality was hard to switch to and it had no flash. This is not the case with the Canon camera. Not only is the quality of photos very good but the movie mode is very easy to switch to. When underwater, I set up the print button for quick access to movie mode so there is no fumbling while swimming. I have nothing negative to report, other than no lens cap but that can be good too, as my old Fuji camera quit working due to the fact that the lens cap would not open.  This camera is well worth the $$ and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot D10: Excellent choice for taking underwater pictures/videos
Reviews.Author: Aditya Phatak
Reviews.Content: We ordered this camera before our trip to Cancun, Mexico and it arrived in time. Key advantages of this camera:a. Taking underwater pictures and videos - it just works like a charm.b. Rugged camera: We have a 6 year old and 1 year old who dropped the camera a couple of times and there is not even a scratch. We also used this in salty sea water and sand (beach) for hours and hours during our 8 day vacation.c. Operating the camera is very very easy: change from pictures to video; zoom in-out; underwater mode etc. Specially you can change from taking pictures to videos while snorkeling in a second.c. The thick cable is valuable to keep it attached to your hand when you are scuba diving or snorkeling.Improvement?- Picture and Videos came out pretty good under water. On land they were quite fine, but for a 12 megapixel camera I thought they could be a bit sharper/better.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: coloredtights
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!I am currently traveling in Central America and doing a lot of water activities - this camera is perfect for all of them. Not only do I not fear it breaking because it is super durable, but it also takes really great pictures, with so many picture settings to choose from. I am sending home my DSLR and just using this camera!

Reviews.Title: Adventure Camera Satisfies
Reviews.Author: Brian "acousticlicks"
Reviews.Content: We have used this camera on all of our adventure vacations and it has not failed us once.  We are very pleased with the durability we have tested it with our rough and tumble 14 year old who takes it on ski trips to document his areal 360s as well as our dives into Mexican Cenotes.  We also used it on a kayaking trip in Alaska to film the bow plowing through the glacial melt.  He testifies that the camera is really good at capturing action shots even with fast movement.  Having gone through about 4 Cannon cameras prior, and pleased with the shot taking, but not so pleased with durability, this Camera has hit a sweet spot for us.  The only drawback is it does not take AA batteries so if you run out of juice in the outback you are SOL.

Reviews.Title: The Best Camera is The One That You Can Take With You
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Having now used this camera as my secondary to my Canon 40D for two years, I can confirm that it is likely the last casual compact camera that you will ever need. While the form factor is larger than the smallest compact cameras available today, it is still well within the size range where a woman (or man) can carry it in her/his purse and it won't be a problem. Backpack carry is likewise easily accomplished. The only time the form factor is would be a problem is if you are a guy that wants to carry it in his pocket.What you get is a camera that has a reasonably fast lens, a reasonable zoom range, and absolutely bulletproof construction, all accessed through the familiar Canon compact menu system. I have seen the Olympus "Tough" series lens covers break, and have seen a pentax waterproof camera flood, but in 2 years of ownership, I have not seen a Canon D10 with a serious problem.This camera will likely be the last casual camera you ever need, simply because it won't wear out or break. It takes great pictures underwater, above ground, and on any adventures that you find yourself*Try going into Program mode, setting white balance to cloudy, colors to vivid, and adding +1/3 stop of exposure correction

Reviews.Title: Wonderful multi-purpose camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly L. Hammond "Kelly"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace my cheaper olympus waterproof camera I bought a year ago.  It did the job but the pictures were never very good and I was looking for a camera that not only took great underwater shots but could also be used through out my vacations for every day shots as well.I got a lot of good use out of this camera on my recent trip to Hawaii.  There was no leaking with the camera and it took really great underwater shots.  The zoom worked well, and it was easy to carry around, turn on and off and take pictures with.  I used this camera for most of my vacation, and the pictures turned out incredible.  I would recommend this camera to anyone that needs a multi-purpose or underwater camera for your next vacation.  For the price you get a great quality image.

Reviews.Title: Great Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: Joy Becker
Reviews.Content: After struggling for 2 years with a leaky Olympus, I went for the Canon.  I couldn't be happier.  Took incredible underwater pictures and videos and not any trouble with leaks.  It made wonderful snorkeling even better.  Highly reccomend!

Reviews.Title: It hit the ground hard! still works great! love it
Reviews.Author: X. Matus "Xiomara"
Reviews.Content: What an amazing product, so durable! love to take it to the pool with my friends; or under the rain if I have to. I dropped it yesterday which is why I;m writing this review, it hit the pavement hard!  and the camera is still working perfectly. I've had it for 2 years now, I noticed the price has not change much since, I would not buy the package deal with the extra accessories; they are not of good quality.  BUT this camera sure is.

Reviews.Title: 3.5 - 4 stars
Reviews.Author: Gadgets & Gizmos
Reviews.Content: I pretty much got this camera as a 3rd camera for water trips since I was too cheap to buy an underwater housing for my s90 and 5dmkII. Picture quality wise it's never going to be as clear as the s90 and obviously no where near the 5d. I expected this. For a point a shoot, the camera does its job, although it really struggles in low light. Maybe I'm spoiled by my other camera's but I expected more especially for $300.Size wise this thing is a honker. Sized funnily so it doesn't fit well in your pocket and is heavy to boot. Had it not been for the fact that I have several batteries for my s90 which this camera can also use I would've probably gone to the underwater Panasonic TS-3.Overall durability of the camera is good. I think it's more geared for families with kids who go to the water park or to the beaches. toss the camera to your kids for some quick pictures, if they drop it in the water or the sand no worries.

Reviews.Title: Get Under and Above Water!!!!
Reviews.Author: Tester 90
Reviews.Content: To be honest I wouldn't expect any less...I looked at ALL the other cameras before buying this D10 and I am VERY please!!! If you wanna just put it in your pocket and go then I hope you don't wear tight clothes, but other than it being a bit bigger than the other cameras out there you have the best camera. The bigger the better, right?I have traved around the world with mine over the past 6 months and this includes Afghanistan where I am stationed right now and trust me when they say dust proof and water proof I pushed it to the limit of what they put on the box...they weren't kiddin around. I bought this camera for my older brother back in the states too, he has used it on jobs and out boating and it has been a great camera for him too. Its also very easy to use, trust me...if he can use it then its easy! hahaBasically you will regret not giving this D10 a try!

Reviews.Title: Camera turns itself off constantly
Reviews.Author: KayMarco "boston book lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these cameras about 10 months ago. When I have been able to take pictures with it I have had good quality results. However, less than 6 months after I bought it the battery - although fully charged (and I even have two so it probably isn't a battery issue) - keeps turning off the camera. Other times I will think it is off as I cannot see anything through the viewfinder but later I realize that it was taking pictures anyway. This was a lot of money given that I only got one full vacation with it operating properly and on the second it began to malfunction. I followed all directions for taking care of the camera so I believe that it's a fault with the camera but that's little consolation when a warranty is very brief. If you can get one with some kind of extended protection plan I would suggest considering that. I have owned many Canon products over the years and this camera was the first bad thing I got from Canon.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot guy
Reviews.Author: captainwireman
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera buff but I have found after the abuse and underwater treatment I have given to this camera it was exceptional in its performance. I am most impressed with the factory point and shoot technology. I dropped it, subjected it to hot water springs, abused the ### out of it and still the pics were nothing but perfect. I am a sailor and diver and this beauty worked for me. The only disadvantage I have is the bulkiness but I can put it in my pocket without the accessories and no one can tell what I have. Blow out the lens if you have it underwater for an above the water shot. I think you will be happy with this product. I only used the factory settings and my pics turned out great. Excellent technology.

Reviews.Title: If you can only have one digital camera, this is the one.
Reviews.Author: John J. Cheyney
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera specifically to take snorkeling on a vacation in the Bahamas.  After some research this clearly was the front runner.  Now I know why.  It works very well, is very easy to use, and lives up to it's billing.We took a number of pictures underwater, mostly snorkeling on the surface.  In pretty bright sunlight we were able to get good pictures of barracuda that were at 10 feet below us.  Color was at least as good as what you are actually seeing, especially if you use the Underwater color setting.  The controls are very easy to use and make reasonably intuitive sense.  Colors on reef fish and sponges are representative of real life.  At one point we went scuba diving in a cave and got it down to about 20 feet.  Pictures came out blurry but that wasn't the camera's fault.  We were trying to take pictures of a moving small shrimp.  One thing to keep in mind is that when you are snorkeling/swimming you are not being completely still while you are taking the pictures.Also, the camera takes great pictures out of the water.  I was very happy with the regular quality.  It has a good combination of automatic and manual modes that allow you to over/underexpose picutres, change the light settings, and it also has manual focus capability.One thing I like is that the connector for the strap is actually a button that can be locked onto anyone of the four corners of the camera.  This allows you to move it around to fit the situation.  I would highly recommend a floating strap.  We got the one from Olympus and it will float the camera.  It also makes it easier to find and gives you a sense of comfort that you won't lose it.Good:1.  The camera actually is waterproof, at least down to 30 feet.2.  Picture quality is very good, both in and out of water.3.  Good combination of manual and automatic modes.4.  Battery life appears good.  I was able to get at least two full days of picture taking out of one charge.  I never ran the battery all the way down so I don't know what total life is.Could be better:1.  I agree with the reviewer that threads for filters would be useful.  There are some filters designed for underwater photography to bring out color that would be nice to use.2.  Uses a propretary battery and charger.  Although the battery seems to last a long time you have to make sure you have the correct charger with you.  Not a huge deal unless you leave it.  Also means you can't run into the drug store for more batteries if you get low.3.  Screen sometimes difficult to see underwater.  This can be an issue if you are trying to get a picture of a specific moving fish.  If they are not really bright and easy to see you may have trouble getting them centered the way you like.4.  Because of the design of the housing (which is a little bulky) you may have to work to find a case that fits.Bad:1.  Nothing.All in all I am very happy with this camera and recommend it highly.  Even the things I would like to change are not really that big a deal.

Reviews.Title: Got pair of these for a toddler
Reviews.Author: D. R. Anderson
Reviews.Content: Super durable waterproof camera - cool deal. It's great for the tub or taking kids to park in the rain with it secured to their coat (to not get lost in a hole or something!). I haven't stress tested these things but they can take a lot more than kids' grubby fingers -- I'll tell you what.I decided to get a full metal jacket shockproof and waterproof camera for my young son for Christmas 2010. I got him a pair actually; one for him and one for whoever goes to the park etc. and because I wanted to play with them too without interfering with his use of Christmas present :). Experimental photography much?The screen's picture display quality is good and the captured images' quality is good with good color and depth similar to regular Powershot models in my experience. The movie mode works fine. The sound quality is not a high point but I do not count the overall product down for this, I think it is reasonably priced and that is a small concern at this price point versus durability and waterproof advantages.It reads HC SD cards so the movies can be nice and long, I got 8 GB cards due to being less than half the price of 16 GB when I purchased, and that is plenty long to avoid memory juggling issues while we are out on a few hours trip.The interface is simple like other Canons by the way. But it is also their best attempt to map their controls system onto simple, big buttons for the durability form factor so when you go back to your standard Powershot with its handy manual dials and switches you can flip and spin it's a little disorienting.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Krystal
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 8 months and it's been with me snorkeling in the Bahamas, backpacking in the White Mountains, kayaking on river rapids, and attached to my harness while rockclimbing as well as everyday stuff like birthday parties etc.  This is by far the best multi use camera I have ever owned.  I don't have to worry about it getting wet or when my 6 year old wants to take pictures with it and drops it by accident.  This camera has taken a beating and the picture quality is better than my Olympia anyday. The underwater pictures in the Bahamas came out amazing! Yes it's a little bulky but honestly it doesn't bother me a bit, I just use the strap around my wrist and who cares if it bumps up against something because it's shock proof! I've framed several pictures I took in the White Mountains because the clarity is unbelievable, who would have thought that out of an underwater camera. If you are an outdoor enthusiast or have children who like to play with your electronics when you aren't looking then this camera is for you!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Atreyu
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! We took it on our honey moon to Jamaica and I must say I am very glad we chose this camera over the others. It is very water proof, completely durable, takes great photos and has an awesome battery life. It is not easy to just stick in your pocket but all of it's work makes up for it. We love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Best waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: pradagirl
Reviews.Content: Other than the bulky look of this camera, it did it's job amazingly. Waterproof! you betcha!Really a good buy! After comparing several waterproof camera, and interviewing friendswho already have a different brand, this was the best choice. I'm really glad I boughtthis as a gift for my papi, and we really enjoyed our snorkling shots. Very clear!even on land.

Reviews.Title: Great small underwater camera!
Reviews.Author: Neil
Reviews.Content: Went to St John USVI and took the camera on several snorkeling trips and it took great pictures and video both above and below water!  Spare batteries need to be protected from salt water contact as just getting them wet will cause them to go bad and corrode.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, if you get a bullet-proof warranty
Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: No complaints on this camera overall. It performed as promised, until...Well first I should say it's an amazing thing. Seems bulky compared to the other point and shoots on the market, until you realize it has a built in underwater housing. It's a good Canon point & shoot that goes under the water. Neato.I took a couple of thousand pictures with mine on a snorkeling trip to Eleuthera.Then I came home and used it regularly for about three months.And it died.It suffered what is called a fatal lens error. It's not just the underwater cameras, all of these little digitals are vulnerable to fatal lens errors, it turns out: all models, all manufacturers. And there is no company, Canon included, that will step up and say "My bad" and replace your camera.I'm not happy about that, but as every other product I have gotten from the company has been stellar, including the AT-1 that I purchased in 1977 and still works, I'm not going to tell you to not buy Canon. I have, in fact, purchased another camera since.What I am telling you is that you should do what I did when I got my new Canon, buy it from a retailer that offers a warranty for an additional fee, one that allows you to replace a broken camera, no matter what, no questions asked.Because fatal lens errors are not that unsual, alas...

Reviews.Title: It does what it claims
Reviews.Author: Denis J. EVANS
Reviews.Content: This camera is the goods if you're into adventure photography.A couple of reviews have said it's not waterproof.  That is almost certainly due to the battery door or the comms door not being closed properly. If you pay attention to these details ... Guess what! It doesn't leak!If you leave the dOors open anything will leak!Denevans

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: camuser
Reviews.Content: Got this for our Hawaii trip last year. Initially I wanted to look for a waterproof casing for my canon point and shoot. But I couldnt get one for my camera's make/model. So finally ended up buying this. I am glad I did. The waterproofing works great. You just make sure you close the battery cover properly. I took it for snorkeling, snuba diving and it was fun. I also took photos when I was about 20-25 feet deep inside water. I could even operate the buttons underwater and switch modes and take pictures. The camera is quite sturdy. I once tied it to my wrist and was snorkeling around some rocks. The camera hit the rocks a couple of times due to the waves but nothing happened. I also let it swing by freely while playing in the beach sand. After my trip, I do have a few scratches on the body of the camera but the camera itself still works great.Now, after a year, this is my only camera and I use it all the time. Both in and out of water. I have got some great photos with this. The only down side is that it has only 3x optical zoom. The battery life is great. Video quality and audio is great too.Overall I highly recommend this camera to anyone looking to take photos or videos under water.

Reviews.Title: Definitely Waterproof
Reviews.Author: UGoOli
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little nervous to put this in water. We just got back from our honeymoon in Tahiti, Moorea and Bora Bora where we put it in all kinds of water and depths and it worked perfectly! We have great images of sharks and stingrays. There are so many types of scene selections such as Sunset, Beach, Landscape, Kids and Pets, Aquarium, Indoor, Night and Underwater. They helped a lot with the different areas we went to.  We even received a lot of compliments on the look of the camera itself. It's a great buy for the price and the quality of the photos.

Reviews.Title: Canon D10
Reviews.Author: J. Bertone
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. Pictures are vibrant. Underwater shots are excellent. There is a little lag time but overall the camera is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: kiwidagger
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for our cruise to take photos while in the water, snorkeling, etc.The picture quality if great. Beautiful color, resolution, you name it. The underwater setting does a fantastic job of correcting for the blue while free diving. If you don't change that it'll look like typical off color underwater shots so don't forget to switch back and forth. My only complaint about it is the fact that there isn't a quick change setting for underwater.Egonomically it's okay but not great. I wish Canon had designed it with some sort of a grip on the shutter button end. It's kinda like holding a potato.As for waterproofing. Never had an issue but after every outing it was soaked in tap water to remove the salt and dried off before any compartment was opened. One thing I made sure of though to ensure it didn't leak was to check the seals of any cover I opened up for sand, etc. If you don't check the seal on any underwater camera you chance leaks.Wholly recommend this camera as it's great for playing in the water with.

Reviews.Title: Great Underwater/Weatherproof Camera
Reviews.Author: brian neilson
Reviews.Content: The Good: I have put this camera to the test-surfing, snorkeling, free diving to 20-ft, packing it around daily in rainy wet conditions of Alaska, you name it and its held up great so far (about 1.5 yrs old).  Also I have been impressed with the video quality.  This is a great camera for what it is intended for.Complaints: It's not the most compact camera with the bulging lens, but probably the trade-off for durability.The image quality is not great when you use the zoom.  I try not to use zoom at all and just crop my photos when processing for close-ups.Overall-this is a great camera and I would argue the best compact point and shoot underwater camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for active people
Reviews.Author: Jessica L Riecker
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous camera. It's pictures are just as good if not better than any other digital camera. It takes amazing underwater pictures!  It goes to 33 feet, not just the 5 or 10 like other digitals. I love it. I plan on taking it snowbording this winter to try out it's freeze and shock components. The only thing I don't like is that it is a little bulky and not as compact as other digitals, but I'm sure that's due to the casing that protects it.

Reviews.Title: Good All-Around Rough Weather/Water-Proof Camera
Reviews.Author: OKRAY44
Reviews.Content: Good featured camera that functions well in rain/wet environments as well as being rated for moderate full immersion (snorkeling, etc.).  Very fast from turn on to being able to shoot.  Zoom and wide angle functions well, but buttons are a bit small.  My only criticism is that the display screen should have been slightly recessed (or protected by a small rim) to prevent scratches when the camera is rested on its back.  Mine became slightly scratched after a couple of days use.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Patina
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use right out of the box.  The pictures are good for the most part, but from time to time, you get a double exposure.  No particular pattern to the ocurrence.

Reviews.Title: The PERFECT Vacation Camera!
Reviews.Author: ellen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just before a trip to Disney World and it turned out to be just the right camera to take along! Part of me ordered this camera thinking the product test shots had to be too good to be true, as I was replacing a Nikon Coolpix P5100, which was marketed as a "pro-sumer" camera, a distinction this camera doesn't have.To a certain extent, it does lack the little niceties of a camera aimed at a more camera-savvy market, mainly a full manual (or at least aperture-priority) mode. It looks like something Spongebob probably owns, and the lens doesn't retract, making it non-pocketable. I'm worried about the reviews that say it leaks, although I haven't experience this yet (fingers crossed) after several dunks in the pool and sink. But if inducing paranoia counts as a con, add that to the list. A complaint I've heard from friends I've handed it off to, although not one that bothers me too much personally, is that the on/off and shoot buttons are too similar in size/shape/location and it's easy to accidentally hit the wrong one. Vibration-reduction doesn't work as well as it did on my old Nikon. I'm not overly fond of the included wrist strap (waay too long), but now I'm really scraping the bottom of the barrel for complaints.Overall, I'm really impressed with this camera. The "Auto" mode on this camera is a "smart auto," meaning it can switch automatically between modes, such as portrait or macro, without a single button-press. It's really amazing how often it gets it right! For control freaks or camera geeks, P mode allows control over ISO, white balance, color mode (neutral, vivid, b&w;, custom, etc.), metering, single/continuous shooting, image quality, and size, and, most importantly, remembers these settings when the camera is turned off and on again. For situations when you're not sure quite how best to set up the camera, there are a number of scene modes as well. Using this camera for vacation, I experienced some problems with overexposure in the bright Florida sun, but putting it in P mode and turning the exposure compensation down a bit worked quite well for this. The camera also offers manual focus, which is an exciting little feature if you're shooting a fairly stationary subject and the camera can't seem to get the focus right on its own. Very slow to fiddle with if you're trying to shoot anything less stationary.Highlights: water rides? no problem!, bumping against sinks and walls while keeping the camera permanently attached to my wrist? no problem!, nice colors, nice creative controls, GREAT battery life (one battery seems to last through about a day and a half of very intense vacation-photo-taking or almost two weeks of normal intermittent daily use), macro mode works better than any other compact digital i've used, and fireworks mode made me very proud at Epcot while balancing the camera on a monopod fashioned out of a parasol balanced on a fence-rail, and, of course, lots of fun in the pool!Would recommend to: anyone with kids, vacationers, anyone fond of water, anyone looking for a worry-free take-everywhere camera.Would not recommend: if manual controls or size matter. image quality is very good, but not as good as higher-end models. If waterproofness/shockproofness/freezeproofness aren't key features for you, I wouldn't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon D10...best waterproof camera!
Reviews.Author: Gatorboy92000
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife purchased this camera 2 years ago when it was released June and it is by far the best camera we have owned to date. The battery lasts for a whole weekend with underwater photos and video and it is crystal clear underwater pictures. The sound in the videos is amazing and the high resolution of the pictures makes you able to really zoom in pictures without affecting the picture clarity. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a durable waterproof camera and am still stunned that Canon is not marketing this camera more. Much thanks to Canon for designing a quality underwater camera with sweet looks.

Reviews.Title: Really Quality, Affordable Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Hong
Reviews.Content: I've been waiting 4 years to get a quality underwater camera and I've finally got it!  Before purchasing, I read the reviews on Amazon, both good and bad, researched underwater cameras on various websites and asked friends and family familiar with photography.  I own a Nikon D60 and a Sony DSC so I am very particular about image quality and getting the most for my money.  My sister had a canon that worked so well for a point-and-shoot so already this product interested me.  I was very skeptical and scared based on the bad reviews I read on Amazon about this camera, but I think those people are wrong.  I took this camera to Hawaii and dunked it in salt water and fresh water one after the other (we went snorkeling then went back to the hotel pool several times).  I had no problems at all; it even got banged up a couple of times considered you're trying to snorkel and take pictures.  Pictures came out very well.  If you're not going to use an underwater digital camera than for time, I wouldn't recommend getting this product, but if you plan on using this long-term, this is a great camera to get (my husband & I say it was worth every penny).  Camera has very big buttons and easy to use features.  Night pictures (or dimly light pictures) aren't as great as my other cameras, but you can't get everything in one, right?  Make sure to read/follow the instructions.  Happy picturing!

Reviews.Title: First Waterproof Camera Does Well in Belize
Reviews.Author: Jonathan R. Bar-on
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera mainly because we were going to Belize and wanted to take it with us snorkeling and cave exploring.  The camera did great and we now have a number of great underwater shots that we would otherwise have missed.  The camera is very durable - I didn't mind banging it up while cave exploring and it takes excellent pictures.  In my opinion, the one drawback is that it is not as flat as our other Cannon digital point and shoot cameras and is due to the lense which is not retractable.  Despite this, I think that the camera is worth getting if you need one that is `rough and tough' as well as waterproof.

Reviews.Title: good but not amazing pictures
Reviews.Author: bktw
Reviews.Content: I typically shoot with a DSL in RAW but also used to have a little Panasonic Lumix that recently died. Bought this camera for family trips that tend to include water activities (and hopefully it won't die anytime soon). Wish this camera had RAW.I shot over 700 pics on recent lake trip. What I found:- camera is waterproof- used on P (not Auto) mode almost exclusively - I set the ISO to lower amount as the higher ISO pictures (that Auto often chose to shoot in) aren't worth bothering with - they have a ton of grain and poor color. I also found I needed to use exposure compensation typically at around -2/3rd stop to get rich colored pictures and not have a ton of blown out highlights. I am not sure why Canon likes to have its shots overexposed but my DSL has same tendency. If I had been using camera right out of the box in Auto mode (as I did at home for a couple weeks before the trip) I would be very disappointed with the resultant pictures (as I was). In Auto mode too many end up grainy, poor color, etc.- macro - works pretty well although item has to be fairly near center of picture - couldn't necessarily get it to focus where I wanted it to focus.- did shoot underwater but lake was cloudy so can't comment on underwater setting color- isn't great for low light action but does great in bright light- using flash for fill (forced flash mode) on bright days was a bit of a disaster - the flash was so bright even at 7' or so away that pictures look unreal. Unless I can figure out a way to turn flash down I won't be able to use it for fill. It does seem to do a decent job in darker light settings as flash (or does what you expect a small camera flash to do but at least correctly exposes main/centered subject).- movies - what you'd expect- I did buy an extra battery (based on other reviews) but didn't end up needing it on any one day despite a fair amount of shooting and movie taking and reviewing pictures each day.Good camera for outdoor wet activities - and children who drop things. Spend a little time with the manual and camera and you will improve your shots immeasurably - camera CAN take good pictures but won't necessarily without a little help.The camera is "cute" and my kids love the way the hand strap can be put on any of the 4 corners. You can't use a neck strap without buying another custom corner thingie to hang it from. Clever of Canon. I like that the tightener on the handstrap can be used to open the tight latch on the battery compartment.

Reviews.Title: Making my friends and family jealous!
Reviews.Author: Magdalena A. Rios Metcalf
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas after drooling over it for a year or so.  The last time I had a point and shoot I was 16 and it had film in it.  I needed something to take where I didn't dare take my SLR but I wasn't willing to suffer in the picture quality department.  I've taken this camera everywhere.  I can give it to my students to take pictures with and not worry about them dropping it or spilling something on it (though I make sure they wear the wrist strap).  If I'd written this review just after Christmas it would have been positive but having used it extensively on vacation, in tide pools, on hikes and in the pool I'd very highly recommend it.  At first I was irritated by some of the auto settings (it tries to make each scene medium gray, as far as density/exposure).  However, when I played around with the Program mode I was able to adjust all of the little things that I was used to  having control over in my SLR, not as precisely but sufficiently for a point and shoot.  Figuring that out, I realized I could also use some of those things (exposure and white balance and manual focus among others) when shooting video.  I've had a great time shooting underwater video of minnows, trout, salamanders and friends.  The Macro feature is good but sometimes it rebels when the flowers wiggle in the breeze, I found placing my steady hand next to the flower and focusing on that works for a quick shot.  Otherwise I use the Manual Focus which lets you get pretty close, 2in away...  The pictures are of lovely quality, the auto white balance is good enough on most occasions.  However, as with any other camera I find it's best to choose a light situation for the camera otherwise it tries to make yellow sandstone white as if there were Tungsten light and that looks gross.  The underwater settings are great.  I've used them to create vivid color when the color isn't working in other situations too.  I was a color corrector at a big photography lab for years and I know that color can make or break a shot.  I also know it's better to not have to make too many changes after the fact.  I've been pleased with the accuracy of color and density and can often send pictures to print with no color correction requested.  Something I don't dare to do with my SLR.  On the other hand, I was recently taking a picture of a purple delphinium and everything was a fine color except the flower which the camera insisted on making a weird sapphire blue that it invented.  The camera is a little heavy for a cocktail purse or most ladies clothing pockets but otherwise it's fine.  The zoom is good but definitely only in comparison to point and shoot cameras.  I wouldn't take this on a bird watching trip as a substitute for an SLR camera though it does do better than other point and shoots in this department.  It takes a nice landscape though not as wide angle as I'm used to with my SLR.  It also takes lovely arm-out self-portraits.  The self-timer is fun to play with, you can set the custom timer for a 1-30 second delay and have it take 1-10 shots.  It's perfect for a silly picture series, family portrait, you riding your horse over a jump... all sorts of things.  It also takes good pretty dark shots, if you hold steady it can usually do a good job for you.  The 3200 setting helps, but it isn't usually necessary.  It's a great tool and the more I play with it the more I discover.  The pictures I've taken impress my family and friends because it's an awesome camera I've learned to use well.  They're all jealous I can drop, submerge, nearly freeze my camera, hand it to cookie dough covered second graders and then wash it off with a little soap and water.  Good to go again.  A couple of friends who are in the market for a new camera are seriously considering it.  You're going to like this camera and you won't regret having bought it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Harvey Kliman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our summer vacation in the US Virgin Islands. Besides our masks and fins, this was the most important item on the trip. Everyone wanted to use it. And we had so much fun taking pictures underwater, above water and around the water. The pictures were fantastic and the videos wonderful. I made a series of slide shows and movies from all the clips that really has memorialized our vacation.

Reviews.Title: Love It So Far
Reviews.Author: Jimfish12
Reviews.Content: Got the camera a few months ago. So far, I've used it out of water, in pool water, and in saltwater. Haven't had any problems and the resolution is excellent. Easy to understand, and easy to use.I've taken videos and photos with it. Both with great results. I realize it's not a super high-end camera, but for my fishing, snorkeling, and everyday usage, it's an excellent camera for the application.I also bought a floating camera strap and camera case at the same time as the camera. I highly recommend going ahead and purchasing those items - not much more money and you have then have everything you need for any potential usage for the camera.Finally, I had a SeaLife 35mm film camera for years and was never satisfied with the quality. The first underwater shots with the D10 greatly exceeded the quality of the SeaLife and my own expectations.

Reviews.Title: battery runs out quick and super bulky
Reviews.Author: Hector A.
Reviews.Content: get the pentax way way better this cam is huge compared to other underwaters but pics are really great

Reviews.Title: Great all-around rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Jason H.
Reviews.Content: Great camera for an active lifestyle - swimming, kayaking, hiking, boating, etc.  Rugged and completely waterproof, takes great shots underwater and in most settings.  A bit bulky, and I'm worried that the lens will get scratched (although so far there have been no issues).  Would love to see how this handles in Caribbean waters that are very clear (so far i have mostly used in darker lakes). Great battery life as well.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the quality of pictures
Reviews.Author: C L
Reviews.Content: My wedding photographer partner recommended this camera for taking to the beach and pool.  I have been more than satisfied with this camera!  I have Canon 5D Mark II and lots of L lenses, but I never want to take them to the beach and I'm not serious enough about water photography to buy water housing.This was perfect for my family shots in Hawaii and when we jump in the pool.  The pictures and video you can get on a sunny day are amazing, but when it is cloudy, shots will look muddy and not so good.  I use the "P" mode and force the flash for best results.  Also it gets hard to hold steady for video when snorkeling.Easy to use, my wife who doesn't like electronics, has no problem with it.My only criticisms are the size (much bulkier than other point and shoots) and that it doesn't shoot in RAW mode.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Shutter Speed!
Reviews.Author: Patee333
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back in Oct. 2009 and just barely got around to using it because I had another camera.  I finally pulled it out for use during a pool party.  The shutter speed is sooooo fast, it made me want to cry almost.  I could get action shots of people driving and the water splashing, and everything was caught perfectly without any action blurs.And water splashed onto the camera with no problems either.  I was tempted to just submerge the camera too but never got around to it.  This camera is awesome!!!  I will update my review once I use it more and use more of the features too.

Reviews.Title: Terrific for Sand Storms, too!!
Reviews.Author: R. Arnott "film luvvr"
Reviews.Content: I know this is sold as a waterproof camera.  But, that's the tip of the proverbial iceburg.  We were in the Atacama desert, in a terrific sand storm.  In about ten seconds our G11 was grinding (literally) to a stop.  This doesn't affect my view of the G11 ... a hurricane-force sandstorm is a bad environment for most any camera.  But, the D10 was perfectly happy.  We can get it wet, we can get it filthy.  Just run it under the tap when we're done!  It's become our new all-purpose pocket camera.  We *love* it!!!

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof for long
Reviews.Author: T. Ingalls
Reviews.Content: Since I live in Hawaii, I bought this camera for its underwater feature. I had purchased a Fujifilm underwater camera the week before and it broke within 30 minutes. I consider Canon a great company with quality products so I decided I should just bite the bullet and get the Canon D10 instead.I used it underwater about 5 times shooting photos and video. They all turned out wonderfully and are great quality. It was easy to switch back and forth from picture to video, from underwater to beach mode.However, yesterday I took it to my favorite snorkeling spot and used it for about an hour. Afterward, in the car I wiped the lens down (I didn't want water droplets on my photos for the rest of the day). Then I tried to turn it on and I got this message "Lens error. Restart camera." Every time I start the camera I get this message and can't go any further. There may be water under the lens (it looked like a little seeped through but it was hard to tell).In other words, the camera is broken. It worked at the beach for awhile, but I've only owned it for one month. Should last a lot longer than that for the price and because it is Canon. It is unfortunate because I really loved the quality and features up to that point.The next step is to contact Canon about repair options....

Reviews.Title: Good package for the price
Reviews.Author: TomK1 "tomk1"
Reviews.Content: This camera is basically one of Canon's typical point and shoots wrapped up in a waterproof shell.  It's an attractive camera, and while it's not tiny, it's hardly the huge camera some have implied.  Basically the nose of the camera is bulbous which makes it appear larger than it is.  The benefit is that the design eliminates the need for the lens to telescope into the body when not in use.  I don't think anyone will have an issue with size or shape.  And if you're familiar with Canon's "operating system" on their point and shoot cameras, you'll be at home.Picture quality is excellent as you'd expect, and the movie quality really is excellent, although it is limited by the 640x480 resolution, but this works pretty well in the water; as a stand-alone video camera, I would consider it lacking.I used it for a week in the water constantly in the Florida Keys.  I had no issue with water proofing, although the battery door should be examined every time because it is possible for the door to be closed, but not sealed.  I always checked it before I jumped in.I recommend that Zeikos ZE-FS10-OR Floating Strap that Amazon sells, It ties to the camera, and it will make the camera float.  If you lose it, it bobs right to the surface.  If you use this strap, you won't lose the camera in the water.Overall, for the price, it's a great camera, however, there are several significant flaws that you should be aware of:1) The view screen is coated so it is visible in water, however, it scratches *very easily*.  My first camera had a scratch out of the box (returned) and the 2nd got a scratch simply by placing it face down on a kitchen table.  Wow.  By contrast, I've had a panasonic camera in my pocket and tossed around for the better part of a year with no scratches.2) The mounting system is very well designed.  Unfortunately, Canon as far as I can tell, will not sell you the mounting clips.  Instead, you need to buy Canon AKT-DC1 Accessory kit, which has 3 or 4 mounting straps and new colored fronts.  If you're using this for snorkeling or scuba, you need this kit.  It's a great kit, but it's over $100.  Figure this into the purchase price of the camera.3) There are two ergonomic faults with the camera.  First, the 2.5" display is too small to effectively use it when you're in a diving mask.  Maybe your eyes are better than mine, but it's hard to see the display to capture small details.  More significantly, there is no dedicated movie button.  You actually have to change modes by pressing a mode switch, and then using the cursor button to select movie versus program or auto mode.  This is a really big hassle and is the biggest flaw with the camera.4) Battery life could be better.  If you're going out, buy a 2nd battery at least.Overall though, I really liked the camera.  It's the best value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for use in the water.  It takes great underwater shots and it durable enough to take on the jetski.  We do take precautions to ensure the camera doesn't get banged around.  We are quite pleased with the picture quality, video and audio capabilities.  A great camera at a good price.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera
Reviews.Author: fiamma5585
Reviews.Content: well perfect camera for out door activities and also cayak snorkling...excellant battery conditionsthe only problem I get with is that from time to time there is a lense error message

Reviews.Title: PERFECT for my Hawaiian vacation!
Reviews.Author: Aurora
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera so I could take more pictures while on vacation in Hawaii, since I always seem to be at the beach in the water. I was not disappointed! This camera worked perfectly on all my snorkeling trips, and worked great out of water too! It was a great relief to just not have to worry about getting the camera wet while kayaking, or just walking around with all those sudden rainstorms.Thanks to this camera, I got a TON of great pics of my vacation, while everyone else with me had their cameras hidden away for safekeeping...now they all need copies of my pics!! If you spend a lot of time around water, get this camera!

Reviews.Title: Lens Error after 3 months
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and has been used at a baby shower, the zoo, the pool, camping, on the lake, around the house, and at the hospital when we had our 3rd child recently.  NO COMPLAINTS until....the dreaded "lens error" struck 1 week before our FL vacation...which was the main reason for our purchase of a waterproof camera.  Called Canon and they seem to be working with us, of course they knew right away about the lens error.  We tried the restart, and the restart after battery removal/reinsertion but to no avail, still have the lens error message.  I was extremely disappointed and aggravated as this caused me to miss a ton of pics I planned to take today.  Canon claims their remedy for this error is to just send out a new camera, and have told us they'll send it to our condo in FL...we'll see if they follow through.This camera takes great pics, and is easy to use, BUT for a product that is marketed for it's durability I'd expect it to actually BE durable...and not have a fatal flaw at 3 months.

Reviews.Title: Best Family Fun Camera
Reviews.Author: Christine M. May "HappyMama"
Reviews.Content: Pros:  It's small, lightweight, waterproof, does both photo & video, easy to use (easy enough for my grandma even), and has good picture quality.  What more could I want!Cons:  I doesn't have a very wide angle, but I knew that going into the purchase.  And it did a this weird thing that if I was in video mode and zoomed in during videoing, it wouldn't focus on the subjects.  I'm not positive, but I don't think that's normal.  I have a regular Canon Powershot 800is (had it now for a few years) and I've never noticed it not keep the focus while zooming in and out during video mode.  It was minor irritation, but I thought I should mention it.I am a professional wedding photographer and am a big fan of Canon products.  It is hard for me not to take my big, fat professional cameras with me where ever I go, but when I'm playing around with my kiddos and need something small, lightweight, and not as expensive (in case it gets stolen), the Canon powershot camera line is awesome.  So when I decided to get a digital waterproof last minute before a family vacation, it was kind of a no-brainer.A friend of mine has a cute little, Panosonic digital waterproof camera (bought it almost a year ago) and he loves it.  I've seen his images from that camera and they are very good...so I was tempted to go with his recommendation, but being as I already have quite the Canon collection, I know they make good, solid, easy to use products, I decided on this one.  Glad I did.  I've only owned it for one month but it's already been on two vacations (I lent it to a friend going to Hawaii, plus our family vacation in Alabama) and is currently on a third one (lent it to my sister-in-law on her Mexico honeymoon).  So far so good.  I don't think anyone has taken it past 6 feet, so I don't know how well it does deeper and such.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: i don't usually write reviews but i'm so impressed with this camera i just had to this time. i looked long and hard to find the best for the money and couldn't have done better at any price. this thing takes great pics and the video is just as good. the clarity of even the bubbles underwater are perfect. as to it's size... i've carried it all day in my pocket of my jean shorts and never new it was there and the rounded shape just makes it easier yet to get in and outof my pocket. i don't know of anything else i could ask of a waterproof camera. great job Canon, thank you...

Reviews.Title: Great take-along camera for the beach!
Reviews.Author: Eric Liebman
Reviews.Content: Great camera.. we purchased this to replace a Sony T-series camera. Shoots great pictures..  underwater pictures and video are great!  You have to photoshop them a bit to get the blue hue out of the shot - something Canon should have built into the camera as an "Underwater" setting or somthing like that..  But, the 12megapixel resolution is great..  particularly the widescreen format.The camera is a but funky...  bulbous design doesn't lend itself to just putting in your pocket like the Nikon Coolpix, Panasonic Lumix or even the Sony T-series cameras.. however, it is light and totes along just fine in a small handbag or tote bag.Shutter lag is pretty standard.. around 1+ seconds.. so you can't really take any candid shots as typically your subject is a blur exiting the shot right or left!  As I own a Nikon D300s prosumer cam, this isnt a problem for us but something to keep in mind if you want to use this as your 'all-around' camera.What the Canon D10 really excels in is being taken on holiday to shoot in the mountains, near the water or any other extreme condition shooting. It is really tough and stands up to being thrown around.  We used it in the ocean with no problem... salt water doesn't bother it at all.The settings are a bit confusing..  coming from a Sony where most of the features and settings are quite obvious and intuitive, this camera presented a challenge to navigate the settings.  For example, we changed the setting to the Widescreen shooting format, but then none of us could figure out how to get it back to normal.  We eventually had to do a 'reset' to get it back.All around, we love the quality of the pictures and of course the underwater feature.  This is a great 2nd camera for those who take a lot of holidays like this and don't want to lug around a big DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Better Idea for (Floating) Neck Strap
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Kalash
Reviews.Content: Just a quick tip for anyone who's recently bought a Canon Powershot D10 underwater camera (or one with similar pinhole-variety strap mounts), and doesn't want to shell over the $100+ for their accessory kit (or, if you phone them, I think $70 for just the neck strap and the [pointless] shoulder strap). Do this:(1) Phone Canon and order 2 additional strap mounts (the camera will have already come with 1, for the included wrist strap).(2) Order Nikon's floating neck strap: http://www.amazon.com/Nikon-Marine-Grade-Floating-Neckstrap/dp/B000075BCZ(3) Go to anyplace that sells fishing gear (I went to Sports Chalet), and buy split rings (what's that?: http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/419Qo145ivL._SL160_.jpg). Size 9 probably works best; get the closest to that that you can. You could, of course, just pull a couple of these off your key rings, but I'm thinking/hoping that the ones made for fishing won't rust as easily, and I know that they're stronger. But don't get much stronger than 40 lbs test -- get much stronger and you won't be able to work with it.(4) Use the split rings to permanently attach the Canon strap mounts to the ends of the Nikon neck strap; that's 2 split rings, 2 strap mounts, and 2 ends of the 1 neck strap.Tools I needed were: my fingernail (to start to pry apart the split ring), a flathead screwdriver (to finish prying it apart and then hold it like that for a moment while I slid on the strap mount), and a counter-mounted vice (I stood there in the bicycle repair dept at Sports Chalet and used theirs!...they didn't mind a bit; the vice gave me the steady extra hand I needed to hold the split ring in place while I pried it apart and slid on the strap mount). To get the split ring (which will be securely on the strap mount now!) on the end of the neck strap, you can just disassemble and then reassemble the strap's buckling; you'll see what I mean when you go to do it.Now you have a strap that will allow you to keep your camera handier than it would be in any other place while you're paddling, and allow you to film your shenanigans (the Canon D10, at least, has that function) while your hands are left free for paddling. Unlike the non-floating Canon neck strap, it will keep your camera from sinking like a rock into the inky depths after that breaking surge demolishes you out of nowhere. It will look cool. You will have made it yourself, sort of. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Underwater in the Abacos
Reviews.Author: John O. Lafferty Jr.
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera to use on sailing trip to Abacos for snorkeling and on beach/in dinghy and other places I did not want to take my digital slr.Lived up to expectations.  Easy to use.  Ability to brighten made underwater use much easier.  Photos are spectatular.

Reviews.Title: D 10
Reviews.Author: R. P. Jaffe
Reviews.Content: The D 10 deserves a 10 on a scale of 10.  Superb ease handling. Great shots and waterproof, for sure. Took it to 20 ft. and no issues.

Reviews.Title: Great, Relatively Inexpensive, Turns on Fast, No Lens Cover
Reviews.Author: J. Tucker
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It turns on nearly immediately and takes pictures quickly. I've used it underwater while snorkeling, and have taken it about 20ft deep with no problems. Underwater pictures totally blow away disposable cameras. Not tough to use, although other programs are better to unload pictures than the one Canon provides.If you're moving a lot while taking pictures, they can come out blurry.The reason this isn't a five star review is because there is simply a glass protective cover over the lens, and it's really easy to smudge. I dread the day it gets scratched.

Reviews.Title: Worried about flooding, READ THIS !!!! Canon PowerShot D10 ... A superb underwater camera !!!
Reviews.Author: D. Martinez "David"
Reviews.Content: I have to talk about my Canon PowerShot D10. Almost a year old and I'm still very impressed. During a current trip to Maui I took quite few shots at a depth of 52 feet with my D10 (see why below); it is rated for 33 feet max depth. It was not my intention to beta test this camera but I was free dive turtle chasing to get the perfect shot. Depth was ranged by boat radar in a very well known area of 5caves/5graves, I asked the boat captain after coming back on board once I realized I went very deep. After reading about many flooded D10's leaking from the AV door, I sealed mine with silicone glue shortly after my purchase. The battery / SD card door was never implicated in the flooding. After a year of hearty use I am happy to report my beloved D10 is solid and dry. I dive without worries!!! I'm very confident in getting the best shots I can with it when I can't take the DSLR due to conditions. I have taken it to the ocean depths, boarding the highest mountain slopes of Tahoe and everywhere in between. The Canon PowerShot D10 is absolutely phenomenal; I just can't say enough good things about it. Above and below water it is a superb PS camera.  Great image quality!!! Also my flickr page, [...]All of these Amazon uploaded underwater shots are from this guy ... I highly recommend it !!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!! Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: Sam Johnson
Reviews.Content: After much research, I bought this camera for my girlfriend, and we took it to Mexico to do some snorkeling in the ocean.  We couldnt be happier with its performance.  The quality of the pictures and videos are outstanding.  The manufacturer has thought out every aspect of coordinating swimming with picture taking.  The strap location is movable to any of the 4 corners, also the strap will lock around your wrist so it doesnt slide off your wrist while swimming.  The location and size of the buttons are set up for ease of use underwater.  I checked out other underwater cameras in this price range, and this one blew away the competition.  The most amazing thing tho, is the quality of the pictures, not just underwater, but regular picture taking.  Most of our evening/low light pictures require no flash, and come out looking like its daylight!  We are both extremely pleased with this camera, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: D10, not fully tested yet
Reviews.Author: George F. Benedict
Reviews.Content: Got this to replace a Canon SD700 + waterproof case (Aqua Case 6810). In normal dry use the D10 is a little bulkier, but not objectionably so. Seems waterproof so far (immerseda few inches in a creek). Will test in the Keys in May. Picture quality seems better than the SD700. Happy so far.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, shipping problem
Reviews.Author: PJP "Deemon"
Reviews.Content: The camera is pretty much what I expected tho' I haven't really had a chance to play with it much and have not had it near the water yet. It is a bit more complicated than expected and not very intuitive (at least to me!) but with all of its features, that's okay.My only problem was the shipping. I paid the extra money for expedited shipping as I needed it for a certain date but it was shipped ground anyway. The company, Electronics Expo, was very nice about refunding the difference but it didn't change the fact that I didn't have the camera on-time.

Reviews.Title: Great preset features
Reviews.Author: J. Lewis
Reviews.Content: All the preset features are amazing!  We have used this camera up on the mountain sking several times.  The preset "snow" shooting feature works great.  I've used automatic in the snow also and the pictures turn out great, when I switch to "snow" shooting mode it's even better!  This is a great camera for an active family.  The buttons are good size and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Canon D10 Review
Reviews.Author: L. Erlandson
Reviews.Content: I'm definitely only a recreational photographer, but the Canon D10 works wonderfully for it's intended purpose.  Underwater photos and video are easy and clear with the Underwater mode; I was amazed at how well the photos turn out.  Lots of other preprogrammed scenes make the camera easy to use for an array of different shots in and out of water.  It also seems to have adequate manual controls for the more serious photographer.  The included wrist strap works fine, as opposed to some reviewers' comments.  It is a little thick with the fixed lens, and it could use a lens cap of some sort.  Overall very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: everything works awesome-ly!!!
Reviews.Author: Farzaneh Firoozabadi "sherryershadi"
Reviews.Content: before i bought mine, i was soooo nervous because everyone was like water leaks in, well i put it to the test 6 times and NO IT DOESN'T!!!! if you make sure that every compartment is closed nothing will happen , trust me! i must admit everything is awesome, but i hope they have made it with better zoom. it has 3x optical zoom and 12x digital zoom, which of course gets grainy, but that's expected. overall im so happy i got it.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Victoria Solla
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back when it was new because I wanted a waterproof camera since I am into whitewater sports. I will say I have had no problem what so ever with the waterproofness of the camera. Went down some big rivers in Maine just sitting in the front taking pictures and the camera was perfectly fine. On another river even went swimming with it in a hole (recirculating water) which are really good at finding leaks in plenty of things but my camera was still good to go. Another nice feature is the movable wrist strap for the camera. It is nice to be able to tie it to whatever for a trip down the river and just adjust where the strap is attached to be able to take pictures without taking the camera off.The only bad thing I have encountered is that when water is on the lens it can blur your pictures or if there is fog on it it will do the same thing. This could be easily fixed though with a proper cloth to take the moisture off the cloth. That is my only complaint about this camera though.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: D. Olon
Reviews.Content: Great product. Don't drop it. I dropped mine out of my pocket and it broke. Sent it right back and got a new one. Amazon was great to work with. Great photos. Little hard to hold but over all it is a great camera. Much better then the Olympus waterproof cameras, the pic qualities is way better.

Reviews.Title: Handy Cam
Reviews.Author: R. Taylor
Reviews.Content: Nice little travel camera, but a bit bulkier than most. Still, for outdoorsy shooting it's a great camera.  I took it snow skiing, and had no concern about dropping it in the snow or taking pics during a heavy snowfall.  And it takes really good quality pictures.  Battery lasted a lot longer than I expected, and could go two days easy without having to recharge.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: N. Yazvenko
Reviews.Content: I borrowed this camera from a friend for my trip to Hawaii. It was easy to operate, and took great underwater pictures even when I forgot to turn on the underwater mode.I think that it's weight is irrelevant, as with a strap it floats in water.I liked it's shape, it was easy to hold.It's battery lasted more than three hours of continuous picture taking without flash. Flash did deplete it fairly fast.It survived several 2-3 feet drops.It survived a 20 feet free dive in the water, which is impressive.What amazed me about this camera is Canon's image stabilization. Even with waves' bobbing action and fishes moving rather quickly, most images managed to come out crisp and colorful. It also managed to focus on the moving fish, rather than the background most of the time. I also noticed that I got better pictures by getting very close to the object rather than zooming, because of inherent limitations of underwater photography.I never experienced any leakage, but then every time I opened any of the seals I did it after rinsing the camera in fresh water, wiping it dry, and putting it in front of a fan for an hour to dry.I'll have to buy it for myself.

Reviews.Title: Worked perfectly
Reviews.Author: Ian W. Ellis
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a snorkel trip to Virgin Islands.  It worked perfectly.  It was in and out of the water probably 15 times over a four day period.  I'm guessing as deep as 20 feet.  Took over 600 picks and seven videos.  Very happy with the optics.  I suggest that when you open a sealed door, open it so that gravity will pull water droplets away from the camera.  Once I opened the battery door and there were a few water drops around the seal.  I dried it off and when I closed the door, I was sure there was no debris on the seals.  I would press the door firmly and then slide the lock closed.  I could see by the door designs that it may be possible to not completely lock the doors.

Reviews.Title: Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: BE
Reviews.Content: So far the pictures are great...there has been a few issues with the camera locking up when trying to zoom.  The system calls to turn off the camera and reset...which doesn't work.  If you leave it on and hit the side with your hand a few times that corrects the problem...Read the manual especially the options section.  There are soooo many options on this camera it it pays to read the manual otherwise you will miss something that would really enhance your pictures.I haven't tired the camera underwater yet but I will and when I do...if I can make an addendum to the review I will.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot D10
Reviews.Author: M. Lisowski
Reviews.Content: This is the second Canon camera that I own (the other is a model A630).  This was purchased for the waterproof feature.  This is an excellent product (takes great pictures, is truly waterproof, easy to use, etc.).  The only issue that I have with this product (as well as the A630) is trying to take action shots.  Regardless of what setting is used, there is always an inconsistent delay (from 1 to 4 seconds) between when the button is pressed & when the shutter opens.  Trying to capture an action shot at a precise moment is impossible.

Reviews.Title: poor focus
Reviews.Author: Michael G. Labrie
Reviews.Content: Not at all happy with the focus quality and the resulting sharpness of the images.  very frustrated trying to figure out how to do away with all the automatic exposure settings so that I can actually take a picture the way I want to.  A good camera for an ameteur.Canon PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD

Reviews.Title: best camera ever had
Reviews.Author: wren "wren"
Reviews.Content: This camera is for sure the best one we've ever owned. We have two small children who LOVE to take pictures and we have no worries with the strap they can adjust around their little wrists. They've even dropped it already (which is what busted our other camera) and there was no problem or disfunction to the camera. Underwater photos are incredible and there is no compromise with out-of-water shots either. We did a lot of research and heard this was the best one underwater camera around. Now we believe it. Definitely worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: J. Kenley
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my son in law and he is very happy with it!  We were surprised at the quality of photos and it seems to work really well as far as being in and around water.

Reviews.Title: Great little second camera
Reviews.Author: Michelle "Miche"
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon 5000 and while it's an incredible camera, it's getting old.  And I really wanted something more durable for some of the picture taking that I do.  I was just in the Virgin Islands/West Indies and this camera was exactly what I needed.  I used it everywhere without worry.  Including under the water.Since I live in a cold weather area I can us it outside in the winter without worry as well.  Camping, hiking, ice fishing; it just does it all.

Reviews.Title: great travel camera
Reviews.Author: W. Sharma-Crawford "Traveler"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a vacation to Jamaica. It worked great. Great pics underwater, great video in the water park. It performed as expected.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING CAMERA
Reviews.Author: A. Brown
