Reviews.Content: This is an AMAZING camera! Easy to use, waterproof and shockproof (exactly as all the reviews say), with BEAUTIFUL picture quality! It is not too bulky for a purse, only for a clutch, and it takes AMAZING pictures and videos. I would recommend this camera to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Greatest little camera...ever
Reviews.Author: A. Lee
Reviews.Content: i recently purchased the canon d10 to do underwater pictures in grand cayman.  i have always been a nikon loyalist, but after reading all the reviews about the d10, i had to give it a try.  not only does it take great underwater pictures and video, but it also takes excellent land shots.  it is extremely easy to go between the different scene modes to fit the shot and the scene modes definitely help the shots.  i actually took my nikon dslr on the trip to take the land shots, but the d10 was working so well...i didn't want to sacrifice the convenience of the point and shoot since we were on the move.  one caution:  test drive the camera in the sink or bathtub before you take it on a trip to use for the underwater feature.  on my dive boat, several folks had the d10 and it leaked the first time in the water so their whole vacation was lost for pictures.  however, mine and several more people didn't have any issues with leakage and we all agreed it is the "greatest little camera...ever"

Reviews.Title: Worth it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Princess"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a cruise I was taking.  When I got the camera, I took several shots, inside and outside and the quality of the pictures were great.  Then I dunked it in a sink full of water, took a few shots and then took the camera out and THANKFULLY it still worked!  I was more worried about dunking it than I thought I would be, but I wanted to make sure it was waterproof before my cruise.  It was.  The camera still took great pictures afterward.  I love the color selection function, can't remember exactly what the function is called, but it is where you can select a color and the camera will only highlight in that color, making everything else in black and white - really neat function.  The video records great. And the battery life held up way longer than I thought it would have.  It takes great pictures in dark rooms/settings, bright light settings, inside, outside, where ever.  I would say this camera is definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: So happy I bought this camera
Reviews.Author: hello3030 "pants"
Reviews.Content: I am so happy that I decided to buy this camera! The picture quality is great.I love how durable it is. Even though I travel with it in a case, I no longer am worried about piling it in my backpack with a ton of other stuff when I'm going out to the beach or something.  You can drop this in the sand without it damaging any mechanically moving parts.This camera is really great about battery use.  When you set it on automatic mode, it takes really great photos, and usually there is no need for the flash to fire! In an environment where any other camera might fire the flash, Canon D10 seems to be smarter than the rest as it can take the same picture with no flash and produce a crisp image with true color - even in low light.Underwater, this camera is fantastic! At first, I was a little bit nervous to bring it underwater after reading on this website the reviews about the camera not working after the first underwater use. However, my experience with using this as an underwater camera has been perfect.  Underwater mode seems to empathize the colors of certain areas so details on fish, coral and other underwater life are beautifully captured. The compartments that you can open seem sturdy enough, but just in case I always check before entering the water that they are closed completely and that there is no sand in the cracks.This camera uses an anti red eye flash but in some photos, there you can still see a small amount of red in the eye.  Forget about using the red eye remover feature that this camera has, because it will just put a big dark circle that is larger than the eye in the image.Compared to the other user images taken with underwater point and shoot cameras, this one is superior. Also, I had a disposable underwater camera and those pictures came out awful!  Weather you scuba/snorkel regularly, or are like me and just bought it for this one trip - I 100% suggest it to you!

Reviews.Title: Great all-around camera
Reviews.Author: Carl Cole "ccole1215"
Reviews.Content: If the camera had a completely manual mode, it would be perfect.  Still, the program mode gives a lot of flexibility and it takes great pictures in just about every setting.  This is truly an amazing camera for the price!  I took the camera on vacation and it performed well both in and out of the water.  The dry-land pictures were as good as any other point-and-shoot camera that we have owned (Nikon, Olympus, and Canon).  Others have complained that the camera is bulky but it fits in a jacket pocket easily.  I bought a floating strap for it but really didn't need it; the supplied strap cinches down to tightly fit around your wrist.  We used it snorkeling in this fashion and had no problems.  The Olympus version is smaller but it costs $100 more.  With the date stamp feature, I can also use it for outdoor work documentation without worrying about weather condition.  If you only want one camera to do everything, this is the one!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Option
Reviews.Author: Sergio Weiser
Reviews.Content: I needed a waterproof camera. Afraid of buying just the case for my older camera, I bought this one after reading the reviews.It was an excellent purchase. It has been working just fine under the water and specially outside the water.Does it have some inconveniences? Yes. There is no action mode, the camera is a bit large to put inside the pocket, and there is no cover for the lens.Apart from those, excellent camera.

Reviews.Title: Best pre-trip purchase EVER!
Reviews.Author: Bryan Kennedy
Reviews.Content: We're SO glad we bought this camera prior to our trip to Fiji. It was so fun to play around with, has an amazing lens capable of depth of field shots, takes some great underwater photos, and includes lots of features I would never have expected in such a compact camera (like manual focus and spot color). It's also really good at detecting faces - it even detected the face of the woman on the Fijian dollar!We loved it!

Reviews.Title: surpassed expectations
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Weiner
Reviews.Content: Just returned from trip to st marteen and anguilla. We do a lot of snorkeling and was most excited to try out the camera.  The D 10 worked great in the water. It took a while to figure out how to focus under water. But want I got used to the camera, I got great pictures. The picture quality was very good.  I was able to take nice pictures in varying lighting conditions. Simply, I used the underwater program and used the zoom. It is best to be in front or the side of the fish or coral. One should avoid shooting down. The view finder is very clean and true. The camera is very easy to hold and use. It is easy to hold and still use your arms for swimming. I was very pleased with the picture quality outside of the water. The picture quality is better than by small point and shoot camera. I did not expect the quality to be as good as by Canon T1i SLR, but I would not take this camera to the beach or near water.  I was very impressed with the video. Overall, this camera is a great product and good value.  I did buy a non canon battery for far less than the canon product and it worked fine.  I did buy the camera, the battery and flash card from Amazon.  As always been my experience, I got good prices and my items were send and received in a short time frame. The canon d 10 and amazon are highly recommeded

Reviews.Title: Trip to the Islands
Reviews.Author: N. Clark
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a trip, it was fantastic.  Got awesome pictures of sea-turtles while snorkling.  Very good pictures of wife on the beach.  Good all around camera.  The lanyards is a little funky because you can move it around, but it actually comes in VERY handy.  Since you probably want to strap it to something, like your wrist or life vest, and you can move the lanyard so it doesn't get in the way.  All around a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this camera
Reviews.Author: Robin "frfall"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I was going on a cruise and wanted to be able to take underwater pictures on some of my excursions. I am very pleased with the results that I got. Overall, the camera performed well. However, I am glad that I took another camera with me as well. Compared to my Nikon cameras this one does not have optics that are as good. While most of the pictures that I took are good, they are not up to the quality of the images I get from either my Nikon digital SLR or even my Coolpix. Unfortunately, Nikon doesn't do underwater cameras and I'm not willing to trust my expensive camera to a plastic housing that might leak.If you are looking for a good point and shoot that is waterproof I highly recommend this camera. Being able to shoot video underwater is a wonderful bonus. A few suggestions:1. Purchase an extra battery.2. The accessory kit for this camera is worth every penny.3. I was surprised that this camera did not come with a flash card, every other one I've ever purchased did. When shopping for flash cards get one that is rated C6 (class/speed rating), everything else will be WAY to SLOW for shooting unless you are only taking pictures of stationary objects.One other issue is with the microphone on the front of the camera: when shooting video in breezy conditions I found that, upon playback, you get really bad wind sounds -- you'd think I'd been in a hurricane. However, if you keep your finger in front of the tiny microphone to block the breeze it helps.Many people have commented about the size and shape of the camera. Not sure what their issue is, I had no problems with it. If you want something the size of a credit card, look elsewhere. If you want a good underwater camera and reasonable point and shoot then this is the camera for you. I just wish Nikon would come up with a camera with similar features.

Reviews.Title: Canon D10 A Great Camera from a Great Company
Reviews.Author: CLR "CLR"
Reviews.Content: this is the one you want for action sports. i've taken great shots & video of: skiing, boating, hiking, biking, fishing, scuba diving, surfing & wake surfing with this canon. amazing quality shots. it is wonderful to have a camera that is small enough that you can take it on your adventures & strong enough that you don't have to worry about breaking it (which i have done with other cameras). i also bought the orange olympus floating wrist band. it works very well. allows you to take the D10 in the water without concern (i've had it in my board shorts in head-high surf). This is my 4th canon & based on my experience (and the experience of my 2 pro photographer friends) they make the best cameras.also, i can't say enough about what a great company canon is. when i broke the seal on my D10 & got some water in it, i sent it back to be fixed. i assumed that i'd have to pay for the fix (after all i am hard on this thing). canon didn't charge me a cent and they mailed me a brand new one. incredible.last year when i broke the lens on my G10 skiing, i sent it in for a repair. canon fixed it fast, sent it back fast, and charged me a small, reasonable fee. canon makes legendary products and their customer service is extraordinary.the only draw back with the D10 is the shutter speed. for action sports you long for a rapid response so you can get a lot of shots. that said, you can't expect the performance of a high-end DSLR in this form factor/price point.for action junkies who want a point & shoot - this is the choice.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.. great price.. Great first effort.
Reviews.Author: I. Alsafa "Izzy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my vacation to St Thomas, USVI. This is the best point and shoot camera I've ever bought. Every year I've wasted my money on those stupid disposable waterproof cameras and the pictures never turned out. This was definitely worth the investment. I've put it through the salt water of the Caribbean, the sand on the beaches, the swimming pool and all it takes is a rinse after it's used to clean it up. Great picture qualities in and out of water. Great video quality for a point and shoot camera. When you shoot under water, make sure to choose the underwater macro setting and the pictures will turn out fantastic. The fully charged battery lasted for about 200+ pics. The camera looks like it can withstand all the weather and punishment, and looks and feels watertight. This has replaced my regular point and shoot camera. Anyone thinking about buying a waterproof camera should definitely buy this one.

Reviews.Title: i love this product!
Reviews.Author: M. Ribeiro "MMarques"
Reviews.Content: I really liked this camera. I went for a trip and the pictures was the best thing I collected. Tottaly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot D10
Reviews.Author: Paul G. Savage II "Woggy"
Reviews.Content: Camera was everything I wanted. Picture and video quality are excellent. Very easy to use. Easy to use all the common functions. Had the camera in the water for at least two hours at a time with no leaks (pushed all the buttons underwater with no problems). Battery time very acceptable, could possibly be seen as short (on avarage two days) but the camera has a large view screen. So get a couple of extra batteries to keep charged they are quick charging and not expensive. Get this camera and you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Great all around point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Mark Kitaoka
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit to take with me on a snorkeling trip to Mexico. It works very well and I only wish it shot in RAW so that I can adjust the white balance afterward. Other than that it performs very well. Underwater photography is tricky, but this camera gives one anything needed to take a shot as well as movies. Very reasonable pricing for a point and shoot that is waterproof and shock resistant. I normally shoot with a 1D Mark III and an underwater housing for the camera cost more than the camera body!

Reviews.Title: Worked great till it died.
Reviews.Author: LudaChris
Reviews.Content: I looked all over for a good camera I could take paddleboarding and not worry about it getting wet if I fell in. Got some great pics the first two trips, but it died on the 3rd. Must be something with the seals on the camera. I was extra careful when opening and closing the hatches but it looks like water got in there. The door seals didn't ever quite feel 100% closed to me, so I'm guessing that's where the water got in.Canon has always had great customer service, so other than the pain of returning it, it's no biggie.I think I'd go with one of those hard plastic housings for my older point n shoot instead. Those things never leak, but are a bit bulkier and UGLY.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Olewnik "Chris )°("
Reviews.Content: I really like the Canon PowerShot D10. It works great! I wish the battery life could be a little better, but I guess I will just have to carry extra batteries with me. I plan on taking it with me to Burning Man in 2010!

Reviews.Title: Love The Canon Powershot D10
Reviews.Author: WAM
Reviews.Content: This, so far, is one of my favorite cameras. I bought it for vacation and it took great pics both inside and outside, in light and in dark. I love the camera. It's also easy to use and its almost impossible to take a bad picture with it.

Reviews.Title: A real "Bring it everywhere" camera
Reviews.Author: C. Lim
Reviews.Content: With this camera, I am not afraid of getting wet, or being mishandled by my son. I bring it everywhere I go to capture some pictures that I had never done before:Water slides, Swimming pool, Snorkelling, Water theme parks....GREAT

Reviews.Title: love my photos
Reviews.Author: Seattle Mom of 2
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera right before we went to Disney World as I didn't want to chance taking my Rebel. I am so happy I chose to purchase this camera!!I used it outside, inside, for fireworks, underwater, on water rides, at the aquarium and I have to say it performed past my expectations!!!!The picture quality was great!This camera also seems to be very durable. I will admit, I've already dropped it twice and the camera has had no issues, it still works perfectly!I would highly recommend this camera to anyone!! But I would also suggest in getting an extra battery, especially if you are going to be using it all day.

Reviews.Title: Canon D10 review
Reviews.Author: Sycamore
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a kayak trip and used the Canon D10 for scenic and underwater pictures. I purchased this camera for this very reason. It is an ideal camera for water sports and for backpacking. With these type of adventures, you are always exposed to water due to being on the river or in rain. The clarity of the pictures I took under water were excellent and the landscape pictures were excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: Great addition to your snorkel gear
Reviews.Author: Morris W. Sasser "mwsasser"
Reviews.Content: The wife and I both agree that this little camera is great on snorkel trips.  Just a few weeks before this posting we snorkeled at several islands in the Caribbean with no problems.  I see several people upset about water leakage, the only way this might happen is if you didn't carefully close one of the waterproof doors for the battery ect.  The one on the bottom could easily not be closed all the way, just be careful and you'll have no problems.  I took this camera down several times to about 15ft depth to take pics on the bottom and they came out fine.  The trick is to have good sunlight at the right angle.  We took hundreds of pics over a few days and most of them were gorgeous.  Clouds of tiny fish or just some nice stills of the sea bottom with larger fish coasting along.  You must remember to buy the extra AKT-DC1 accessory kit and tether it to you because this camera is a tad bulbous and feels odd in the hands sometimes and it does not float.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jorge M. Almeida "jorge"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  It takes excellent pics and is extremely user friendly.  The only draw back is if you use it for 5 hours straight the battery starts to go on you.  So for long trips I suggest buying 2 batteries.  We took it to Hawaii and we used it everywhere, including all the beautiful oceans and pools.  Great Buy!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: D. Webb
Reviews.Content: This is the best purchase we have ever made. We were frustrated with our old camera and were about to go on a trip to Cozumel, so we considered buying a waterproof camera. After a little researching we opted for this one. Wow. No disappointment what so ever. Love it love it love it. It takes great pictures underwater and on land. The camera is very easy to handle and has lots of settings. I hate reading manuals. We even took videos under water and they came out amazing. The battery life really surprised me. It lasts for quite a while. The only thing is, it doesn't have a string. It came with one, but we can't figure out how to attach it. I think we'll just have to buy the accessory kit. It does not float, so without a string we were always worried about loosing it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Takes really nice pictures. The different settings allow creative photography as well as regular pictures. Haven't tried it under water yet, but am confident it will work wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: Great durable camera!
Reviews.Author: Q8 mom
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our daughter for graduation. She loves it! She is a swimmer and equestrian. She loves taking video and pictures under water and so far, the camera has held up to this with good quality pictures. I have also filmed her riding horses and the zoom is great and easy to use. It has even been dropped a few times.

Reviews.Title: Fun in the water
Reviews.Author: Eugene A. Davis
Reviews.Content: What a fun camera to have along on our annual trip to the water park.  Videos going down water slides are cool!  Gruesome affects taking portraits of people looking down into the water with camera under water. Its twelve mega pixel sensor makes large images, we tried an eight gigabyte memory card and feel it was plenty.  A second battery is a must.  Not that the battery capacity is lacking, we enjoy taking pictures and a second battery would have lasted well beyond the day in the sun.We've had it a month now and know for sure we can use it for any pictures.  Shutter lag was not noticed at all.  This will be my "go to," wet weather camera.Gene

Reviews.Title: Great Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Singer
Reviews.Content: This take amazing pictures in and out of the water.  The only negatives, and they are minor; are that the camera does not float and you cannot recharge the battery using the USB connection.  Also dont zoom while taking movies as the image is not that clear.  With the x12 zoom for pictures, it is great.

Reviews.Title: Is the best camera I ever bought !!
Reviews.Author: FRANZ HOLZHEU
Reviews.Content: It works great, under water, in the sun, in the dust, in the rain and I'm very happy I got one at the right price....

Reviews.Title: canon at its best, but water leaked. see my comments
Reviews.Author: SheenL

} cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81br1YBfHqS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNpreplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNpreplayImageId'); if (cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNpreplay) { cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNpreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81br1YBfHqS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNcurrentClick) { return cv_mo3H20OBDBO6ZGNcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 3:44 Minsnice design, takes great pics under water and on land. Pretty small but is bulky at the lens, so putting it in your pocket may be uncomfortable. Bus is to be expected if you want to go 33feet under water**** Well, just recently I was at the beach and in 4 feet of water and the camera died. Water leaked into the DC input door. I sent it to canon and they sent me back a refurbished one that doesnt work due to a lens error, I am waiting for a mailing slip they are sending me to send this one back. So far customer service has been great, no wait on the phone. Well see how it goes****

Reviews.Title: Gift for a kayak fisherman
Reviews.Author: ojQj "ojQj"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my parents.  It's robustness was thoroughly tested by UPS, but it arrived functioning and in one piece, unlike the box it was in.  The testing is being continued by their grandchildren.  My dad is a kayak fisherman, and my mom was tired of him dropping her cameras in the water.  My dad in particular has been raving about this camera.I'm happy because I get to see pictures of the catch of the day, and the latest quilt project.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for a family vacation
Reviews.Author: Damon K. Webster "PhotoInduced"
Reviews.Content: After reviewing a bunch of point and shoot cameras, the unique qualities here make it an awesome choice for those into water or snow sports. With all of the classic Canon feature sets, you know there will be quality images. The underwater capability makes this THE camera for summer. I've used it in the pool and even on a slip n' slide, and the images were excellent! Haven't had the season to check out the winter uses yet, but it goes to 14 degrees F, and shockproof to 4ft. Seems like a snowboarders dream. Finally you can hang in the water, where everyone else is, to get the best shots of your friends and family. Easy to use, big buttons, straps that can adjust to your wrist so no possible loss in the deep blue sea.Wish it had HD vid but, I'll live with the underwater SD.I used to be that guy who bought the underwater housing for the point and shoot because i hate being kept out of the water.Problem solved. [...]

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures, underwater and out.  Canon did a great job with this one.  I used it at a kid's birthday party and one of his favorite gifts was a water gun.  He kept spraying everyone whether they wanted him to or not.  I had him spray me while I took his picture and it turned out incredible!  How many other cameras would you encourage a child to shoot a water gun at?  I have played with all of the different settings and have really been impressed with the way the pictures turn out.  I am looking forward to taking this camera diving in a few weeks!  Definitely recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: Terrific camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Hawaii and this camera was perfect for my trip. I took beach photos, underwater photos, sunset photos.  I'm not an expert on cameras, but this one has a mode everything.  This is a great camera.  I would definetly buy this camera again.Also, I first bought this camera from Dell the week before my trip, and they delayed and delayed the shipment. It was also a nightmare getting my refund from them even when I hadn't even recieved the camera.  But, when I ordered it from Amazon, it got to me in 2 days.... not using expedited shipping either.  I've learned my lesson.

Reviews.Title: Really impressed!
Reviews.Author: Terry D. Smith "Customer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife and we both love it. It takes great pictures, the LCD screen is bright and crisp and it's easy to use. I recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Wish I hadn't bought this camera.
Reviews.Author: Aquaman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to have a rugged and waterproof camera for kayaking and snorkeling. I flooded the camera snorkeling (the battery and connector doors look inadequate to me), which Canon replaced with a refurbed unit. The refurbed camera has an intermittent fault  which started out innocuous enough (having to press the power button a couple times to get it to switch on) and has progressed to the point where it gives me error messages half the time that I power it up. I just missed taking pictures on a once in a lifetime kayak trip because of this camera. If I could do it over, I would try a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Great shots. Durable. If you can only take one camera this is it!
Reviews.Author: DCCorpMom
Reviews.Content: After reading dozens of reviews for waterproof cameras, I was confused.  But I like Canon's and haven't been disappointed with them in the past so I went with this one.  Most of all, too, the reviews overall suggest that this camera has the best IMAGE QUALITY among the small waterproof options.  We took it to Virgin Gorda for a week of scuba diving (40 ft) and sailing.  It did GREAT!  I had another camera with me that I never used.  This just did everything I needed and I was delighted with the quality of the pictures.  Really excellent.  NO LEAKS.  NO problems with salt water.  I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Takes Great Pics when SCUBA diving or snorkeling
Reviews.Author: Gary M Parkert
Reviews.Content: Most reviews are written by people who just bought the product and haven't used it for any significant period of time. I have used this camera for underwater photography for well over a year. I recently found took the chance of using it on dives deeper than it's 10 meter rating. I have used this camera down to 70 feet with no problems at all. I gambled on using it at these depths after a dive boat I was on said they have 3 of these cameras they loan to customers to use and they have never had one leak. They said they have had them shut down at depth because of the pressure but have never had one leak. I decided to take the risk with my camera and had great results on some recent dives in Kona. I used it on a Manta Ray night dive and got great video but that was only at 35 feet. Then I used it on a dive down to 70 feet with no problems at all. I got great still shots and video. The picture quality was so good I have had 11x16 gallery wraps made up and they look incredible. It takes great shots while snorkeling as well. I recommend this camera to anyone who wants to take great photos but doesn't want to invest a lot of money in a complicated underwater photography set up.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot DS10
Reviews.Author: kaiwi
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera.However, it is not good enough for underwater usage as it leaks and the manufacturer does not include leaking in the warranty.I bought a powershot D10 11months ago. I've kept it in impecable conditions. After a swim, I've always cleaned it as per instructions.Last week, while swimming, water leaked in through the AV outlet.I was shocked as a $300 camera should last longer than 11months.I sent it to the manufacturer and I've been told the warranty does not include water leak!!! and had to pay $200 to have it fixed.As a canon lover, my first camera was a Canon A1,  I'm deeply dissapointed.Anyone thinking of purchasing a D10, think about it at least twice!!!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera but it makes me SAD.
Reviews.Author: Marilee Kimball "She Radar"
Reviews.Content: I love the concept of this camera. Took it to Hawaii last year and it was amazing! Got so many cool shots of my kids first time snorkeling, and marine life. Plus video. I was beyond wowed by all of it features.Then I took it to the pool.... and it died.  I know, bummer, right?So I sent it back and Canon replaced it with a brand new camera. Thanks Canon! I do appreciate this.New camera, cool! So happy. I took it on vacation and after only about an hour of photos camera stops working. I change the battery, etc.... Nothing.  Then I notice that WATER is INSIDE OF THE LENS. Did I forget to close the camera back up properly? Nope - all dry inside there. Battery and Media still work on another camera.Send SECOND camera back to Canon. They send me a refurbished unit.Now I have this dilemma. Going back to Hawaii with kids and I don't trust this camera! Im sad, because I want to love it. When it takes photos its great. But I am on my THIRD camera.So.... Cross your fingers for me. If it dies in the water this time, Im done with it.(And Canon, I do love your products. I own 6 Canon DSLRs and 8 Lenses. Give a girl a break here on this baby camera - I just want it to work!)

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Nancy A
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a recent trip to Hawaii, and had really liked my previous Canon camera.  I was excited about the camera initially, thought it was very easy to use, and was pleased with the picture quality.  The second time I took it out it quit working and was filled with water.  Needless to say this was a total bummer because it was day two of my week long vacation.  I called around to a few camera shops on the island in the hopes that Canon would do some good deed and exchange my camera for me...(that did not happen).  Even the camera shop guys said they don't recommend this camera because of all the leakage issues.  I ended up buying the waterproof Olympus camera while there and did not have another problem the entire trip.  Comparing both cameras' pictures I have to go with the Olympus as well.  Save your money!!  Amazon has been great though...no complaints there!

Reviews.Title: why is "lens error" issue not mentioned here?
Reviews.Author: Karen Fong
Reviews.Content: Ive been reading reviews here for a week now and just about to order this 4.5 star camera and I stumbled on the Many many complaints about "lens error" message and unsusable Canon d10's. Now I'm confused. why are those reviews/rating NOT figured in here. totally throws off what I'm basing my purchase on. Guess I'm not buying one tonight? UGH, thought I finally made a decision.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!  MAJOR DESIGN PROBLEM
Reviews.Author: Robert Arthur
Reviews.Content: MAJOR DESIGN PROBLEMI bought a Canon D10 for a dive trip in the Caribbean.  The camera worked well and took excellent pictures.  Sadly, it is no longer with us, for the following reason:Access to the battery and memory card is through a compartment at the right base of the camera.  This is opened by pushing a latch on the compartment door from right to left.  While using the camera, your right hand thumb rests on this latch.  Under normal conditions, this is not a problem.  However, if you are in the water being pushed around by waves or surge, and are holding the camera trying to take pictures, your thumb can move and easily unlatch the compartment, letting water in.  This has happened to me twice.  Once with the Canon and once with an older Olympus Stylus Tough (which had the same design for its battery compartment: this design may have been changed on later cameras).With the Olympus, I was trying to get pictures in heavy surf and was being thrown around by the waves.  With the Canon, I was snorkeling through rocks in strong surge.  In both cases, my thumb was on the latch and the compartment door only partially released, but it was enough to let in a few drops of water which completely wrecked both cameras.It would seem that better placement of the latch/compartment would take care of this problem, and I'm sure I'm not the only one this has happened to.

Reviews.Title: Worked as advertised in caves, ocean, jungle !!!
Reviews.Author: oriole
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Cozumel Mexico. The camera was great. I went snorkeling, hiking in the Yucatan jungles, hiking in caves, swimming in underwater caves (yes - hike and swam 600 meters), and just plain sightseeing. The camera is no bigger than point-and-shoot film cameras of old. It was great. You don't need the Canon accessory package (which I bought and didn't use). The included wrist strap worked just fine. The picture quality was good. Definitely get an extra battery. I almost ran out  (pretty close but didn't) during the hike and swim in the underground caves but the battery survived the dozens of pictures and video (especially flash pictures and constant reviewing pictures while on this hike). The camera also survived a couple drops (one on a Mayan pyramid). It was also easy to operate while snorkeling.  I was worried about leaks like other reviewers. I followed the instructions and everything went smoothly. Definitely worth every penny. It captured a once in a lifetime trip.

Reviews.Title: too bad it broke..
Reviews.Author: Darla M. Forman "Book Lust"
Reviews.Content: The camera was great except that you can't set it down, it falls over because of the rounded edges, if you set it down, the camera falls over on to its screen or the lense.  The lense does not come with a cap, and is just naked in the air all the time.  It did take pretty good pictures until it broke, I bought it in February and it is now May, and I am sending it in.

Reviews.Title: Water leaked in after 2 uses!
Reviews.Author: May Liu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 6 months ago, took it snorkeling (less than 10ft) twice and went to the beach once. It was all okay until the second time I went snorkeling with it. The battery life was pretty good so I never had to charge the camera since the first time I charged it, so I'm sure the battery slot is well sealed before I go snorkeling the second time. Got in the water, the camera was fine for 10 minutes then the zoom-in/out stopped working. After 5 pictures, the whole camera died right when I finally spotted a sea turtle!!!! I thought the battery died. After I got home, I charged the battery and put it back in the camera, the buttons were not working right, the camera turned on for a few minutes and died eventually. The battery slot was completely dry but water somehow leaked into the camera.I contacted amazon and canon, amazon replied right away and offered to send me another one, I hope this one won't have the same problems again or I might just go back to regular reusable camera, cheaper and can go deeper!!Update:Amazon exchanged my camera and sent me a new canon D10. I took it to the big island and snorkeled. The camera was okay after I got out of the water. An hour later the buttons started malfunctioning, I could still take pictures, but some buttons didn't work. A few hours later the camera would only turn on and off, the zoom-in button kept zooming in on its own. Later that day the camera completely died. I thought it might be sand or salt stuck in the buttons but no, i soaked it in water and nothing came back on. I opened the compartments and everything was dry, even the lens. there seems to be no water at all in the camera, it just refused to turn on and of course, broken buttons. Before going on the trip I read the instructions and carefully closed all compartments.Fortunately Amazon is giving me a refund. I will not buy canon ever again.

Reviews.Title: Best Underwater Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: Harmony
Reviews.Content: Super easy to use. My lumix underwater camera was stolen, so I thought I would try this canon since I usually shoot canon. I'm so glad I did. The image quality is great in and out of the water. The video quality is good. I highly recommend it. So happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome all around camera
Reviews.Author: B Homer
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year now and it works great.  I use it for everyday snapshots but more importantly, I use it for snorkeling.  The camera has been used on multiple snorkel adventures with the camera underwater for hours as a time and no problems!

Reviews.Title: Indestructible
Reviews.Author: Fighting_Tiger
Reviews.Content: I carried the Powershot D10 along with me when I did the Tough Mudder race in Tampa, FA while taking pictures along the way.  It made it through anything from freezing cold water to several different kinds of mud, and was in my hand for at least one 10 foot drop into the water.  At the end of the race I simply washed it off with a water hose. The camera is virtually unscathed other than a few scratches, and the pictures are HD quality.  I've also taken this camera along with me around the world to include: the Saharan Desert, several mountains across the globe, coastal islands along the southwest tip of Thailand, and it has been in the hands of at least one curious monkey.  I have over 1500 pictures on here and the factory memory card is no where near full.  I also have several decent quality videos stored on it; they're not HD quality but they're perfectly clear and it captures sound well.  If Bear Grylls was looking to buy a functional digital camera to use in his field of work I would recommend the Powershot D10.

Reviews.Title: Leaked and Failed after light use
Reviews.Author: Doug1
Reviews.Content: O.K., the warranty has expired on this but I feel this camera's durability is lacking.  It's two years old, has been well taken care of but flooded and failed after only light use in water no deeper than six feet.  I am a Divemaster certified by the PADI organization and I got this camera for my wife to use snorkeling while I am scuba diving and to use in rain and snow.  Before its failure it worked very well, but in the middle of a vacation in Bonaire a short while back it stopped working.  You can see water got behind the front lens element.  Good to 33 feet?  I think not!

Reviews.Title: Indestructible camera, great pictures!
Reviews.Author: TheDi "DM"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son two years ago. He's rough on stuff. Before he got this camera, he broke the first two, both Kodaks. He takes this camera everywhere with him - it's been on 5 family vacations, on photo expeditions for school projects, it's been dropped on our tile floor, and it's been taken underwater in swimming pools dozens of times. It still works perfectly. What I also like is the quality of the pictures. They're sharp, nice color, nice contrast, and it can take macro photos up to a few inches away from the subject. Now that my daughter is ready for a camera of her own, I'm buying her the same one!

Reviews.Title: Seals DO NOT last
Reviews.Author: Stephen M. Cifuni "bostonsteve"
Reviews.Content: Starting around 1.5 years after owning this camera (and treating/maintaining it perfectly) the A/V door seal began leaking water.  Thankfully I put the camera into a bag of dry rice and there was no internal electronic damage.  Canon wants $150 to replace this tiny seal as an out of warranty repair!!!  If they would sell me the seal (they will not) this would be a simple repair that I could do myself in two minutes.  Expecting your customers to pay an average of $75 per year for maintenance on a $300 camera is ridiculous and anti-consumer.I can't help but feel like I paid Canon $300 to test their new waterproof technology for them so they can perfect it in the successor to this camera...

Reviews.Title: Good Point-and-Shoot but NOT Waterproof (Great Customer Service)
Reviews.Author: Kevin Seto
Reviews.Content: I was excited when the Powershot D10 came out as I am an avid surfer and spend a lot of time at the beach. I bought it before there were many reviews that mentioned its durability.  Trust me, I REALLY wanted to love this camera!Overall, the functions are great and it is ready to shoot almost instantly after turning on. The outdoor photos are exceptional and comparable to my Sony PowerShot DSC-TX1.  The indoor photos lack quality and are borderline unacceptable.  Video is okay; my only complaint is the glare from the sun on water causes strange lines in the video. Using it while snowboarding in sub-32 weather has never been a problem, even with some pretty good falls, so I can't argue with the "cold-resistant" and "shockproof" claims.Unfortunately, the D10 is not waterPROOF as advertised (which is why I bought it in the first place); it is water-resistant. I can take it in the pool and shoot underwater without any problems but ocean water has caused many problems. I am currently on my 4th (yes, 4th!) D10 because taking pictures in the ocean for surfing/snorkeling has caused the camera to malfunction. Somehow, water leaks in and ruins it, even after just a couple minutes of taking pictures in the surf. None of the cameras have been more than 15ft underwater so I was not pushing its "33ft" limit. I find it hard to believe that I was issued 3 defective cameras by chance. It can handle splashes and some water immersion easily but mine failed after 5-30min in the ocean. Luckily, all of the cameras were replaced under warranty. The warranty on the last one I received has expired so I'm wary of taking it into the ocean...I would have given it 1 star because it claims to be waterproof and I have not found that to be the case, however, I added an extra star because Canon's customer service has been great and every problem that I had was dealt with efficiently. Hope my experience has been helpful

Reviews.Title: fail, 6 months later and leaked.
Reviews.Author: JCEL "Joe"
Reviews.Content: Well, now I have a paper weight.  An average point and shoot digital cam other wise.  You pay the hefty price for the toughness and water proofing, nice if it actually lasts.

Reviews.Title: it leaked...
Reviews.Author: Blandine Gery
Reviews.Content: The day I received the camera, it worked well underwater and I downloaded some photos on my laptop. The next day, it leaked?! Maybe I didn't shut it correctly?In any case, I shipped it back to CANON (obviously it was under warranty), and 3 weeks later I received a brand new one (free of charge). I haven't tested it yet.

Reviews.Title: Good product, but could be better. More rugged.
Reviews.Author: Sandro
Reviews.Content: I have used my camera twice, beach and pool, and in both cases the picture's quality are pretty good. The mechanism to close the USB and battery cover compartment are not feasable. Could be better, in metal for example. So you need to pay attention when you close it. Is not a rugged camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Flyboy "jetjoc53"
Reviews.Content: Bought camera for trip to Jamaica. OMG what a pleasent surprise.  Pictures are crisp, color is vivid, can't say enough good things.  It's great to just rinse off the sand or salt water.  Even dropped it once.Underwater pictures are great, would compare my pictures with a high end camera anytime. Video both underwater and topside are super.While on trip people all around were asking what kind of camera I had.  I believe there are at least 8-10 new D10 owners now.The camera is simple to operate, even my wife who is a point and shoot type person used it with ease.If you want a camera you can take to the beach, pool or any adverse condition this camera is great. I would recommend buying a 16GB chip which would give about 2hrs+video and more pictures than you can take in a day.

Reviews.Title: great underwater camera
Reviews.Author: swim cam
Reviews.Content: We purchased the camera for underwater shots in the Galapagos Islands.  It took excellent photos and became our "go to" camera while we were snorkeling and kayaking as well as being very nice to have on the beach.  Took excellent photos under water without flash  (though there is an internal one) and underwater focus was excellent.  We recharged every night but did not have any problem with battery life after using it all day to take both photos and video. The 3X zoom was sufficient for all of our photo requirements. There is also digital zoom but we did not use that often. This was in roughly 30 ft of water. The camera has simple, easy to understand and easy to master controls. Some of the other settings that you might be used to on "Cannon land cameras" such as changing the ISO are a little more challenging. Since those all  run through the menu on the back rather than a button on the camera, some prior consideration of shooting conditions rather than changing "in the heat of battle" is the way to go,  but still it was not a problem.  The display  on the back is large, bright and easy to use both in and out of the water. There is a short learning curve mastering the  framing photos while swimming. The camera does not float but we got a small clip from home depot to clip the wrist strap to our vest and had no issues. Overall an excellent camera especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Aruba Trip
Reviews.Author: J. Capps
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this camera for the sole purpose of taking on my 15th anniversary trip to Aruba.  We were to Snorkel, Snuba and SeaTrek.  Prior to going we tried the camera in different situations and it did great.  The Pic quality was superior and the interface was easy to use.  My problem began upon entering the water for the first time.  With every thing properly sealed I took it on the SeaTrek walk.  I was able to take 1 pic before the camera shorted out.  Needless to say I was very disappointed.  I have replacement on the way but it will not make up for the missed opportunity.  I know that I just had a defective camera and that it was most likely a fluke but still very disappointing.Jim

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Beach Princess
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a cruise this past summer. I am a camera novice . . . if it's too complicated I won't do it. Anyway, I took lots of pictures on a beach trip and on a cruise. There are easily changed settings and sometimes you need to play with it a bit to get exactly what you want (like action pictures at sunset). I have beautiful underwater pictures with no editing (IF you have it on the underwater or aquarium setting!), great sunrise and sunset pictures, indoor pictures,  pictures of people and dolphins and birds, and my son took some amazing pictures of fireworks on the Fourth of July. I am extremely pleased! The only video I took was of some birds fighting, so I didn't use that feature much. My only complaint is that you can't zoom in a lot,  which I wanted to do with the dolphins, and sometimes zooming in the picture can come out grainy. The colors are beautiful, though. All in all, though this was a smart purchase and I would buy this camera again!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Morioka
Reviews.Content: Love the camera and video feature!  Haven't used it underwater, but used it in the pouring rain!  Works great and took great pictures and videos.  Easy to use and image stabilizer is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: W. Doyle "Taco Billy"
Reviews.Content: We use this to take photos of our kids swimming. no issues with water as long as you dry it off before opening it to remove the card. It takes good picture of under water life. I have used this in salt water and have had no issues. I have only gone about 10' down.

Reviews.Title: Decent underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Kathy "airportbabe"
Reviews.Content: The pictures turn out pretty nice and for the price paid, it's a good choice.  My complaints are about the bulk of the camera.  The Pentax I had previously (and accidentally ruined) was a much slimmer camera to hold and was easier to use.

Reviews.Title: take it out drinking, it can take the beating
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: I live by the beach and have taken this camera out a few times and it's great. But the main reason why I bought this camera was because it had a large aperture at the time compared to impact resistant waterproof cameras and.... to replace my mom's camera that a drunk friend had slapped out of my hand and ruined! I have also used this camera in classrooms, and it's not a big deal if children hold it to take pictures. I have dropped it a few times myself.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: John J. Santoro
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few years now. My husband go to Aruba everyyear and snorkel the camera takes great pictures

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly and takes a beating
Reviews.Author: M. Beste
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift for my wife to use snorkeling.  So far it has worked perfectly.  It has not leaked at all and takes beautiful pictures.  We have had the camera almost two years now and it still works as good as it did the day we bought it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Delia Alva "DeeDee"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera and it takes great pics!  Will definitely recommend to others if asked and thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: Purchased over 7 years ago
Reviews.Author: Keith Vallely
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent.  I've had it for years, taken in the ocean, in pools, etc.  It has never failed, it works great, was worth every dime.  The only criticism I have is that you cannot remove the 'memory card' and simply stick that into a  computer. You must plug the entire camera into the computer, using a usb cable (provided).  I don't use, never have, the included software.  I can see this camera lasting me another 10 years.  Pictures are solid, video is great, goes underwater both for pic and video, and the audio is solid.  I cannot give this a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Amy of FL
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific camera. Takes beautiful underwater shots and video. Have used a lot of it on our facebook and business website. Best buy of decade.

Reviews.Title: Good pic's
Reviews.Author: Stefan Sigurdson "Sig"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and takes good pictures. Battery life is good as well. Don't forget the SD card to hold all your shots.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Carney
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera.  Bought it for my annual fishing trips to Canada which tend to be wet and rainy.  Takes fantastic pics and video and is very, very durable.

Reviews.Title: Construction Inspectors Friend
Reviews.Author: Dennis Logue
Reviews.Content: using cameras on construction sites is usually a death sentence for the camera.  The dust usually kills then in a few weeks.  I have used the D10 for over five years with no problem, wide range of picuture sizes and video capability are all part of ongoing uses.  The battery has never run out before the end of the day and the flash is also good enough for service in any place I have been, including inside sewer pipes and underground structures.  great camera.  It is a little bulky, but not so much as to make me think of changing.

Reviews.Title: Great outdoor camera!
Reviews.Author: DAW
Reviews.Content: This is not a do-all camera. If you are outside, in the sunshine or the rain or underwater it takes an amazing picture. If you are inside or at a concert at night, it's not awesome. I love it for what it was designed for and I'm very happy!

Reviews.Title: Nah, don't buy it
Reviews.Author: Cultech
Reviews.Content: I used this for two years with great results, and then it finally failed and filled with water. When I sent it back to Canon at my expense, for a repair evaluation, I was told that to repair it it would be 240.00 Shoot, I only paid 99.00 for the camera to begin with. I got rid of it.

Reviews.Title: problem with waterproof
Reviews.Author: Pedro Igarreta
Reviews.Content: After a year of use, whenever I use it underwater, the following day the display doesn't work. On the second day it starts working ok.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Vagner Iupi
Reviews.Content: Great Camera!I bought to film my swimming strokes!Great quality video, Great quality sound!Easy to use.Perfect!!! Perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: good camera, but poor battery life.
Reviews.Author: Big Trev
Reviews.Content: takes great pictures, and the utility of it being water resistant makes this a solid purchase. the battery life kind of sucks, though, so make sure you're bringing spares if you're going to be snapping pics all day. this is mainly because they're no view finder, and relies solely on the LCD screen.

Reviews.Title: 4 years of happy photography in and out of water
Reviews.Author: Gabriela
Reviews.Content: I bought my D10 back in 2009 and it finally died on me this past August 2013. That's 4 years!It never leaked, it never ever gave me any trouble at all. I took it everywhere: from the rain forest to swimming with whale sharks every  year, I took it along for extended periods of time with heavy use in the ocean. I was rough with it, I must say, never soaked it in fresh water after being in salt water, never cleaned it. And it never failed.It was a really great camera! I will miss it dearly!I'm getting the new one, the D20... I hope it is as good as its predecessor!

Reviews.Title: This is NOT a waterproof camera- DON'T BUY!
Reviews.Author: Francine G. Shirvani "cinette"
Reviews.Content: All the 5 stars ratings  are probably written by customers a short time after they used the camera.  I purchased my late in 2011 before a trip to Hawaii.  It worked well and I took nice pictures.  I would have given it a 5 then.  However, I went back to Hawaii beginning of Sept. 2013.  I took a few pictures one day-- then the next day I got the dreaded black screen and the camera did not work.  I put it in rice ( a trick I learned when my iPhone got wet).  24hours later the camera came back on.  I was thrilled because I had seen lots of wonderful fish and turtles while snorkeling the day my camera sat in rice.  I was eager to start taking pictures.  So...I took my Canon camera back to the beach and was not able to take a single picture.  The camera seemed dead.  I did my rice trick again-- no luck.  My camera is kaput.  I have read reviews from customers who have had the same experience and I read that they have had no luck with Canon customer service.  They will not exchange and they charge more for repairing  it than the cost of a new camera.  I personally will wait for newer technology.Even if you are happy with the Canon camera when you first take it underwater-- you will soon have the same experience.  Don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Leaky Camera, But Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Meghan
Reviews.Content: My parents bought my husband and me this camera for our wedding so that we could take it on our honeymoon.  It worked great, the pictures were great, we loved it.  Fast forward two years later.  We took the camera snorkeling it worked great while on the boat.  I checked all the little doors to make sure they were securely closed before I got into the water.  When I tried to use it in the water it wouldn't turn on.  Thinking the battery was dead I took it back to the boat.  That's when I noticed that there was water inside the screen.  When I opened the compartments for the battery and the USB plug I noticed that they were damp.  Clearly the camera leaked while in less than four feet of water.I was unhappy with the initial response I received from Canon.  However, when I sent an email letting them know that I was unhappy with the response, a supervisor contacted me and sent me a UPS shipping label to send the camera in at no cost to me.  She told me that I should email her a copy of the repair estimate once I received it.  The estimate said that it would cost $179 to repair the camera.  When I contacted the supervisor she said that they would send me a refurbished camera (which could actually be a new camera that was excess inventory) free of charge.  I received the new camera today.  It included a new battery, cables, charger, software, etc.  It was just as if I purchased a new one.While I was disappointed that the camera leaked, I'm extremely satisfied with Canon's response to the issue.  I will remain a loyal Canon user as a result.

Reviews.Title: Had it for 3 years now and its wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Margaret Thornton "Mag"
Reviews.Content: This is my first underwater camera not counting the disposables I have bought here and there through the years. One very important advice for people like me, make sure you turn the underwater mode while underwater otherwise you will get all green images like my first time:) This camera has been with me all over Florida, the Caribbean island and Bermuda. It is great for snorkeling and beginner scuba, up to 33ft. I have taken some amazing images both above and bellow water, best underwater pics are closer to the surface where there is more light, the colors are vibrant. I highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: THE BEST.
Reviews.Author: Lisa Nix
Reviews.Content: I have cameras. Lots of cameras. One might consider me to be a hoarder of cameras. I have insanely expensive cameras. I have cheap disposable cameras. I have goofy cameras. I have A LOT of cameras. This particular camera is my all-time favorite camera.. It's small, it's almost unbreakable, and it takes some of the best regular photos plus the absolute BEST underwater photos- it has become my go-to camera. You won't even need the user manual, because the camera is beyond user-friendly..it literally guides you step-by-step based on what you want to do. Worth every single penny! Get an extra charger, battery & miniHD card and put them in your suitcase! You will be glad you did and very happy with your purchase!

Reviews.Title: Best Waterproof Camera Ever!
Reviews.Author: Heather Ryan
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!!! I took it with me on my Caribbean cruise and got some amazing video and pictures of the reef. I highly recommend this camera for people who aren't very techno savvy that want a somewhat inexpensive camera for water sports!

Reviews.Title: Waterproof AND Crash Proof!
Reviews.Author: TTs Trippin "Teresa"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 2 years and absolutely LOVE it!  I am a Travel Blogger and this is the only camera I travel with.  I love the quality of pictures and video and the ease to transition between the 2.  I have taken underwater video that looks like I am swimming in an aquarium!  I have also taken several underwater pics both in pools and beaches--they have come out great.  My last "unplanned" test of the camera came when I went flying over the handlebars of a bike and crash landed.  My camera was in my hand and flew right along with me, hitting the pavement HARD!  I picked it up (after picking myself up) and tested it--worked like a charm.  Barely a scratch on it (and I had to really look hard to see one).  When it says "shock proof", it means it!  It's great to use ALL the time and not have to worry if it starts raining or liquid spills on it too.  I have recommended it to all my friends and don't plan on buying a new camera till its dead :-)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For Travel
Reviews.Author: A. Bradley ":)"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a birthday present to myself a few years back. It has been to the Caribbean, to multiple CA beaches, HI, many pools, a color run, muddy environments, the rain, dropped by a toddler- still going strong! Have not had any issues with leaking or anything. **I am very good about rinsing it in fresh water if taken to the beach!**

Reviews.Title: Great Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: Dylan Murphy
Reviews.Content: PROSVery sturdy, takes hits like a champVideos & pictures are great!Nice OptionsEasy to useIncluded battery charger works great, charges fast, battery lasts a long timeCONSDROPLET ON LENSE!Flash ShadowVery little zoomRarely, but occasionally, refuses to come on.Fairly bulkyMy biggest complaint is one that I think all underwater cameras suffer from: When you take a picture out of the water after being submersed, you have to check the lense to make sure there are no water droplets sticking to it. They will distort your pictures, I have literally hundreds of pictures that are awesome except someones head is totally blown up by this. It occurs to me now that a touch of RainX on the lense might solve this but I have yet to test it.2nd biggest complaint is unique to this camera, and perhaps just to mine. Sometimes, and this would only be at the start of water adventures, the camera will just fail to come on. This won't have anything to do with battery power but I think is because it thinks there is like 1 water molecule in the battery compartment or something. Usually waiting a few hours will solve this and I think it is caused by maybe me not 100% closing the battery door after charging the battery.3rd complaint is that using the flash causes a visible shadow in your image from the top of the lense house blocking part of the light from the flash.At the time, this was one of the few available in its price range. Now there are many sleeker options, but at the time it stood out. It is fairly heavy and bulky, you would not comfortably keep this in your pocket. Perhaps I would not buy this in today's market, but I am not sure other cameras would have withstood the abuse this has taken.Complaints aside, this thing is a beast, I've been spelunking, snorkeling, diving, river floating, boating, camping, hiking, biking, etc with this. It has hit rocks, concrete, trees, boats, etc and while it has its share of scratches, still operates like it did day one. Has some neat options for bracketing and various auto settings like most cameras. Also I don't know that I ever recall an occasion where the battery died on me, unless I hadn't charged it in like a week. I have taken literally thousands of pictures with this guy.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS!
Reviews.Author: BAMMAJAMMA
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing pictures and is so durable. I suggest buying the little floatie that hooks up to it in case you drop it in the ocean. I have had this for years and it has been on many vacations with me. Out of the water it takes great pictures too! This is probably one of the best gifts my husband has ever bought me.

Reviews.Title: great waterproof and girlfriend proof camera.
Reviews.Author: Adam H "mobile ham"
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this camera.  It has been beaten dropped and everything else and still works very well.  Waterproofing held up and the pictures turn out great.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Andreas Bachelez "ABA"
Reviews.Content: overall, works great, resistant, I carry it when fishing so I can take underwater/wet shots of the fish. It takes very good pictures (NOT professional quality, but a good point and shoot that suits my not so techy needs).The only downside is its bulk - the "submarine" design is cool but not all that practical.A.

Reviews.Title: fine until it went underwater
Reviews.Author: Yarrow Nelson
Reviews.Content: This camera worked fine for one year until the very first time I used it underwater. It blitzed out the minute it was underwater - only about 1-2 feet deep. This happened the first day of our vacation, so we had no camera the rest of the trip. Bring a spare camera or buy a better underwater camera.

Reviews.Title: Don't Get It Wet
Reviews.Author: Herbert Hartmann
Reviews.Content: Every time I got the camera under the water (2 to 3 feet), the display would stop working. My camera shop sent it back to Canon three times. Canon replaced it with a new camera once and fixed it the other two times. So, I stopped using the camera under the water and everything was fine. But a friend borrowed it and stuck it under about 2 feet of water to video humpback whales from a raft....The display stopped again. Back to Canon, but this time Canon wanted to charge me over $150 to fix it...Bad news!!!

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I Ever Owned!
Reviews.Author: David Greggo
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a long time now and have dropped it in snow, on the ground, took pictures underwater, and it has had ZERO problems and takes beautiful pictures.  The only downside is that it is kinda bulky, but the activities I enjoy taking it on are where I have a lot of pockets or storage so it's not an issue unless I want to take it sightseeing or while wearing casual clothes and then you notice how bulky it is.  This was the best waterproof camera on the market and you won't go wrong in buying this!

Reviews.Title: Failed 50% of the time
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: While this camera takes great photos, it is totally unreliable.  I've taken it underwater a total of four times;  the first time was 5 months after purchase, and the LCD screen blitzed out.  Canon deemed this a catastrophic failure and replaced it under warranty.  I've taken the replacement under water (less than 25 feet) three times... guess what?  The LCD screen failed again!  Same response from Canon Tech Support, except this time no warranty repair.  They extended their "customer loyalty exchange program" to me, with the exception they have no D10 cameras to exchange, and their only other waterproof camera available (D25) is indefinitely out of stock for exchange program.  Likely because they have had to replace so many faulty D10's.  Bottom line, loved the camera when it worked, but Canon's service program has lost them another customer.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Derby City "Michelle"
Reviews.Content: Takes great underwater pictures. No problems with leaking. My kids can use it too and I don't have to worry about them dropping it. It was nice to be able to walk out to the ocean or get in the pool to take photos and not worry about getting the camera wet. I suggest using the chums waterproof camera float for added safety. Won't replace an underwater case for a SLR, but great for underwater shots for casual user, summer vacations or just summers at the pool.

Reviews.Title: I loved this camera and its abilities - just puzzled on shape
Reviews.Author: Tara KM
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in 2010 and since then have taken it on several trips that included underwater diving with great white sharks in South Africa, snorkeling in Zanzibar, whitewater rafting in Jackson Hole and just swimming around in mucky lakes and chlorinated pools with friends in the U.S. Never once have I had any issues with water leaking, and I have been pleased with the photos and video abilities of this camera. (Although after taking it in salt water I made sure to rinse the camera off with non-salty water!) Even the sound underwater is good; as in one video I took in SA, the shark swam right into the diving cage and the sound of the shark hitting the cage in the video is awesome!I usually shoot on a Nikon DSLR, but I wanted a point and shoot to take with me in more "adventurous" locations. I would definitely recommend this camera, although now it has been around for a while so I am not sure if there are any improved models. The one thing that puzzles me about it (that I wish I could change) is the silly shape of this camera. I wish I could fit it in my back pocket - but alas the camera is bubbly and a bit bulky for a pocket. I argued with the guy at my local camera store for a bit about that, but in the end aesthetics were not as important as image quality so there you go. Good luck to all making a decision!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Nevette
Reviews.Content: Love my camera.  It is amazingly sturdy.  It doesn't have the picture quality my last camera had but my last camera died when it fell in the water.  I don't have to worry about this one being dropped so it gives me great peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: mon
Reviews.Content: I haven't taken it in deep water yet but have tried it out in pools and in adverse weather conditions and I love it!I also like the retro design and little submarine window lens.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: bidget10
Reviews.Content: I have great pictures of the beach, under the water at the pool, and skiing. Takes great pictures. Worth every penny,

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Tom Jones
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for our kayak trips. We have used it under water with no issues and very clear pictures. We could not be happier with this product.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Stacey Gross
Reviews.Content: Kids loved this camera in our pool. We still use it all the time. (2012)Great for the beach (sand).!!!!Thank u

Reviews.Title: Served the purpose
Reviews.Author: Joseph J. Doane
Reviews.Content: one of our better buys, we'd do it again if the opportunity presented itself; we're very satisfied with the product

Reviews.Title: Perfect for underwater pictures
Reviews.Author: Rachel Willenberg
Reviews.Content: This product really delivers quality underwater pictures that I never thought would be possible at this price range.  The downside....not the best camera for above water pictures.  But for anything in the water, this product is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Very fun camera
Reviews.Author: Aaron Frederick Goss
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for a little over 3 years now.  I bought it for snorkeling and SCUBA diving in Saint John.  It's a fun camera.  Takes great pictures, goes underwater.  It's rated for 30 feet, but I've taken it to 60 a few times without any adverse effects that I can detect.  I'm nervous about taking it further than that, just because of the manufacturer limitation.It's *awesome* to be able to just hose it off whenever it gets dirty.I've also dropped it several times, some onto concrete, also without any detectable adverse effects apart from a scratch or two.It takes great pictures in and out of the water.  Any time you take an underwater picture, you're going to want to color-correct.  With minor adjustment, though, I've been able to take several pictures worthy of decorating my house.

Reviews.Title: Takes a beating!
Reviews.Author: Tim C.
Reviews.Content: We refer to this camera as the tank. It has been dropped, splashed and crashed more than I care to think about but it still works. I love this camera and would recommend it to anyone who wants a great durable point and shoot camera. My only complaint? I do wish it was a little smaller, I still wouldn't give mine up though.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier.
Reviews.Author: Chris Jepsen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on my honeymoon in hawaii, and it did great in a variety of settings. It provided us with excellent underwater pictures, panoramas, macros, portraits and stills.  Since then it has endured several hunting trips, road trips, and fishing trips. its waterproof feature keeps my mind at ease in rainy conditions and in boats, while its shape which lacks sharp corners has proved to be very durable.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THE CAMERA - but it disappoints me every time (I'm on my 3rd one!)
Reviews.Author: Krista
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I love this camera.  My husband and I live in the Caribbean and he runs snorkeling tours so it is used more often then that of the average person.  It takes great photos on land and in the water.  It has been a great addition to our collection of other Canon cameras.  I've always been a Canon 'junkie'.  We have purchased this camera for the third time.  I will take the blame for the first replacement as the seal wasn't all the way in.  But on the other two - the seals were all the way in and the camera filled with water.  The second replacement of (3rd camera) we used for the first time in my parents pool in NJ and it filled with water the first time.  We sent it back to Canon who determined the seals failed and they sent us another (which actually makes our 4th camera).  After having that one for a few months - the seals have failed again.  While we were waiting for the replacement of that one, we purchased the Olympus digital water camera - and I HATE IT.  The quality of the pictures is pathetic, which just makes me even more sad that our Canon has failed us again.  It really is a great little camera with fantastic versatility but I can't see myself purchasing another one to see it die after a few months.  I'm going to try a Sony water camera - another island friend has one and has had decent luck.  Very disappointing from a die hard Canon fan.....

Reviews.Title: Cool
Reviews.Author: steph
Reviews.Content: My daughter wanted a waterproof camera for beach-going and wake boarding.  She loes this camera and the picture quality is awesome.  Great compact camera at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Still going strong!
Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over two years now. It's been to Florida, the Bahamas, Hawaii, etc. It has worked great in all situations! I've let my friends borrow it also, and they loved it. I bought the floating strap with this, which is a great idea. This thing will sink without it.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
Reviews.Author: AP
Reviews.Content: I borrowed this camera from a relative. It was used to take photos while spending time on the beach, so we wouldn't have to worry if a little water splashed on it etc etc. We did take it into the water, but this camera never went deeper than 12 inches  if so much at all. It worked fine for a couple days, then all of a sudden, it refused to come on. Shortly after, I noticed there were tiny droplets of water on the lens.  I always made sure all the compartments were securely closed before using it, as I did borrow it, and was extra paranoid. As far, as I can tell, we were very careful with it, never dropped it or anything like that. And even with all that care, it still just 'konked' out...just before the snorkeling trip to boot! Correct me if I'm wrong, but this is supposed to be waterproof up to 33 feet, is it not?I would not recommend anyone purchase this camera if they intend to take it into the water...It does not seem to be truly waterproof, and therefore a waste of money! While it does take decent photos, you never know for exactly how long it will continue.

Reviews.Title: It is great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Hui
Reviews.Content: The camera does not capture image very well under strong lights. However, it is great for clod and watery environment. I used it when I snowbard in CO. I did not worry when I fell over and dropped it in snow. Also I am going to bring it for my Maldives trip. Love it so far and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Canon Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: Saeeda
Reviews.Content: I love Canon generally. The picture quality is great.After some use a bit of water got into the lens making pictures look misty.It's quite chunky- so not as portable as other slim cameras that can tuck into a purse or jeans pocket.There is no lens cap to protect the lens.

Reviews.Title: Nice but didn't last long
Reviews.Author: loriannk
Reviews.Content: It was nice but as soon as the warranty was over the lense does not want to work properly. The camera itself is kind of bulky.  I have taken very good care of it and cleaned it after being in the ocean as the instructions stated to do.  Won't buy Canon again.

Reviews.Title: Best waterproof camera that I have owned
Reviews.Author: Reverand
Reviews.Content: I have owned 3 different waterproof camera's and each one has failed me when I have used them snokelling. They all fogged up inside and I was unable to use them. I was in tropical enviroments. The only camera that has not let me down was the Cannon. The pictures are very good for a point and shoot camera so considering this is waterproof as well is impressive. I have a Cannon T2i SLR and of course the pictures are not the smae quality as an SLR, but if you are in the market for a waterproof this is the model to buy. My only complaint is it is a little larger then the three other waterpoof camera's that I have used but it is a small price to pay to be able to take pictures and underwater video without the lens fogging up.

Reviews.Title: my favorite camera ever!
Reviews.Author: tewpo
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 3 yrs and it is still going strong. It is a little bigger than a true pocket camera but I carry it in my pocket with a slight bulge. I've used it in pools, at the beach,snorkelling, river trips, skiing, you name it. Never leaked still taking great shots. As far as rugged goes my sons have both dropped it and kicked it across the floor and it is still working. I am a reasonably good pitcha-taker with some fairly sophisticated cameras. This is the one I reach for more than any other. Like all these small aperture,small chip cameras it isn't super in low light. Still, the action setting shooting at 3200 iso ain't bad for a 4X6 print. This lets you get the shot in darker situations. I've tried the Fuji xp which really stunk in every regard and the Panasonic Lumix which suffered on color repo. So if you want a great little all purpose, underwater, rugged,great pictures in bright light, decent pictures in low light, I can't give a better recommendation than the D10.It has been a lot of fun and isn't that what you want in a camera?

Reviews.Title: Mixed Reviews
Reviews.Author: Nesta
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in June 2011 to specifically use on my beach vacation.
