Camera was working great, takes great pictures but unfortunately I started getting a lens error and was unable to use it the remainder of my trip. Camera was returned to manufacturer who repaired lens for free.  This summer I went on another beach vacation, camera was working great, but then I received the same error message. I contacted manufacturer again, this time I'm required to pay for my repair (approx. $170 or more). Needless to say, I'm a little disappointed in buying this camera, I was so looking forward to having a Canon water camera, but my new camera has turned out to be a bust. =(

Reviews.Title: Canon D10 camera
Reviews.Author: Siegfried Mayr
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera - very pleased with it. Easy to use and highly portable. Great for snorkeling and other wet applications.

Reviews.Title: worked great!!
Reviews.Author: laura
Reviews.Content: We bought this to take to jamaica with us. Pictures turned out wonderful, video was good, but could have been better. It was a little grainy at times, usually when I tried to do close ups, if everything wasn't high def these days I probably would have never noticed the video quality. We had a lot of fun playing around with it while we were there and brought home some amazing photos that looked professional. We took good care of it and had no problems with leaking or anything. Read the manual, follow directions, and have fun with it!

Reviews.Title: Amazing photos
Reviews.Author: Ahmed Ramahi
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived to me just a week before our honeymoon trip to the Maldives so i didn't get a chance to test it or play with it.I'm a semi pro photographer, or a serious amateur you may say, the camera options are easy to figure out (to know its options go check the product page on Canon website) the underwater photos with or without flash are amazing. It lacks behind a bit on night photography at open areas so dont count on this camera as you all-in-one if you have a special occasion. But all in all. It performed well over my expectations!

Reviews.Title: Great Underwater Camera for Price
Reviews.Author: LyssaBelle
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to take with us to Maldives for 8 GLORIOUS days. Used everyday, did not read the instructions too much as many were provided here in the reviews! The camera battery on full cahrge lasted us about 4-5 hours in the water with constant use. The pictures are clear and the camera is very easy to use. There are many more settings besides the underwater features. We also used the video underwater, amazing the sounds its captures and how clear it is.We did bump the camera quite a bit underwater, especially on low tide days, this did cause an internal scratch on the screen, unnoticeable when the camera is on. We were meticulous about rinsing it after each use and drying it.We recommend getting the float wrist band, this was a lifesaver at deep reefs! After 8 days its still going strong, we brought it back to Afghanistan with us to see how well its holds up.Overall, definitely recommend this camera, crystal clear shots, user friendly, and a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great, Worry Free Camera for Outdoor Fun
Reviews.Author: Michelle Holbert
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back in 2010 for my boyfriend who is an avid deep sea fisherman. We live in Hawaii and he takes this camera with him every time they go out on the boat. I am not a tehcnological savvy gal. However, after reading all the positive reviews, I decided to purchase the camera. I am so happy I did because the camera has exceeded our expectations. I have about 3 other non waterproof cameras and this camera is my first choice. Although it is made for the outdoors, I use it for everyday pictures as well. It is a bit bulky but the quality of the pictures is worth it's weight. For the past two years this camera has been fishing, kayaking, hunting, in and out of suitcases and more and it still delivers top quality photos. If you are doing research on a quality camera that wont't break the bank, do yourself a favor and buy this!

Reviews.Title: Great Multi-purpose camera
Reviews.Author: BradleyB
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, thinking I would use it for some diving and snorkeling vacations that we were taking, and wanted to capture great underwater memories.  Wow!  is all I can say, not only does it take great shots underwater... the quality of regular above water shots is also excellent.  If you are looking for something that is perfect for Land and Sea - this is a great option!  Pictures are of high quality, it is easy to use, menus are simple to navigate and have tons of options.

Reviews.Title: Nice pix if you don't take it underwater!!
Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: I bought this exactly 2 years ago from Amazon, as I wanted to take underwater snorkeling photos. It has minimal zoom but that is understandable since the lens does not extend/retract , likely because it is meant to be waterproof ... I used it the next month in Hawai'i for ONE snorkel adventure; but too much water movement made the pix fairly cloudy/blurry .Now, 2 years later, we go to the islands again. I used the camera today for a short while before it totally stopped functioning. I  did see some tiny air  bubbles coming from the bottom of  the camera . Black LCD screen. Won't turn on . Nada . Water leaked inside on the 2ND time I ever used the thing.(Before this happened,  beach pictures taken on dry land were very vivid and of nice quality).I swam back to shore, removed the battery and card,  kept the door open to dry it out , hoping that would fix the problem. I did not notice much wetness, and I was lucky all my photos on that SD memory card were still intact. Then, I went back in the water to see what I could see, which was amazing. I saw really big fish in schools, but the "piece de resistance" was a VERY large beautiful sea turtle... the only one I have ever seen. He let me swim alongside him for a long time. I loved it, but of course was miffed about the bummer camera and being unable to photo this gentle giant turtle.Later, I installed my extra battery and a different card, heard a sound as if the camera was starting up, but no. Still dead. As a doornail.It has been two years since I purchased it, and I have only had it underwater the two times I have mentioned. I highly doubt that Amazon can help me out, as it has been so long. I see this same camera is still on their website for sale, hence my review here and warning to others that this is no cheap camera price-wise, and it is a Canon, so I expected better than two uses only.  I will try Amazon first, then Canon. I feel like I threw away over $250 and lost a great photo opportunity.Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Mary C. Vandegrift
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in April 2010.  Works great in a swimming pool.  First time snorkeling (April 2011) in salt water the LCD screen died.  Returned to Canon and they replaced with a refurbished camera.  Continued to work great in a swimming pool and out of the water.  Second time using in salt water (August 2012) the LCD screen again died.  The camera still worked, you just had no idea what you were taking a picture of.  I returned the camera to Canon to they want to charge me $172.00 to repair.  Not happy!

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: Oiso obasan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 2-3 yrs ago . I noticed ,when taking photos under normal circumstances( not underwater ), that sometimes the camera refused to turn on,even though the battery had just been charged. After playing with it,I realized that  the bottom door fo battery/SD card compartment,was not closed tightly! It appeared to be closed ,at a glance, but wasn't ACTUALLY CLOSED!! I had to push the door 2 times, to get it completely sealed! Imagine if I were snorkeling with it....poor design! ! I got used to checking it obsessively,and got great underwater pix.....then I went snorkeling a few weeks ago, and was hit by a big wave! Impact had caused the side door ( USB -PC connect) to suddenly pop open...flooding the camera with salt water! ! After trying to dry it out ( I knew I was hopeless), the camera never functioned again,and I could still see water inside the back screen!!  Canon is basically a good product , but like so many products ...they are designed by people who never ACTUALLY TEST AND USE THEM,UNDER NORMAL USE! They need two SECURE DOORS ,THAT LOCK IN PLACE,!Bottom line, if you don't mind throwing your money away,buy it, it takes great pix...if the doors don't come open , and send your camera to the trash pile!

Reviews.Title: Great Underwater Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ashley F "Ms. Finny"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased this camera for a trip to Hawaii last year. We were looking for something that would do well in salt water, but then maybe also last long enough to use it for years to come with our kids in the pool. After reading reviews on a few other cameras (as well as this one) and viewing user uploaded pictures, we decided to spend a little extra money and go with this one. All of my other cameras are Canon's as well so I knew the brand to be good.18 months and hundreds of pictures later it was the best camera purchase we have made! Not only does this camera take wonderful underwater pictures (and video) but it takes great pictures above water as well. The color straight off of camera is stunning, much more so than my DSLR or other point-and-shoot. Because of it's sturdiness it makes for a great camera to take along everywhere that an accident might happen (and I don't feel uncomfortable putting it in my purse or diaper bag). I'm even OK letting my young kids handle it!So far we've used this in the ocean a few times, our pool a handful of times, on the beach (my phone is now full of sand), and in other normal settings. It has been carried around in pockets, my purse, and our diaper bag and after all of this the camera is still functioning wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot D10 - Not so waterproof
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: Received my first Canon Powershot D-10 for Christmas 2009.....first used in Aug 2010....used it the 2nd time October 2010 (both times in swimming pools) and it leaked....luckily it was within the one year period and they couldn't repair it so Canon send me a brand new one (with only a 3 month warranty). New one only is now 15 months old and it leaked!  Very disappointed in this Canon product that can't hold up to use only a few times a year. From the other reviews I see this Camera model is a real lemon! Since it is out of warranty Canon wants $199 minimum to repair it!

Reviews.Title: Simply Not a Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: BI
Reviews.Content: I have owned two of this model of camera with the same result. After the 5th or 6th use, the camera took water on in the body (not gaskets). I maintained the camera as instructed, and did not use it rigorously (I was not snorkeling or taking underwater pictures per se, just dipping it in kayak bilge or slogging through waist deep water). The cameras took beautiful pictures in many light conditions, but did not hold up at all. Cannon offered to "replace" the cameras (out of warranty period) for half the cost of new ones. Not worth it to me, as I feared the same result.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Mick G
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and was a little worried about it leaking into the battery case but I have to say 2 months in and it works great. I used it both in a fresh water lake and in the ocean and it's giving me really cool pics. Trouble for me is that it has so many features I need my 12 year old to show me how to use it

Reviews.Title: Great Photo quality - used for snorkeling and scuba (up to 20 meters)
Reviews.Author: Marcos J. P. Vieira "Marcos JP"
Reviews.Content: Although tech info stated that maximum deep diving is 10 meters I used it twice on divings from 15 to 20 meters without any problems.  VERY GOOD quality photos/videos, easy to use, easy to change modes underwater, great pictures and also great utilization out of water.  I do recommend.  Even if you want something for pictures on the beach, this is a resistant and great option.  Some fantastic videos and pictures, great buy.Batteries are ok but when diving I recharged it every day.  Noticed that energy consuption is a bit bigger than similar "no diving" machines.

Reviews.Title: Perfect rough & tumble camera
Reviews.Author: RatMarie
Reviews.Content: I already had a real nice Cannon Rebel for everyday pictures, ie Kids Graduation, Games, sports, etc. But I wanted a less expensive camera to take to the lake, and camping. one I wasn't always worried about "ruining" with dirt and water.  I got this camera and gave it to my 11 year old and told him to go dunk it in the pool. The next day, I threw it into my aquiarium. Each time I took out the memory card and downloaded the pics onto Facebook for all my friends to see my silly pictures. I had fun with it!  I took it to the lake, and let it float around there while we swam and played.  I've dropped it several times, once on purpose in the house, and the rest was just me being a clutz.  I can't tell you how many times now I've opened the compartment to take out the memory card or to recharge the battery, and it still works like a champ.  I've had it now for almost 3 months and it's still rocking along. I do recommend getting the floating strap so when it dunks into a lake, it's easy to retrieve. I bought this one: Canon Floating Strap For Canon Powershot D10 Waterproof Camera -Blue/Black and it works like a charm with the camera.It is recommended to keep an eye on the seals where the battery is, so everytime I have made sure it's all still good before dunking it back in the water.Update:  After about 4 months, I'm happy to say that the camera is still working just as good as it did on the first day I received it.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: John J. Mattus "jack"
Reviews.Content: Just got camera for vacation in Ocmd, having great time with it, fun in the water and on the beach controls similar to our other cannon cameras

Reviews.Title: LOVEdD
Reviews.Author: MMF
Reviews.Content: The hit of the summer in this household - LOVED the underwater camera!  We are having a blast with it the hot weather.  Thanks for a quick easy purchase!

Reviews.Title: great camera but broke after 1 year
Reviews.Author: mp3 man "nam3pm"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this camera. The quality of photos are excellent, the underwater shots were great. BUt..after 1 year, it broke for no reason. The photos are now blurry and fuzzy and we have tried everything to try to fix it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for my family!!
Reviews.Author: IMA_critic
Reviews.Content: I got this camera on a gold box deal for way less than regular price.  Made it even more of a good deal!This camera takes great pictures both in and out of water.  Although I originally purchased it to take on canoe trips, we have been having such fun taking pictures in our pool in our backyard. It's great for getting up and close at the kids' swim meets also.  Never have to worry about getting the camera wet.I was extremely nervous the first time I put the camera under water!!  No worries though!! And I love that I can get great pictures with this camera and can save my more expensive camera for places that do not involve water.I have never had another waterproof camera, so I can't compare it to others, but it does what I want it to do. If you are planning on using the camera in places that involve water that is either dirty or deep, be sure you get a flotation strap for it.  That way if (when) you drop it in - or your canoe flips - it floats and you don't lose it to the bottom of the lake/creek/etc...

Reviews.Title: Leaked after 18 months
Reviews.Author: Mario Romualdo M. Costa "mrmcosta"
Reviews.Content: The camera leaked after 18 months when used under fresh water, 1m deep. The camera was sent to service. Authorized service in Brazil said that the equipment could not be repaired, since the parts were oxidised. The guarantee had already expired. They charge for sending back the camera to me. I am very disappointed. I didn't expect this from Canon.

Reviews.Title: Image Quality Poor
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: I'm a fisherman and so am out in nasty, ugly weather during low-light conditions frequently.  Consequently, my girlfriend thought that this would be a great camera for me and shelled out the cash for it, especially since I'd been using her hand-me-down, ancient Canon PowerShot 540 with pretty good success.  Anyway, bottom line, she should've kept the dough she blew on the D10, and I should've held onto the 540.  Why?  Image quality.  I continually have to fight with this camera to get a good, in-focus image.  Part of the problem is that the automatic functions do very poorly in low-light or really contrasting conditions - they either continually over- or underexpose the subject.  To address that, I now only use the manual modes, and I still have to constantly play with the light-metering function, the ISO speeds, the focus, etc to get an image that is focused correctly, with the right exposure, and that isn't blurry.  Particularly frustrating is the focus, which is extremely finicky and way too frequently does not focus on the subject even in daylight conditions.  In general, about 1 out of every 7 shots actually turns out well, which, from my persepctive, is unacceptable.  On the flip side, the camera is very durable - utterly frustrated with it one time, I lost my cool and slammed the thing to the ground.  Fortunately, or, perhaps, UNfortunately, the thing survived.  Suffice it to say, I'll be replacing this camera in the very new future.  Want mine?  You'll find it in the bottom of a lake very, very soon.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: imbubbasmom
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures, battery life is good, it has lots of features, and it is far better than the Sony we used to have. The fact that it's waterproof is an added bonus. The different modes are easy to toggle. I used the "snow" mode to take pictures at White Sands on a recent trip, and they came out great. Then we used the night mode to take pictures of a parade. Also? It's blue (my favorite color) and looks like a miniature retro submarine, which I love.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Pandas23
Reviews.Content: Love it for fishing & the beach! A+++If anything, we would like more zoom but it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Worst underwater camera ever
Reviews.Author: Alejobio
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera specifically to take underwater pictures in the sea. The camera didnt last more that 3 times in the water. First the screen went out, finally the camera stoped working. I know 3 more cameras with the same problem.  canon in Colombia doesnt have warranty, so i lost my money with this camera.

Reviews.Title: I Quit using my SLR! (A Professional's Opinion)
Reviews.Author: leiavoia
Reviews.Content: I haven't used my SLR and lenses in about 3 years since i bought this camera. It's very liberating to go on a trip or a hike and not have to carry all that gear around. I don't worry about gear anymore, and i don't worry about damaging the camera or where i take it. Raining? No problem. Snowy? Not concerned. Dropped the camera in the mud? It's okay, i'll just rinse it off. Need two hands? Fits in my pocket! I have this little guy and a spare battery and i'm ready for anything.I got this in 2009 for a vacation when it was newish on the market after a great deal of research. Since then it has been all over the world: Hawaii, New York, Texas, Oregon, Colombia, Costa Rica, Mexico. It's been in the ocean snorkeling, in the mountains in snow, zip-lining through jungles, wading through creeks and streams, and on many hiking trips. It's been dropped, bonked, plunged, crushed, and rained on so many times. It takes great pictures and it keeps going!PROS:- Goes where other cameras can't. This alone makes it worth the price.- Takes pretty darned good pictures for a point and shoot (this is from a professional who knows how to really scrutinize an image, too)- Turns on and off instantly. This is important because i usually turn it off in between shots to conserve battery power. It's instant-on as soon as i need to take another shot.- I can leave my SLR bag at home. This is really important if you travel carry-on only.- Battery lasts forever.- Excellent color and white balance.- Underwater!- Washable. Like, *in the sink*. How cool is that?CONS:- Shutter lag gets annoying. (Not a good action camera).- Bulky. (Newer model is better.)- Limited zoom range. (Because it's a fixed housing, it can't zoom too far in or out, but still a really good general purpose range. Newer model fixes this too.)- Image quality won't match an SLR CMOS sensor. Most people won't care, but professionals might. If I needed this professionally, I would go with an SLR. I only use it for trips though.- No auto-stitch panorama mode.- No full-manual settings (but it's not an SLR either, what were you expecting?)- Microphone picks up a lot of hand noise on videos.But overall: worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Beware!!
Reviews.Author: Melody Henderson "Cricuttown dot com"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last November to use on our family vacation to Hawaii.  It worked great and we got some great pictures with it.  It is a little bulkier than a normal camera, but overall it worked out just fine.  But here it is, June, not even a year after we purchased the camera and I am getting a lens error code everytime I turn on the camera.  I have taken extra good care of this camera and it has not been dropped or mistreated in any way.  I have been extrememly careful with making sure all the closures are completely closed before using it in water and then washing it off with tap water after being in the ocean.  I don't know why I would be getting this error.  I have no idea how common it is, but I'm not happy about this error at all....

Reviews.Title: D10 - great until it leaked
Reviews.Author: Anthony J. Hitchings
Reviews.Content: I used this on many action vacations, and regular travel, its such an easy camera to carry and use its captured a great many wonderful memories.  My only mistake was finally taking it snorkelling in salt water  for the first time in Tahiti in November 2011 - it leaked and the innards rusted in a heartbeat. Prior to this it suffered from old age and was getting the lens error message - though a good whack seemed to fix it.At its current price this camera is probably still worth buying.

Reviews.Title: Drowned within 6 months
Reviews.Author: M. Montani
Reviews.Content: We used this for two beach vacations.  It worked well while it lasted but it certainly isn't as rugged as some of the other products out there.  Thankfully on our last trip we brought a waterproof Olympus camera as a backup.  Although the Olympus was dated (8 MP camera, so at least a few years old) and the pictures weren't quite as good, at least it didn't drown like the Canon did!  I would not purchase the PowerShot D10 again.

Reviews.Title: Canon waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Shumowmow
Reviews.Content: This camera really works. We took it on our vacation to Turks and Caicos and it took a lot of abuse from the kids, sand, ocean and pool, never have a problem. Kids took it to snorkel, got some great pictures. Great camera for it's price.

Reviews.Title: Best all environment point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Dysoxic
Reviews.Content: Iv'e taken this camera everywhere from the jungles and reefs of Central America to the Black Rock Desert to the ski slopes of the Sierra Nevada and it has always performed admirably. Hot, cold, dusty, wet, dropped, landed on, and generally abused and still taking great pictures.One point of advice, spend the extra $10 and buy a spare battery, you'll be ticking of photos trigger happy style and may need the extra juice to finish the day/trip etc.Good Hunting!

Reviews.Title: very tough camera
Reviews.Author: rommel
Reviews.Content: canon is canon. the picture qualities are great. add that up with waterproof feature and you are worry free when you are going to the beach or going to water activities with family and friends.  It is also child proof as it can survive bumps and drops from the hands of my 2 year old daughter. Very good camera.  it is just too bulky to hold though and expensive.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Bs325ny
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best investment I've made. We've had it over a year now and can take it anywhere. It takes beautiful photos and videos, both underwater and above. We bought it as an underwater camera, but I find myself bringing it everywhere. It's great on vacation at the beach or pool. If you're afraid to bring your camera because it might be stolen while your swimming, you can just bring it in the water with you. It's gotten a small amount of water inside on 2 occasions due to improper closing (my fault.) But each time I just opened it up let it dry out and it began working again.

Reviews.Title: I'm excited
Reviews.Author: josie67
Reviews.Content: I went from 7 megapixels to this 12 megapixel camera and wow what a difference.  I take shots of the backyard near dusk and they come out bright without using a flash!  I'm loving the quality of the pictures and can't wait to use it underwater.  I took shots in my living room and the walls look so much brighter, it just astounds me what the camera catches.  I like the handle that you can move around depending on which way you want to hold the camera.  The one thing I have to get use to is setting the camera down, there really isn't a definitive flat spot.  It does sit upright but it isn't a "boxy" camera.  I usually download my pictures using Picassa 3 but I found that my videos were only coming across as a single picture.  I now have to download them using the gallery photo area which is fine because then I can just drag the video to my desktop and it is picked up by Picasso 3 with a problem.  I like all of the settings for close up pictures, fireworks, inside shots, etc...very nice.  I did have a Canon camera before so it was nice that some of the features were the same and already comfortable.

Reviews.Title: Excellent !!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Flores
Reviews.Content: the camara takes beautiful pic in and out of water. Clean images And videos, I must say its my favorite camera!

Reviews.Title: Pretty indestructable
Reviews.Author: Juliana A. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year and it's been pretty durable.  I took it to the Galapagos for three months where it encountered salt water, sand, sulfuric gas, and temperatures in excess of 110 degrees Fahrenheit.  I recently dropped it from about 4 feet onto a hard floor and it's still alive.It does have occasional lense malfunctions causing it to fail to turn on, this has been a reoccurring problem since about the third month I've had it, but it will eventually turn on if I give it about a dozen tries.  It also fogs up a bit resulting in blurry photos when it's about 100 degrees.  Overall considering what it has had to endure I see these as rather minor inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: Water damage twice over
Reviews.Author: spindoc11
Reviews.Content: I purchased my first Canon D10 during a vacation in Hong Kong two years ago. I intended to use it mostly for fishing and beach trips. Having read some reviews about the camera not making it out of the water alive, I was a bit wary so I diligently checked all compartments and seals prior to dipping it in water.  On the first trip, the camera conked out in waist-deep water. Luckily I was able to save the memory card. Shaking the camera, I could hear that it was quite filled-up with water. I had a $250 canteen. Unlucky was I to have received a lemon of a unit, I thought to myself. So I gave it a chance and got another unit in the Philippines.  It did quite well on fishing trips where it withstood rainy conditions, wet hands and a few splashes here and there. That was until I took it to the beach recently.  After making sure everything was properly closed and sealed, I took the camera to chest-deep water and snapped a few photos of friends. While reviewing the photos, the screen just went crazy as photos in the memory card flashed at a mile a minute before the camera conked out and failed to start from thereonin.  Two Canon D10 lemons in a row.  Canon PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD

Reviews.Title: Camera Failed.  Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Cuica Maracas
Reviews.Content: I bought this for rigorous outdoor use.  However, it failed on me during our not so rigorous trip to China right after I bought it.  I got an error message that would not clear.  In the end I concluded that the problem was related to the mechanics of the lense or motor that would zoom it in and out.  I was able to get it to work again by careful tapping that seemed to free up the lense.  Bottom line, I returned it and Amazon was cooperative and then purchased a waterproof Panasonic that I am as delighted with as I was disappointed with this unit,  Form factor of Panasonic is superior as well and far far less bulky.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Royce
Reviews.Content: After purchasing a few other cameras claiming to be good at underwater photos -- along with reading what seems like 1,000 reviews -- I finally decided to give this camera a try. We purchased it just before going on a vacation to Hawaii in mid-January and decided to use this as our only camera for our activities -- snorkeling, luau, beach trips, etc. Overall, we were very pleased with the results. I've uploaded a couple of the underwater shots we took while snorkeling in Hanauma Bay so you can see the image quality. I even made a short movie while snorkeling, and despite what some of the negative reviews might say, this camera does record sound (you can hear me breathing underwater through the mask).In other settings, the camera did well, too. Like most digital cameras, you lose some focus when you zoom to close to things or in very low light. Overall, though, in a variety of settings this camera took some great photos, much better than one would expect for a camera at this price. One thing I would recommend is take the camera off of the auto mode and experiment with the different mode options for photos and video. If you're trying to take a photo of something in low light from 40 feet away, the auto mode is going to try to use the flash and you're going to end up with a dark, out-of-focus photo. Try the ISO 3200 mode for those kinds of shots. Take the time to play with the camera and figure out everything it can do.

Reviews.Title: Great pics while it lasted!
Reviews.Author: Whydontthingworkastheyshould
Reviews.Content: We were on a 2nd beach adventure with our new camera... it worked great on its first beach adventure...beautiful pics - land and underwater...But somehow while swimming with the turtles in the middle of the camera's 2nd vaca, the camera just decided to stop working. The lens wouldn't open or close, the camera wouldn't turn on or off and we were very upset because we were missing great photo opps on our snorkel and scuba trip...next time we'll buy a cheap disposable camera. The return policy already expired with Amazon so we'll have to go through all the hassle and costs of having Canon repair our camera now. We assume water leaked in somewhere but we can't find anything...Funny thing is when we switched our media card into our regular camera, the water cam had actually been working and taking pics even though we couldnt see it or hear it working! Crazy! Bottom line: very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Great Photos
Reviews.Author: rbgilbert
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these two years and it took great photos. Unfortunately, it was stolen in July 2011. I ordered another, even though it has several new competitors. The new D10 still takes great photos and they've added image stabilization. It's also miserly with battery power - I mean the battery lasts a long time. It still doesn't have HD video, but that's a small sacrifice.It is, as they claim, waterproof and dustproof.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: nhoJ
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Camera. Easy to learn on. Functional and versatile, even with multiple users.  Very tough and waterproof, not just for water sports but in the real world. Only downside, wish it had greater zoom. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Excelent camera, 100% recommend it
Reviews.Author: Lizzy Schone
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!! the colors in the images are perfect, the excellent quality, also excellent quality under water!The only "but" its the size, that you can't put it in your pocket because its big, but if you take it hanging in your hand or in a bag its perfect!5 stars

Reviews.Title: Tough enough for adventures with kids!
Reviews.Author: Katarzyna Tomaszewska "Kathy"
Reviews.Content: It's one of those cameras that you could take everywhere you go with the kids - even on the waterslides!  Now I can follow my kids everywhere and not worry that the water or sand will damage my camera.  I take a lot of pictures everyday and I went through many cameras already, they don't last me more than a year.  This one so far I had it for a few months, kids dropped it already twice on the pavement and it is still working great.  I am afraid to take it underwater though because of some reviews but I am fine with it because water splashes don't do damage, that's all I need.  My one complaint is that there is no lens cover,so I got to remember to keep wiping off the fingerprints, water drops, etc. I'm glad that the lens is scratch resistent!  I had an expensive camera that the kids scratched the lens just a little and that was it, had to throw it out).  Picture quality is great, I like the auto setting "kids & pets."  Finally a great camera for the mothers!!

Reviews.Title: Best Underwater Camera ( for less than a thousand dollars)
Reviews.Author: Karen Stewart
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 3 years now and it is amazing - on land or sea. I went to the Caribbean with a group of friends - me with my Canon and two others had Olympus underwater cameras - my pictures turned out so much better and not due to anything I did (other than buy the right camera). The color and clarity of my pictures are amazing. The Olympus can't compete.

Reviews.Title: Canon D10
Reviews.Author: T. Pham
Reviews.Content: The camera is delivered on schedule, it is really a waterproof unit, I left the whole unit in the fish tank for 20 hours, It still working fine.So far I did not like the quality of the picture yet.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot D10
Reviews.Author: just me
Reviews.Content: I have found this camera to take beautiful pictures, great videos, but is a little bulky.  This camera has almost as many settings as many larger more expensive cameras.  have not used it in water yet.  will do so when I go to Florida this winter and snorkel.  I am pleased with it so far as I am with my other Canon cameras.

Reviews.Title: Must have for vacations and children!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Addict
Reviews.Content: Water Ride...no proplem, on the lake....don't worry, your child wants to take pictures....let them!!!  I have used this camera, in the water, underwater, in the rain, at boy scout camp, on vacation, everywhere!  I bought the Chums Waterproof Camera Float for it so when my son (11) wants to use it I don't have to worry about him dropping it and the camera ending up at the bottom of the lake.  I will gave it to him and his friends to take pictures at camp and didn't worry about him dopping it because it's very durable!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD
Reviews.Author: viet tran
Reviews.Content: It's so reliable and nice product.I did throw it in my fish tank for theovernight. Next day, in the water, I turned on the camera and took some pictures of my fish, the flash was working well, the pictures were awsome.

Reviews.Title: More than I expected
Reviews.Author: accordiangirl53
Reviews.Content: What a great little camera.  The clearity of the photo's was more than I expected.  I would say it is definitely worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: Worked for just over a year, then leaked water
Reviews.Author: AFWife2002
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera for the first year I owned it. I will always own a "tough" camera from now on. I never had to worry about it accidentally getting wet or dropped. That said, I did not abuse this camera, but after about a year of use it started acting up. After the first "episode" it began working again for about a month more. Then I could actually see that water had leaked behind the LCD and since then it hasn't turned on.  I like Cannon, but I'm thinking about buying the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS3 as a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for everyday use, and underwater or climbing
Reviews.Author: rmblack
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome.  It works great for a regular walk around camera, with a bit of extra bulk so if you drop it it won't break, like most cameras.  It works great underwater too, and much less expensive than a dslr casing :P

Reviews.Title: Fantastic photos under water, acceptable above
Reviews.Author: Joshua Graessley
Reviews.Content: This point and shoot isn't compact as others, but it is water proof and it takes good photos under water. The key is to use the underwater mode so the white balance is decent. Unfortunately, the video resolution is limited and there is no underwater video mode, so the underwater video comes out very blue. It may be possible to fix this in post processing, but I don't think most tools like iMovie make it easy to fix this. The other super annoying "feature" is that the flash switches back to "auto" ever time you turn the camera on. A flash in slightly murky water leads to an interesting-only-in-the-first-shot twinkling star effect. All the bits of junk floating in the water reflect the light of the flash and you get lots of burned out tiny spots instead of murky water.I bought two of these (one for my wife and one for myself) before we left for Hawaii. I originally looked in to a case for my DSLR, but those were well over $1000. For significantly less than that, I was able to purchase two of these cameras and my wife and I both got to take oodles of photos of fish, rays, eels, turtles and even a seal.Overall, a fantastic underwater camera. Nicely done Canon. If you don't ever intend to take photos underwater, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Best all around camera
Reviews.Author: BERRY SPIVEY
Reviews.Content: I am the WORST person in the world for equipment. I droped stuff all the time or I forget where I leave it. My friends know if I own something for a couple years and it last, buy some stock!  I have dropped this camera hundreds of times. Boat docks, cement stairs, asphalt. It works great. I have left it under gloves over the defroster of my truck in the wintertime here in Alaska and have forgot where I put it. So it goes from burning hot to freezing cold. No problem. I have dove over its limit 30 some times and it has never failed. The only problem is at about 80feet, you cant change the settings, the pressure is too much. But its only rated for 33 feet I believe. I use it for everything. It stays in the boat in the summer, truck in winter. It goes on every vacation and every dive. Its the best!!Berry Spivey, Kodiak Alaska

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera
Reviews.Author: L. Heath "Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for underwater photography while snorkeling in Australia and couldn't be happier with its results. The buttons are all large enough to use underwater without even looking at the camera. The screen can be a little hard to see in certain light, but I think this would be a problem for all cameras without a viewfinder underwater. I took a large number of photos in various lighting conditions and the overall quality was good and color rendition was excellent. I didn't take any dry land photos (have a DSLR for that!), but I am sure they would be great too. I was very careful to follow the rinsing instructions and had no problem with operation or waterproofing. The wrist strap was very handy and made me feel confident about not losing the camera and its ruggedness made me comfortable carrying it in and out of boats, off rocky shores, etc. It is larger than some other underwater cameras, but I think that is good since I have large hands and don't want to fumble with small buttons, especially while in cold water or wearing gloves. Overall, an excellent camera for underwater photography!

Reviews.Title: cannon lover
Reviews.Author: jat49erfan
Reviews.Content: so far I really like the cannon d10.  I am not sure how to use everything on it yet, but am excited to learn.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Native Texan Stuck in Utah
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on Amazon.com in August 2010 to use for a Hawaii snorkeling trip.  I have been delighted with the quality of the pictures it takes!  The pics aren't as sharp as those taken using my large SLR camera, but for the price it does a great job, is easy to use, produces decent quality pictures and is just perfect for snorkeling or just goofing around in a pool, lake or river.  I unfortunately lost it in Lake Powell due to a poor quality wrist strap (Pentax Floating Wrist Strap model number 88206 / ASIN B001Q5Q62Y - if you are looking for a wrist strap for your waterproof camera do NOT buy that one!).  Because I liked this camera so much I do plan to buy another to replace the one I lost in the lake, but will most certainly purchase a different strap to secure it!

Reviews.Title: Nearly indestructible
Reviews.Author: BH
Reviews.Content: Just a great camera all the way around.  We have dragged this thing on dozen of trips to four continents over the past two years and it still works and looks great.  Nearly indestructible.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot D10 Camera
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our trip to the Carribean and it worked Great!!!  It took great pictures in and out of the water.  No problems at all, and it was pretty easy to use.  I highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: It leaked but I love it anyway.
Reviews.Author: sandra andrews
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera knowing that some people had issues with leaks. We were extra careful and checked it in a bowl of water before ever taking it outside. Sure enough, there was a tiny bit of water in the USB port. I called the manufacturer and they offered to fix it if I would send it in (no repair shops within driving range).My husband believes that whenever you send something in for repair they send you a refurbished model, so we didn't want to do that. The camera takes really great photos (colors look amamzing!) so we also didn't want to return it either.After much research, I stumbled upon someone who said they had the same problem with the USB port, and he had filled in that port with silicon and never had another problem.Obviously, this is not the best answer and it definitely voids the warranty, but aside from this one problem, the camera is awesome. Great photos, decent videos and the battery lasts forever. You don't need access to the USB port because the battery and SD card slots are in a different part of the camera, so we filled in the USB with silicon and haven't regretted keeping the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for my adventures
Reviews.Author: Laura Leenderts
Reviews.Content: Update:  I've had my Cannon Powershot for about 14 months now and it's done some traveling.  I'm still seeing very good picture quality in a lot of different settings and no troubles when it's been underwater, out in the snow, or on a dusty trail.  I did notice after a beach trip that sand gets into crevices so I either need to clean it good or check that the batter/card cover is fully latched (and waterproof).  Mr. detruction is now 3 and has not managed to break this camera.  I would recommend this camera to people who are 1) adventurous, 2) not careful with their electronics, and/or 3) parents to small children.  So far, this camera was money well-spent!Original:  I've had my Cannon Powershot D10 for about 3 months.  It has been 4-wheeling, hiking, swimming, boating, and camping.  It has also been to weddings, parties, and chasing children.  I have been very happy with the photo quality - sometimes even amazed at how good my pictures turn out.  I am not a photographer - I am a point-and-shoot-picture-taker.  This camera has required no skill on my part, just an adventure to tag along on.  I have not had great luck with previous cameras - either too slow at capturing the moment or very inconsistent quality.  So far, the D10 has not left me dissapointed.  Upcoming adventures for the D10 are an ocean vacation and snowmobiling.  I am confident it can handle whatever I dish out - and hopefully whatever my 2-year old puts it through!

Reviews.Title: water proof is a must
Reviews.Author: online shopperrrrr
Reviews.Content: Pros: water proof, water proof, water proof! I took the camera out to the river this weekend and it was around my wrist the entire time. In and out of water, the adjustable strap kept it secure on my wrist. I've owned multiple canon's, so already knowing the functions was a pro for me.Cons: Photos are only ok, though they're much better than my Powershot SD 780 IS. The camera is pretty thick. I joked that it is my obese camera.Overall, I absolutely love it. One less star for the shape and photo quality.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof? ...But Not Moisture Condensation-Proof NOT FOR THE TROPICS
Reviews.Author: A. Benjamin "Silent Thunder"
Reviews.Content: Not a bad camera if you use it for the pool in the US.  But if you go to the Far East where there is a lot of humidity, the camera is a HUGE failure. Humidity-induced condensation got into the front protective glass and fogged the upper half quadrant of the lens.This is a poor... and I mean poor performing waterproof camera as water proof should also mean humidity-induced-condensation-proof.

Reviews.Title: Awesome pictures
Reviews.Author: R. Cullen
Reviews.Content: I got this for my husband for his birthday. We live on a small island and often go snorkeling.  We used it the day we got it and we were both very pleased with how well it works.  Even our children were able to take nice photos with it.  We are now able to share with our family in the states the ocean life we get to see each time we go to the beach and snorkeling.The only thing I have to say that I don't like is how long it takes after you take a photo, to be able to take another one.

Reviews.Title: Love my new water camera
Reviews.Author: peso20
Reviews.Content: If you spend your weekends, summers or holidays out by water, I highly recommend this camera.  It's perfect!  Even if you don't spend time taking pics out by water, it's still a great camera....It's better to be safe if it's on the counter and a drink is spilled...No Worries!  Quality of pictures are awesome....Get one, you should have it!

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Meagan N. Strouse "guilingverity"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera initially because it had the best reviews for the money.  I owned a Canon Powershot previously that I broke by dropping and destroying the lens, so this time around I wanted something that was less me-sensitive (aka can take a little more banging around), and so far this camera has come through for me!  I've taken it underwater several times and in salt water, and have had no trouble with water under the screen or any other leakages.  I always double check the seals before jumping in and I always rinse with fresh water when I'm done.  It takes decent pics whether you are underwater or on dry land.  My only complaint would be that action photos are hard to take, but that's to be expected with a point and shoot designed to not short out under up to 33ft of water.In summary: loving it!  I get lots of comments on how great the photos look, especially under water.

Reviews.Title: Canon waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: B Mount
Reviews.Content: Love the camera. Took great pictures in the Bahamas. Easy to use. My only complaint is the way the straps hook to the camera and also there is no protector for the lens. I had to order additional corner connectors at $17 a piece from Canon to use a neck strap. No problems with it being waterproof. I did follow directions to soak it after using in saltwater. The videos also came out great.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof digital? Yes, please!
Reviews.Author: K. A. Cadena
Reviews.Content: I rented this camera for a week-long trip to Puerto Rico to use primarily while snorkeling, sea kayaking and on the beach. It was phenomenal at everything I wanted it to be good at - captured the beautiful blues and greens of the Caribbean, was very easy to use - even underwater, did a decent job capturing action shots in the water - such as surfing, jumping in waves, etc., and was sturdy - I accidentally whacked it pretty hard against a rock when I slipped walking through tide pools and it took it like a champ. I'd absolutely rent the camera again and if I lived in an area where I had reason to use an underwater camera more regularly, would not hesitate to purchase this great little waterproof point & shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Surpassed expectations.
Reviews.Author: Justin Hosmer "Old Skool"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and took it on two scuba dive trips in Cabo San Lucas. I exceeded the depth limit of the camera by 15+ feet and was still taking pictures with no problems. I think it's a great camera for capturing those moments nobody else can appreciate unless they were there. Read the other reviews and judge for yourself, but in my opinion Canon has made this camera pretty solid. Happy diving!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Vernon
Reviews.Content: I was little concerned buying something like this off the internet. I always like to take a look at it but I was pleasntly surprised. We live in Japan and we go snorkeling a lot. It was surprising easy to use underwater and fast to. There wasn't a delay once you pressed the button to take a picture. It's got all kinds of settings so it's easy to get a good picture underwater or wherever you are.

Reviews.Title: So fun!
Reviews.Author: Meagan Lohin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in anticipation of my honeymoon that took place in June 2011. We went to Maui and went snorkeling quite a bit. People looked at us funny sometimes for having a camera out while swimming but we knew we were ok. I read an number of reviews before deciding to take the plunge and try it out. We made sure to bring a back up camera on the trip and to have an SD card specifically for that camera and not with pictures of our entire trip. We were careful to always rinse the camera off in fresh water after having it out in the ocean and to make sure it was completely clean and dry before opening the compartments. We never had a problem with taking pictures in the water and the camera is still working after being in and out of the water several times over the week spent in Maui. I would highly recommend this camera. It made swimming and snorkeling really fun and it was nice not to have to worry about the camera getting splashed when out on a boat. I would highly recommend this camera! One of the guys that worked a stand at our resort saw the camera and told us how well it worked for people he knew as well. So take the negative reviews with a grain of salt - treat your camera well in and out of the water and you will not regret this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great product but does not float
Reviews.Author: Jm
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera for a sailing and snorkeling trip to Keys. i would definitely recommend this camera and buy again. You should definetly buy a floating strap as if not for my daughters snorkeling ability I would have lost in ten feet of water

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: K Zwick
Reviews.Content: Love this camera ... tried a Panasonic first and it stopped working after first dip in the pool.  This works wonderfully ... great pictures, even have great shots mid jump.  Highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good for casual use.
Reviews.Author: Jon Beard
Reviews.Content: I've been eyeballing this camera as a potential camera to take snorkeling, kayaking, biking, and other places where my big SLR just isn't suited for. And, I guess it's better than not having a camera in those situations. It's very convenient, but the photos aren't stellar. It's also missing a bunch of features that the earlier PowerShot family had - the ability to shoot RAW, a built-in intervalometer, the ability to choose manual settings. I guess I'd recommend this camera to my mom as an easy to use underwater P&S;, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who is interested in photography.

Reviews.Title: The best underwater Point & Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Steve Martin M "SN"
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my Cancun Trip. It is very useful for last 2 rainy days. Picture quality can compare with the SLR results.I took some outdoor Mayan Ruin pictures during raining without a problem while some of my friends needed to cover their cameras not to get wet.I used Olympus underwater camera last year but the picture quality is not as good as Canon.I got good underwater pictures and outdoor pictures of my family.Canon point & shoot has a lot of still picture exposure control that has only in pro and semi pro camera.(Not included in most of the point & shoot camera)If you don't know these features, auto and program did everything.Video quality shows some noise under low light conditions. No special program for underwater video but still picture does.For its price, I recommend this camera for underwater photos and videos.

Reviews.Title: An Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: MadHatterNJ "Nat"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It takes clear shots and zooms in well. It is also durable, so it will survive being banged against the wall or banister while hanging on your wrist. However, when not using it, I would take it off my wrist and put it in my bag.This camera is very user friendly. It has useful options such as automatic face detection, and will adjust to your surroundings. For example, it will automatically turn flash on at night.The only problem I had was once, when I was testing the camera right on the surface of the water, it glitched and the screen went fuzzy.(I restarted it and it went back to normal.  ) That doesn't happen anymore. Also, when your camera's memory starts becoming full, it will have " lens errors" and shut down.Overall, this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: 66 ft deep
Reviews.Author: Janetk
Reviews.Content: I bought this to go on a trip, worried about getting my "nice" camera wet. I took it SCUBA diving, I thought it might make the depth and if not I wasn't out that much money. This little guy went to 66 ft with me. Two separate dives all kinds of great shots, the others on the dive boat were fascinated. It also took great shots on land, at the beach in full sun and even overcast.It is oddly shaped, but not unbearably so. Easy to charge the battery and the functions are pretty simple.

Reviews.Title: Super waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: This camera was exactly what I was looking for--namely a rugged camera that I could take on a boat or to the beach, take those "once in a lifetime" pictures, and could be easilly toted along. The picture quality is excellent, as long as you remember to wait while pressing the button down halfway in order to let the camera focus. If you don't do this everytime, about only half of the pictures will be in focus. Its other weakness is that it is a little bigger and bulkyer then my previous PowerShot camera. But if you remember these points, the camera will let you get those priceless shots during your big adventures.

Reviews.Title: I liked it but...
Reviews.Author: Y
Reviews.Content: I bought the D10 15 months ago for about three hundred and really enjoyed it, until last week when the LCD screen went blank and never came back, 3 months after the 1 year warranty expired. So yes while the rest of it works and I can theoretically still use it to take pictures, there is no eyepiece viewfinder and so everything would be a guessing game (unacceptable). Until then, I took a ton of water shots in the pool and it seemed completely durable and nearly indestructible. The picture quality, colors and shutter lag were pretty good for a compact camera, and highly preferred in every possible way to my only older Sony DSC-T50 Sony Cybershot DSC-T50 7.2MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Silver). But, I just got a replacement Panasonic DMC-TS3Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS3 12.1 MP Rugged/Waterproof Digital Camera with 4.6x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue) and holy crap that is such a sweeter machine! Looking back at the D10, it seems a little dated and definitely much heavier and too bulky to fit into a shirt or pants pocket. For about the same price, I would recommend the Panasonic now.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've owned
Reviews.Author: Sarah Wiggers
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. I've had it for two years now it's certainly going strong. Once you get used to changing the settings to get the best pictures it's kind of addicting. The pictures turn out sharp. I take it with me floating down the river with friends. We attach the float strap and it just makes it's way down letting people grab it, take a picture, toss it to the next guy or just drop it back in the water for the next person to pick it up. A great way to get a different persective without worring about what's going to happen to your camera. I take it with me snowbarding since I don't worry about it getting wet or beat up. I've taken videos of myslef going down the mountain and some of me crashing with no damage to the camera. I took it on a seven month vacation accross Europe. It endured more snowboarding, heat and durt from farming, and plenty of Irish rain. How many cameras do you pull out in the rain and don't even blink? Not to mention all the clear shots through the water. Half way through our trip my boyfriend stopped using his camera and we just relied on mine because the pictures just turned out better. Now he's been trying to buy it off me but I won't give it up. Plain and simple if you want a versitle, quailty camera without shelling out a couple paychecks get this guy. Besides you can go more places and do more with it.

Reviews.Title: Best waterproof camera out there
Reviews.Author: SueE "SueE"
Reviews.Content: After much research online, I bought this camera.  The customer reviews seemed to be the best.  I wish the zoom buttons were easier. I have to look every time to see which is zoom in and which is zoom out.  Wonderful, bright, sharp and colorful pics with this camera.  Amazing in a pool.  Good in the ocean.  It's so great to not worry about getting your camera wet!

Reviews.Title: FAR BETTER PIC QUALITY THAN EXPECTED
Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: Bought camera for Key West Snorkeling trip.  The quality of the pictures both underwater and above were so good, that this has now turned into the camera that I take everywhere. I have a digital SLR and a point and shoot, the ease of the D10 has now replaced those two cameras! Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Finally a great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Estupinan Rodriguez Jose David "JDE"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for taking pictures in my recent Orlando trip, thinking on take it to the waterparks. I'm so very happy with tjis camera, pictures are just perfect, we took the camera inside all pools and played with it all day long. At the end of the day, we passed the pics and videos to my Ipad and had the best time.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot D10
Reviews.Author: Gary W. Elmore Jr.
Reviews.Content: Great cameras. We have 2 of them that go on all our trips. Great pictures and very durable cameras. Excellent pics underwater as well. Hard to beat these.

Reviews.Title: All weather... and something more.
Reviews.Author: Pablo Miranda Barroso "Pablo M. B."
Reviews.Content: A camera truck. I always use it when the weather gets a little hard ...Their optical properties are very good, always thinking what you have and paid for.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but some bugs
Reviews.Author: Willaton
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for about 1 year.  I got it because I wanted to take on a cruise and use when snorkeling.  The camera is easy to use and does a good job on auto selection the mode, except for low light, where you need to change and it works great.The only issue I have is in some setting I get the odd lines (single multi color)that appear to be random on the LCD and on the pictures.  I have had it sent in for repair and still happens I have to assume it is some kid of bug that happens when taking pictures with certain colors.It work great most of the time!

Reviews.Title: Durable little camera
Reviews.Author: kurt vidal
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to take scuba diving in Cozumel.  I had read reviews indicating no problems with the camera down to 65 feet.  I can verify no problems at that depth.  However, I inadvertently took it on a dive that went to 95 feet.  At that depth the camera did function but recorded some pretty pchyidelic photos.  After coming up the camera would turn on but LCD wouldn't work and it wouldn't take a shot.  I noticed water spotting on back side of LCD and inside the lense.  I opened the battery door and left the camera sit for 7 days and guess what...it still works!  Like I said pretty tuff little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: JJ "L-I-V-I-N"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because a friend of ours had it and the pictures always came out bright, focused and nice. We do a lot of water activities and it's nice to have something to take along that you don't have to worry about getting wet.One downfall, I was in Hawaii and on the first day in the water snorkeling, the LCD display quit working. I could hear the camera functioning so continued to take photos for the rest of the trip. Luckily, all of those turned out pretty well for just pointing and guessing. But the great thing was that I was still under warranty, followed the Canon repair instructions, sent it in on a Friday and by the next Tuesday I had received a brand new camera. Unluckily I ended up taking many of my Hawaii pics with my iPhone instead of with my nice camera but I so have it for another day. I did not see any wet in either of the openings so I'm not sure if water got in and did something to the LCD display or if it was just an odd coincidence that it stopped working underwater. No explanation from Canon, just a note that they don't do repairs on this model. I will be sure to triple-check the seals next time before I go in the water though.

Reviews.Title: Great Point-and-Shoot Quality
Reviews.Author: S. Bailey
Reviews.Content: I purchased this so I would not have to mess with a bulky waterproof case for my regular point-and-shoot.  I have a Canon SD780is and this D10 to use at the beach, waterparks, etc.  I have been using the same memory card, just switching it between the cameras.  I was fully expecting my beach shots, where I used this camera, to be lower quality than the photos at dinner where I used the 780.  Not so, I can't tell which was taken where, they both look great.  And the underwater photos I took are beautiful- very crisp.  If you are satisfied with the quality of a good point-and-shoot, you will not be disappointed in this camera.  I took this camera zip-lining, and had it on and around my neck through several water landings with no leakage problems at all.  So far I have not run out of battery life.  It is bigger and heavier than my compact point-and-shoot, but not near the bulk of a Canon waterproof case (which does work really well, just inconvenient IMO).  I am very happy with the camera so far-  I have had it for one month.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Texas Native
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great above and below water photos AND videos.  It even took pictures VERY well on a nighttime dive with manta rays.  It has the fastest "on" time of any point-and-shoot camera I've seen.  My only complaint is that it doesn't do well in low-light situations.  The pictures are blurry.  The videos are great, too, although you might have to convert them from the Quicken .mov format.  When my camera broke after 2 months, I mailed it in to the repair center, and they had a new refurbished one in the mail to me in 2 days.  They even returned, in a separate envelope, the scissors that I had accidentally mailed to them with the broken camera!  BE SURE to also buy a flotation strap for the camera as you leave the store!  It's fun to throw the camera to your friends while you're in the water.  You can also choose which of the 4 corners on the camera that you attach your strap.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot D10
Reviews.Author: gh
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Even in bright sunlight you can clearly see the image in the viewfinder. The auto focus works great. The strap can be positioned in four different places.

Reviews.Title: Canon D10 Review
Reviews.Author: Shirley Forgett
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, it takes great pictures and is extremly durable.  It is a little bulky but not a big issue it has to be to offer the protection.  The only thing that I took a little time to adjust to, was the zoom features.  I am not used to using my thumb for this.  But all in all this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon D 10 on the Galapagos
Reviews.Author: zzzz-nurse
Reviews.Content: What a great camera.  I took it to the Galapagos Islands for a a hiking, snorkeling trip.  Not only did this camera perfrom magnificently, but the pics came out great.  I am a point and shoot guy, I don't do F stop, none of that and this camera did it all. While it is very easy to use and the menu's are fairly easy to navigate, there is a bit of cumbersome-ness to flipping thru them until you are familiar with them. I had absolutely no trouble w/ the seals on the camera for water tightness.  I was only snorkeling, but managed to dive to 15 or so feet for some of my pics. Its also hot in Ecuador this time of year, (imagine that) and I was sweating bullets, so it was nice to be able to just rinse off the camera at the end of the day and after being in the sea.  The write time to the card is good (transcend 16gb class 10 card). Battery life was good, but will decrease with lots of zoom... buy the extra and keep it charged for any trips... movie function is good, although it would have been nice to have a higher def.  Speaking of the zoom... it was very, very good.... 3 x zoom was great, I found that I could hold the camera steady enough even up to about 5-6 X digital zoom and still take clear pix.  Going much higher than that on the zoom required a rest however, that is not unexpected though. The portability of this camera is decent, its a little more bulky than the other point and shoot cameras, but the extra bulk goes into the shock proofness of this camera.  I was literally sprinting thru the airport to catch my flight home, and this camera bounced out of my bag and onto the uncarpeted, marble type floor of the Miami airport with no ill effects except a slight scratch to the outer case. I had no trouble keeping this camera in a cargo pocket in my shorts.  I'm very happy with this camera.  You can also check out professional reviews on [...].  The reviews there were the main reason I purchased this camera.

Reviews.Title: Its Handy
Reviews.Author: Wonderboom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after one of my friends showed me his. I was impressed then by its waterproof abilities. I often snorkel and would enjoy taking underwater photos from now on. Coming Easter holiday I am off to the Ningaloo reef in Western Australia and plan to take the camera with me for some holiday snaps above and under water.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Canon Makes
Reviews.Author: jaldeborgh "jaldeborgh"
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera Canon makes for the average user.  It works well in almost any situation.  I have owned this camera for almost 2 years - since it first came out.  It has travelled the world and seen every type of environmental challenge and met them without issue.  The underwater performance is amazing and you can swim with it for hours.  My kids have taken it to Greece and St. John island and swum for hours with any problems.  The performance of the camera outside the water is amazing as well.  It is as easy to use as any Canon camera and the case design is very rugged which is one major reason why I like the camera so much - it is basically almost indestructible.  If you want a camera that does it all with minimal compromises this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: loved the camera
Reviews.Author: lee08br
Reviews.Content: loved this camera and the pictures, it takes.didn't like the size of it, too bigshould be smaller

Reviews.Title: great little waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: chadw
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to take to Cozumel and it works great.  It's a little big compared to most point and shoot cameras these days, but it still fits in your pocket.  Took it on a couple of dives around 40 feet down and the pictures and videos were great.  Rated to 33 feet, but had no problems with the water-proofing at 40.  On land it takes great pictures, and the video is good but not outstanding.  Overall I would recommend for outdoor & water environment use.

Reviews.Title: Not just for underwater
Reviews.Author: annb
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip on which I expected to do some snorkeling, and on which I expected to have some rainy days. It was easy to get used to, although not quite as compact as my previous camera. The lens does not contract. Not only did the camera perform well for underwater shots, it turned out to be very useful in other ways. At one point I had a boat ride, with spray and the occasional wave coming over the side. I was able to keep right on taking pictures! Often we disembarked from the cruise ship in Zodiacs, with the possibility of a dunking, but I had no fears for my camera. Heavy tropical downpours soaked through my backpack, melted my cough drops, but the camera was just fine. I also found it handy to hold just below the surface while wading along the beach. So even if you aren't a snorkeler, this is a great camera for the outdoors. I got some nice shots of sea urchins in that way. I already had another Canon camera, not waterproof, with very similar controls, so that may be part of the reason this camera was so easy for me to use immediately. I noticed several  improvements in the interface over my previous camera, including changing the position of the Erase option so one is less likely to accidentally loose a picture. There are lots of features, and you will want to consult the user manual, if only to avoid activating something accidentally. The battery/SD card chamber seals very well, and in fact the camera won't turn on if you haven't got it shut properly, a good safety feature. I sometimes had to squeeze the door shut to get a proper seal, although I couldn't have told by looking that it wasn't sealed, so I like that feature. Also, I had one panic when I could not get it open, after moving from high altitude back to sea level. It had really sealed tight! But I was able to pry the door open, once I realized the problem. I got very good photos and short videos, including one of a chameleon snapping up an insect. I loved my old camera, but this one has now taken first place!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: S. Scott "goofy girl"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great little travel companion.  It worked well under water, and the photos were really good both above and below the water.  Not great at low light, but it might be operator error since I usually wiggle.

Reviews.Title: mighty blue camera!
Reviews.Author: lizzie demarco
Reviews.Content: bought this for a trip to playa del carmen. used it in the ocean the pool and sailing. it's as tight as a drum and takes great pics. it's a little bigger than my other camera but still doable to take along!

Reviews.Title: on number 3
Reviews.Author: jeniphur
Reviews.Content: I got this camera from x-mas 2009... before the warranty was up, Canon replaced the camera twice; due to water damage inside the camera!!! I took the camera snorkeling and kayaking, and followed the care directions to the letter. Being as I live in Hawaii, I used the camera more for underwater activities than an average user from middle America. I really don't find this to be a valid excuse for Canon. I am an avid photographer, all my camera's and lenses are Canon, they usually rock! This product is plain substandard.If you want something that you only take underwater once a year - I think this camera will work out for you... If not look somewhere else... If you do end up finding a good underwater point and shoot please let me know!

Reviews.Title: all conditions
Reviews.Author: J Kong
Reviews.Content: I bought this Canon to compliment my 7D and take it into conditions where it's just not feasible to use a dslr or even my camera phone. The D10 fits the build. The one area that is lacking is no HD video.

Reviews.Title: Function over form
Reviews.Author: G. Lee
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for a year and a half and mostly use it to make videos while snowboarding in the Colorado Rockies.  The buttons are nice and big, making it very easy to use even with thick gloves on.  It has done well being tossed around in the snow, with no problems with water leakage at all.  The D10 is also very shock resistant- I had it in my front coat pocket while barreling down the mountain at a high speed, caught a tree trunk, and landed very hard on top of the camera.  Not a single scratch on the D10, but the tough little gadget did end up breaking my rib.I recently took this thing to Greece for several weeks and used it extensively underwater as well.  Excellent photos; no water leaks.If you can get over the unfortunate fact that this camera looks ridiculous and is cumbersome to carry around, it is a great purchase.  I looked at all the waterproof cameras (especially the Panasonic) before buying this one and ultimately decided that overall image quality was the most important consideration for me.  I've been completely happy with my purchase and look forward to many more rib-busting days on the ski slopes.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera!
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera prior to going to Cozumel, Mexico in January of 2011.My husband was extremely pleased with the picture quality.  He used it snorkeling in 10-30 feet, and got great shots!  We were careful to follow the instructions to soak the camera after each use in tap water, and never had a problem.  It also took great pictures on land.We own an Olympus E3 digital camera that we use for personal use, so we are somewhat picky on picture quality.....this little camera was awesome for the money.  You will not be disappointed.  Would definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: Canon D10 underwater digital camera
Reviews.Author: twerk63
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera after looking at reviews and photos submitted by others prior to southern caribbean cruise.  Camera took some great shots underwater as well as pictures while on land also.  Went snorkeling with the sea turtles and both the pictures and the videos came out fantastic.  Some of the underwater pictures that were taken under wavy conditions with murky water came out murky which is to b e expected.  But the ones taken in clear water were really good.  The only thing I can think that I would change is to have a lens cover that could be placed when not in use.  I would also recommend a camera case to transport when not in use since the LCD can get scratched from banging around.  Otherwise I am very pleased with the camera and would recommend it to those that enjoy snorkeling, shallow diving and just being able to be portable without having to use disposable cameras where the pictures may or may not come out.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera prior to a cruise where I knew I would be visiting a lot of beaches. I have now had it for over a year and am still very happy with it. I have taken some really cool underwater pictures and was shock to see things swimming in the water that I didn't even know was there when the picture was taken. The picture quality is very good in and out of the water. It is easy to use. I am very happy with this buy. This is the perfect camera for us.

Reviews.Title: Great for the outdoor enthusiast
Reviews.Author: NW-Scouter
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera.  As a Scouter in the Pacific Northwest we see a lot of rain and it is great to be able to go out and use a camera without being worried about it getting ruined.  Get the extra battery, because there is very little time between 2 bars and no bars in battery life.  Takes great videos and works fairly well in low light.  Overall I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Buy this camera!!
Reviews.Author: H. Aziz
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Great picture quality especially if you use the right settings and modes. I generally use P mode and rarely use flash- Great for people who have kids. Even if the kids play with it or worse drop it you wont be sweating.- Cool color and design- Underwater pictures good, movies great- Sturdy built, will likely last a long time- Good battery life, lasts at least 48 hours of continuous still photography. Plenty of standby timeCons:- I used to take picture in the auto focus alot. Gives you average to crapy pics in AF. This camera not good for people who want to use it only in auto focus mode. Be creative, use other modes. This camera will get you amazing results- The accessory kit is very expensive $125+ . I would love to buy it to change the color plates on the camera but I doubt its worth the price.- Average performance in low light condition. Again thats too much to ask for from a point and shoot camera.Conclusion:- Great camera for people with kids.- I would have given it 3-4 stars, but I learned some basic tips on digital photography on Youtube and use the camera in P mode. Now I get great results (sometimes better than my DSLR!).- A great accessory for everyday shooting, picnics, vacation etc.

Reviews.Title: Very smart buy
Reviews.Author: Daniel Eduardo Alarcon Mawyin "dan_the_man"
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, not cheap but I'm very happy, really easy to use. My wife is no tech wiz so she's the happiest. I've only gone 10 ft. underwater so far, but I'm very pleased. The only thing that's kind of a drag is it's weight. I would reccomend it !!!!-Dan

Reviews.Title: tough and good
Reviews.Author: Dylee
