Reviews.Content: Purchased this for outdoor adventure shots and other walkabouts.  It is as tough as advertised.  It takes great pictures and is easy to use.  Since the camera ends up mostly in a pack on my back it would be better if lighter.  A little more zoom and better backlight on LCD would be more useful.

Reviews.Title: NOT waterproof to depth!
Reviews.Author: Travel Mom
Reviews.Content: Loved every aspect of this camera. Owned it for about a year and a half. Used it in all sorts of weather and conditions. BUT, I must warn you that this camera is NOT waterproof to 33 ft, as advertised. I used it to take photos of our scuba lesson in a 15 ft pool, and it leaked. The whole inside of the camera was saturated, and it is ruined. Good all-purpose camera for the beach or other conditions in which it might become wet, but do not submerse it if you want to keep using it. I had rated this item higher until Canon refused to honor their guarantee. They said that, because they do not sell cameras directly to consumers, they can't replace it. They suggested I send it in for repair (at my cost). I will try the new Panasonic underwater model. Hopefully, they have better customer service.

Reviews.Title: !Lens Error!
Reviews.Author: SND
Reviews.Content: This camera takes AMAZING pictures.  The photo quality is unbeatable, YES, including the underwater shots.  I took this camera snorkeling in Mexico and am very impressed with the color quality and found no problems with pixelation. !!HOWEVER!!  BE WARNED!! that this camera has KNOWN PROBLEMS with turning on/off.  A 'LENS ERROR' display will prevent the camera from staying on or even just turning on period.  It's very frustrating and obviously ends up making the outstanding quality of this camera worthless.  It's a bit bulky compared to other cameras but the quality of the photos is so much better, if you're willing to risk getting a faulty camera that is.  Compared to other underwater cameras I've seen, the quality of the photos is unbeatable.  I would not recommend purchasing this model though due to the incredibly inconvenient glitch. :(

Reviews.Title: Not actually that durable
Reviews.Author: Unpaid Intern "random_person_usa"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera when it was first released a little over a year ago.  I was excited to have a durable, waterproof camera I could take with me wherever without having to worry about it.  It was a little big and bulk for everyday use and I'd say the quality was slightly below that of the traditional powershot but I had no real complains.  When I took a position working with sea turtles on a remote beach I was so glad I had this camera as life was tough and I was always in the ocean and camping in the sand.  It was fantastic, for two months, then it stopped working.  First the display stopped working, but even without a manual viewfinder I kept taking pictures.  A week later, it completely died.  It is now useless.  When you hit the power button, nothing happens (and I've tried new batteries, etc) which is really disappointing since I paid twice the price of a regular point and shoot to get one that should have been nearly indestructible.  It briefly started working again, but one immersion in the water and it is dead again, so it's not waterproof either. The repair estimate is over half the price that I originally paid for it, so it doesn't really seem worth the investment.Until it stopped working, the features were great - easy to use buttons for marco shooting mode, to change the exposure, set the flash, etc.  Is is like other powershot, which I have owned a few of and loved.  Battery life is impressive.  It comes with a great, durable wrist strap but the add-ons (part of the reason I was excited about this camera) only come in a complete pack which is around $100; it would be nice to be able to just buy the items that you want rather than the whole kit.

Reviews.Title: pretty disappointed in this camera.
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the good reviews and I was needing a water proof camera, on my cruise it worked amazing! I was gone for a week to 3 different countries and used it in and out of water. Pictures were great, it's been 6 months since i bought it and around 4 months i got the infamouse "lens error, restart camera". I figured my battery might be low so I charged it and it worked for another 2 months. I am going on another vacation in a week so I get my camera out to make sure everything is good and there it was again "lens error", charged battery and charger says its full. I bought a new battery thinking maybe my battery is bad, charged that battery and still getting the same error. My camera is pretty much useless at this point, I'll be contacting Canon tomorrow on getting it replaced since it should be covered by the 1 year warranty but I would definately watch out for this error. Doing a good search on this error brings up 422 results.

Reviews.Title: Adventure pics
Reviews.Author: Whitewater
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with my experience with Amazon and with the product I ordered.  The camera is exactly what I had expected and at a better price than I had been able to find anywhere else.  The product arrived on time and in good codition.  I will buy again from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Ok Camera but returned it for several reasons
Reviews.Author: J. Gibert
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip and while it was ok and I got quite a few good photos it also had several problems.1. My friend took about 4 pictures of me surfing for the first time ever. When I went back to review the photos it said this image can not be retrieved. So the only photo I had left of me surfing was one that was half distorted on the bottom. The camera did this several time on the trip- just deleted random photos for no apparent reason. :(2. It's very bulky. I knew ordering this that it was going to be sort of bulky, but I didn't realize what a pain it would be. It definitely won't fit in your pocket.3. The automatic setting drove me crazy! It won't let you put the flash ON- only off or automatic so there were times I wanted a flash and it just wouldn't come on. I wish there was a manual way to control the settings and flash.So overall, I don't recommend this camera. I'm still trying to find the best waterproof camera. I tried out the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS2S and wasn't happy with the image quality. I guess the hunt continues for an all around good waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Brad Towle "photo freak"
Reviews.Content: I find the picture quality out of water is very impressive.  I have not used it underwater...some day.  The features are many and I need to remember them all when the situation arises.  My son has one and he uses it in the ocean and the pictures look great!  He loves his so much, I bought one.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: It was inbetween this and the Olumpus Stylus. I ultimately chose higher picture quality. They picture quality is great! The only cons I have it that it is rather bulky. If you do not mind that, this is the camera to get!

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Denni
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews of assorted waterproof cameras, I decided to go with the Canon D10.  So far I have been very happy with my choice.  It has excellent clarity in and out of the water.  The video also has great picture.  Amazon had the best price and offered free shipping.  I've been spoiled by internet purchases being shipped same day and being able to track them.  That being said Amazon did ship when promised and it was the US Postal service that failed to show correct information so not Amazon's fault.  I'm a bit nervous regarding some reviews that it didn't perform well in the ocean.  I look forward to finding out in a couple months.

Reviews.Title: Electronic Awesomeness
Reviews.Author: mm7
Reviews.Content: I have had the Canon Power Shot D10 for a little more than a month now and it rules! Its not the most compact but that is not why I bought it. It takes great photos and its waterproof! The video quality is excellent too. Its very easy to use, if you already own and operate a point and shoot camera you shouldn't have any problems adjusting to the powershot D10. The shutter speed is good, I haven't tried too many action shots so I can't really provide any insight to that. The only negative comment I have is that there is no lense cover. The lense is completely vulnerable to scratches. But if you are careful, that shouldnt be an issue. And also the camera did not come with a memory card, so make sure you order one when you buy the camera. I would recommend this camera to the adventurous, or not-so-adventurous, person who wants to document their activites with a durable electronic device.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Gio G.
Reviews.Content: The only thing we do not like is the LCD gets scratched really easy. Grrr.

Reviews.Title: Cold Water Ok
Reviews.Author: Jerrol
Reviews.Content: I have used the camera for about six or seven trips in Kodiak Alaska water temp is in the low 40's and visability is not so great, but pictures still turned out good.  Everything has been working great so farCanon PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD.  I wish the buttons were a little bigger. hard but not imposable to hit with 5 mill gloves on.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera to have when it is wet
Reviews.Author: W. A. Freeman Jr.
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot D10 is a great little camera that provides excellent images and it can take a bath. I've used it on several swimming and whitewater swim trips and it is a lot of fun. Just get you a spare battery and don't forget your charger like I did the other day. I shot the pro cameras that provide about 1000 pictures per batter charge. The D10 will give you about 300-400. I also turn the flash on even in daylight to provide fill and that sucks the juice out of the battery. It is a lot of fun to have around for the wet stuff and to journal a day. I do wish he had a lens cover. That bugs me. It does video in the .mov format. I am very pleased with mine and even take it when I go walking or into town. Never know.

Reviews.Title: I'm a big fan of the Canon Powershots
Reviews.Author: D.Hannock
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I was going to the Carribean and I knew I was going to be doing some snorkeling.  I have had a few Canon Powershots and I have always been very happy with them.  I always recommend them when I know someone who is looking for a camera.  I was not disappointed with this camera.  The underwater pictures turned out great (after I changed the setting to underwater).  The only thing that seems different (unusual) about the camera is not having anything to cover the lens.  The powershots normally have the lens covered when it is turned off.  I'm guessing this is because of it being waterproof.  I'm not sure yet how durable it will be. I just purchased the camera in early June 2010.I would definitely recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: B. Booth
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon digital SLR with a number of excellent lenses, but I was looking for something that I could toss in a backpack to be used while hiking through the jungle or snorkeling the coral reefs.  There were a few other cameras on the market that cost less, but every investigation of them usually had some poor or mediocre reviews.  The D10 had some pretty decent ratings, and while more expensive than the mediocre models, I decided I really needed something that would work.I was impressed.  This camera performed excellently.  It turns on amazingly fast and in AUTO mode can adjust for just about anything.  The SCN mode and MOVIE mode gives the camera a ton of flexibility.  If you're going underwater, be sure to select UNDERWATER in SCN mode, as it definitely makes a difference.  As for being waterproof, it excelled!  No issues at all.  And the battery life was very impressive.I'm now using my digital SLR for my more serious photographic work, and the D10 is now the camera I toss into my backpack or computer bag for traveling.

Reviews.Title: Fun toy, great pics!
Reviews.Author: Katie O.
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot. Nice not to have to worry about getting it wet or my 2-yr old son grabbing and dropping it. Took it to the beach the first day I had it and it took fantasticly clear and sharp underwater pics! Easy enough to use that my 8-year old niece loved playing with it too. Only downside is that it only has a 3x optical zoom, but this is not the camera to be using if your taking that kind of picture anyway.

Reviews.Title: PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Camera
Reviews.Author: Charles R. Mcintosh
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera to take with me on vacation. I chose the power shot camera because of its features. I will be fly fishing, thus wading in water or in a boat on a lake and wanted one that was waterproof. I have used the camera and found it to be easy to operate and easy to carry with you. In fact, my 3 year old granddaughter has operated the camera and has taken very good pictures with it. This alone should attest to its ease of use. Great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Excellent Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Matt B
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip to Jamaica.  It never let me down.  Scuba would not have been the same without it.  The underwater macro capabilities are stunning.  Canon once again pulls through and delivers.  Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Works so far!
Reviews.Author: Victoria A. Sherman
Reviews.Content: I do not have another water camera to compare this to, and have only owned it for a month, but so far, so good.  As far as a point and shoot - it works and takes great outside pics.  Just o.k. inside pics.  But most of all it takes GREAT underwater pics compared to the throw-away point and shoot cameras I was using!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent all around camera
Reviews.Author: David J. Beranek "Reddale77"
Reviews.Content: This camera was given as a gift for Christmas with the intent to use on my honeymoon. When we took this camera on the trip to St Lucia, we ended up using it more than my Canon SD850!! This little camera took great shots underwater, ideos when we went zip lining, shots around the hotel, botanical gardens, etc. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone that is looking for a good underwater camera for snorkeling, going to the pool a lot, etc.

Reviews.Title: Best "Waterproof" Camera so far.
Reviews.Author: Erick72 "joh1612"
Reviews.Content: I have owned a few other waterproof cameras in the past and have been disappointed with the picture quality. Being a Canon SLR user for years I was excited to hear that they were coming out with their own "rugged" camera. I picked the D-10 up earlier this year for a trip to Hawaii with the hopes that the reviews were correct and the picture quality was decent. I have to say I was VERY impressed with this camera. I had really only intended to use it snorkeling or kayaking but it was so easy to use and the picture quality was so impressive I ended up using it as my main camera. I used it in every condition; indoors, outdoors, night, day, beach, jungle, underwater and every time it performed perfectly. I was probable most impressed with the underwater capabilities. I have never been a fan of vacation videos but being able to switch over to take a video of a turtle swimming by and then right back to stills without leaving the water was VERRY cool! I probably used it underwater 5 or 6 times during my stay and I never had a problems with leaks, and truth be told I was not that diligent about cleaning all the seals after each use.  Ok, a couple of minor gripes. As other reviews have mentioned the battery life is very short. I always carry spares which was a good thing, I usually went through 2 in a day. Not that big a deal but if you are looking to purchase this camera I would Definitely recommend a spare. My second minor gripe is the shape. I know the bulging lens is probably integral to the rugged capabilities, but it makes it tough to put in a pocket. Also I am hoping the next gen of this camera has HD video, but who knows what that would do to the battery life!

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: FaerieAutumn "FaerieAutumn"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my sisters 18th birthday and to take on our Caribbean cruise... WORKED PERFECTLY! Underwater shots snorkeling and diving are absolutely amazing!!!! Out of water pictures are also crystal clear...have yet to find any issues! I am going to buying one for myself now!!! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Burned pixels on LCD display
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Charbel Felipe
Reviews.Content: I got mine 7 days ago and noticed that there is a thin line of burned pixels on the LCD display. The second vertical line of pixels starting from left to right is burned. Looks like a thin green line when there is anything dark on de LCD display. The image quality is very good, but these burned pixels made me sad. I don't live in the USA and purchased it in there, so I can't use the warranty in here (Brazil).I think the cost x benefit of sending it to someone in the USA to get it fixed is not worth it. So I'm gonna keep using it like that anyway...I didn't test the waterproof feature yet. Later I write my impressions.

Reviews.Title: Works great when it works
Reviews.Author: Brad Lewis
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for snorkelling, with the exception of when it leaks...So after reading reviews and seeing the problems a friend of ours had with the Olympus underwater camera we selected the D10.  We were Canon fans anyway, so it was an easy choice.  If you have used other Canon cameras, this one is a breeze to use as it has all the standard features and usage of a regular Canon point and shoot.  The quality of shots is similar as well, with the regular drawbacks of not being great at action shots or macro.  The facial recognition worked well, as did the image stabilization.  It was actually pretty good in low light as well, with not much noise in the photos.  Overall we were quite happy with it.The one problem we had is kind of a big one though... The camera leaked twice.  Since we were snorkelling in the ocean, we made sure to take all the maintenance steps recommended.  After about 10-12 snorkelling sessions and lots of use on the beach, the camera appeared to quit working.  After playing with it a bit, it seemed to be just the LCD had failed.  So we took it back to our hotel, cleaned it, then left it to dry.  The next day upon opening the AV door, water drained out.  So it is possible it had not been closed tightly, though it appeared to have been.  We left it for 2 days, tried it again, and it worked normally.  About 6-7 snorkelling sessions later, the same thing happened.  This time I am certain all doors were closed tightly as we were triple checking before using.  Also, it was not just the LCD.  Nothing was working.  Fortunately this was the last day of our vacation and no photos were lost.  Upon returning home and waiting a week, it still didn't start up.  So we shipped it back to Canon for warranty support and they replaced it with a new one...So we're still happy Canon customers.

Reviews.Title: 6 month later dead LCD scren
Reviews.Author: John J. Conway
Reviews.Content: Love the camera.  I would marry it if I could but alas my friends after our 6 month honeymoon of near perfect pictures the LCD screen is dead. No screen no viewfinder, no review, no menus etc. Make sure you get the extended warranty for this camera. I did not and I now have to hope the problem does not reappear after warranty repair. If so I am out of luck.

Reviews.Title: Canon waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Trixie
Reviews.Content: I have owned 3 Canon Powershot cameras over the years and really love them.  I bought this camera to take on a 2 week Hawaii vacation where I intended to use it underwater.  I used it at home several times and it performed just like my previous Canon Powershots.  I got to Hawaii and on the second day of my vacation droped this camera from a distance of about 2 feet onto a tabletop.  The camera then displayed an error message that the lens was stuck.  Nothing we could do would make the camera operable.  This camera is supposed to be "shockproof" and you can theoretically drop it from a distance of 5 feet.  Well, don't believe that!  Amazon was GREAT about the return, no problems there.  Just as a note, we bought an Olympus waterproof, point and shoot at the CostCo in Hawaii to replace this.  It worked "OK" for about 6 days (every day in water).  Not as good quality as the Canon and REALLY SLOW.  Then the LCD screen quit working. Thank goodness for GREAT CostCo return policy!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: J. Mayer
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I have a 1.5 and 3 year old and wanted something durable enough to hold up to two small children and allow me to get the shots I wanted of them, including in the rain and water. The drop proof aspect is great, as the kids have already dropped the camera twice and I've only had it for about two months. I've used it at the beach and at the pool. I did a private swimming lesson and used it to video tape the swimmer's stroke under water and it worked great. Not only could I play the video at full speed, I could do it frame by frame for easy stroke analysis. The picture quality is great, I had a pentax optio W80 and more than half the pictures would turn out grainy, with the canon they are nice and clear. The zoom is amazing, even when you go out to the 12x digital zoom they are nice and clear. It is definitely worth the little extra money to buy a canon vs the cheaper models. I absolutely love this camera, it is a great camera for moms with small children, and anyone who doesn't want to have to worry if the camera is dropped or gets wet.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen Clay
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Bought to compliment my SLR have used it underwater with very very good results, just kept it in auto.  Not brilliant at full action shots as there is no viewfinder.  I bought a standard scandisk card which is a little slow to store the images which also affects it's abillity to capture action.  If you are also looking for a bag this one works brilliantly:[...]I would thoroughly recommend this camera.Steve

Reviews.Title: I need to feature this camera on my blog...
Reviews.Author: Rocque Bowen "Rocques Biz"
Reviews.Content: I really like my Cannon Camera. I have not used it under water yet, but have had it in water and it works fine after.  I love the size of it and the stability feature.  I am not the steadiest camera holder in the world and the pictures always look great.Whenever I have the camera and am using it I have people ask me where I got it, and I get great comments about it.  That is why I need to use my affiliate link and direct people to buy it "from me" as the affiliate.I purchased a floating strap to go with it since the camera does not float.  I loaned my camera to friends to take snorkeling at Catalina this weekend.  I hope I can get some of the pictures so I can see the under water shots.  I am planning on taking it kayaking this summer and hope to get some under water shots.  I want to take it out into the ocean and get some surfing shots, too, but am not sure if I will get to do that yet.Everything on the camera is tiny though so if you have bigger hands it might take some adjusting.  It works fine for me, and I have taken hundreds of pictures with it.  It charges super fast, and the charge lasts throughout a busy day of shooting.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled
Reviews.Author: Joseph Anthony "Max"
Reviews.Content: This is the second D10 I've owned in two weeks. The first one was stolen from me. During the short time I've owned a D10, I've taken them sailing and snorkeling. During sailing I dunked camera underwater and videod as we sailed along(see youtube, hobie 16 underwater). I'm astounded with the underwater results I have gotten with this camera. The stills and the video I've taken have impressed me from the standpoint that they were taken in somewhat murky water and limited light conditions, and the vivid results were very impressive. The only complaint I have is this: if you need the flash to take extreme macro shots, there will be a shadow due to the configuration of the lens relative to the flash. It is rarely an issue.

Reviews.Title: Love All My Canon's
Reviews.Author: The Killers Forever "Kat"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last year after being extremely interested in it's waterproof capability and I was not disappointed. It takes wonderful pictures exactly what you would expect from a Canon and works great underwater. I wish I would have had this when I took my trip to Cozumel, but the pool will do. I have used it quite frequently underwater and have yet to have a problem. I always clean it dry after use and let it sit for a while before I turn the camera on. All in all this is a great camera, though the size for some may be an issue it wasn't for me. I plan on taking this camera to Disney World with us this summer to get those awesome water ride shots!

Reviews.Title: canon d10
Reviews.Author: Yoan Medina
Reviews.Content: Been using this camera since it came out. I'm a scuba diver and have taking it down to 32 Feet and taken pictures and videos. Works fine under water witch is what I need it for but it takes bad videos on sunny days outside the water. Other then that I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Jones "sunshinebluesky"
Reviews.Content: This is my first underwater camera. So I decided to go for what everyone rated the best. This camera is totally worth its price. I love it. I use it above water as well. I have only used it in pools. So I'm looking forward to using it in the waters of the caribbean and virgin islands. The function I like is the color accent. You point the little box to whatever color you want to stand out in your black and white photo and wallah!! It's magic.

Reviews.Title: Works great in the pool-now for the ocean!
Reviews.Author: Az Mom "Joan"
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews about underwater cameras and chose this one. Today I took it to the pool to become aquainted with it. I even got another swimmer to make believe he was a big fish. I caught him in fast action and the pictures were great-clean and not blured. I'm sure the camera is better at taking pictures than I am. I have a lot to learn. After reading the manual I know that it has many functions I will never get to, but I'm eager to try a few more. I wish it had a foating strap, as it will sink to the bottom if you lose it, but the strap that comes with it fits tightly around your wrist. Pentax has a floating strap (Amazon) that is very inexpensive and according to a review it must fit the Cannon D10 so I think I will order it. By the way I am 80 years young and if I can figure it out anyone can. Have fun! I am.  Joan

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Active Lifestyle
Reviews.Author: Warren Wm Gollop
Reviews.Content: This has so far done everything I have wanted. Performs very well in the bright sunlight, and viewing on the LCD display is only defeated when used with polarized sunglasses.  High glare environments have still created crisp shot and great colour quality.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: MauiGirl
Reviews.Content: After looking through many reviews, I finally decided on the Canon D10, and I am so happy with it! I took it snorkeling on Maui today and got amazing underwater shots of turtles, coral, fish, etc... I am also pleasantly surprised that the photo quality of the non-underwater shots is fantastic! I thought I would just use this for beach/water activities, but this is the camera for everything! It's expensive, but definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Hardy
Reviews.Content: Camera is great. The only drawback that I can see is the fact that there is no cover on the lens. This is a very important important part of the camera and should be protected. Picture quality is great and ease of use is a big plus. Would recommend this camera to a friend.Canon PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD

Reviews.Title: Great camera, especially for daily use around a 2 year old.  Easy to clean!
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Great camera, especially for daily use around a 2 year old.  Easy to clean!Just rinse it in the sink.My two year old is always grabbing the camera with sticky fingers, its great that you can clean it.I very rarely use it under water, but it works well when i do.The pictures and color are awesome!The best digital camera I've owned by far.The biggest complaint i have is that it tips over too easy.The bottom of the camera is more rounded than most cameras so setting it on a table or something it is easy to knock over.Very easy to use and the videos i take come out great too.

Reviews.Title: Really Good camera
Reviews.Author: H. Sidelinger
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great purchase. Takes awesome pictures, haven't taken it deep underwater yet but have put it in the sink a few times. Still works :) Very happy with this camera. Lag time isn't bad at all.

Reviews.Title: More than just a waterproof camera.
Reviews.Author: T. K. Paul "imatyak"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera very soon after its release.  This should also be advertised as a purse proof camera. I am never without it.  The size is just right for me to carry around all the time.  I initially bought it for my kids to take to the beach, but I've since used it for indoor events year round because it never fails to take the best flash pictures. I own a Digital Rebel Xti, a Powershot G2 (an oldie), and yet another Powershot model (can't remember the number).  By far, this D10 gets used the most.I always complain about battery life to some degree, but this is no worse than any other and probably better than most.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, so-so videos
Reviews.Author: HorseyB
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my very active husband for Christmas.  He rides BMX, snowmobiles, snowboards, waterskis, rides horses...you name it.  So far, he has only used it for snowmobile shots and shots of our kids (1 and 2 1/2) at home. The pictures are really pretty good.  The camera only has a 3x zoom, but that seems pretty typical of the "hardier" cameras.  That it's 12 megapixel seems to help compensate for the lower zoom rating. Our only complaint is that videos, while easy to take, tend to be grainy and not the highest quality in general...we can see what the rider is doing, etc., but it's hard to tell exactly who it is...  This was definitely a good purchase, but I hope that Canon upgrades the video capabilities on it.

Reviews.Title: great camera - sturdy!
Reviews.Author: Patti W. Rowland
Reviews.Content: its nice to have a camera you can use to take pics while you play around in the snow and not be worried that it is going to get wet and damaged.

Reviews.Title: Like it alot
Reviews.Author: D. Sloane "Busy/OCD mother of one"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera as a Christmas gift for my parents to use at there beach house. They are very happy with the pictures it takes. It has lots of nifty features, but the menu navigation is somewhat complex. It seems bulky compared to the olympus waterproof, but feels very nice in your hand. The movable lanyard is a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ivy Peng
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my trip to Costa Rica and it worked out wonderfully!  I took it snorkeling and to the hot springs underwater without any issues.  It's fairly durable (I accidentally dropped it hard on cement due to the odd shape of the camera, I didn't get a good grip on it - still works, though the function to change picture settings does not work properly and I will have to contact Canon to see if they can fix it).  I had to buy the accesories which is overpriced for the straps which are a must-have when traveling and if you're being very active outdoors.  It took really great photos throughout our trip and was very versatile.  I would highly recommend this camera for the outdoor enthusiasts.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Johansen "joannj"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to the Amazon jungle and Galapagos Islands. No cameras in plastic bags for me - I didn't want to worry about keeping it dry. My other digital camera is a Casio and I am very happy with it. The D10 is even better. It's idiot-proof on the automatic setting, and I got great pictures both above and under water. In our group of 13 people, five cameras failed, but not this baby. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof, but not perfect underwater
Reviews.Author: James Ryan
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Central America with the D10.  A few observations:- It was great to know that an unexpected rain shower or a splash while riding a Zodiac would not be a problem.- Photos in general were excellent.- White balance, even with the underwater setting, is not very good more than a few inches below the surface.  Be prepared to adjust after the fact.- The camera can be very slow to respond to the shutter button under water.  When you are holding your breath, trying to hold position, and shooting active fish, this can be VERY annoying.- The rounded shape makes it hard to feel secure holding the camera.  This leads to a tendency to wrap your whole hand around it, and then it's likely that a sunscreen-covered finger will land on the lens window.- The waterproof access doors are very clever.  They are easy to use and keep out the water.  No messing around with seals and silicone as with a separate housing.- I would have tried one of the alternate straps, but they are very expensive.- The 10 meter depth rating made me comfortable that I would not accidentally go too deep for the camera while snorkeling.  Many competing cameras are rated to 5 meters or less, which is not enough for me.In conclusion, I highly recommend this camera for situations where it might accidentally get wet, or for playing around in a pool, in the surf, et cetera.  For underwater nature photography you will want something with less shutter lag.

Reviews.Title: On land it's a phenom, can't wait to see what it does underwater
Reviews.Author: PVanMe "Lone Star Bell"
Reviews.Content: Although it's still winter and we can't get out on the boat, we've been taking land pictures with our new camera and it has been great.  The pictures are clear and sharp.

Reviews.Title: Works great, but then it leaked...
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the camera is a little bulky.  But the image stabilization is pretty good and the pictures are overall very impressive.  Depending on settings, the colors are fairly accurate and just the littlest bit exaggerated.  Beyond that, I bought it primarily for the waterproof capability and ruggedness that it has.  After a month or so, I looked at it one morning and noticed fogging around the LCD screen.  Wouldn't start.  So back to Canon it went, where it has been for the last 2 weeks...A friend of ours had a similar issue, and just left it open with the battery and memory card out for a couple of days, and it fired right back up.  She had a piece of sand stuck in the battery cover.  I checked, ours didn't.  And I'm fairly diligent about making sure that cover snaps into place when closed, but apparently I may have missed something.  It doesn't give the most satisfying "snap" when it is completely closed.  Hopefully, once I get it back, I will not have issues with it in the future.  A part of me is truly hoping it was a user error, but be sure to triple check the battery door.

Reviews.Title: Great option for a water proof camera
Reviews.Author: Morpheus76
Reviews.Content: We were going on a Caribbean vacation and knew that we were going to be doing a lot of water sports and swimming. We looked around for a a water proof camera and ended up buying this camera. To our surprise the picture quality was great even for normal use so we took only this camera on vacation. We used this camera throughout the trip for both underwater and normal photos and the results were great. The only place where it lagged in performance a bit was in low light conditions. Our snorkeling and beach shots turned out great and we even caught some really great pics of our friends jumping off a 20 feet pier into the water.Its a good camera, a little bulky but performs very well as far as picture quality is concerned.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Karl S. Johnson "ksjprod"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before a trip to Mexico to use while snorkeling.  I was very pleased with its' performance.  The underwater pics turned out nicely, as did the underwater video.  I'm bummed that it's not HD video, but they still look good.  Sufficient lighting is always an issue when taking pics under water.  The flash seemed to work well.  In some cases the camera picked up things we didn't notice at the time (like some little sucker fish clinging to a turtle).  Housing didn't leak at all.  Oh yeah, it takes some pretty damn nice pics out of the water too.  It's not the slimmest design, but fits nicely in my hand.  Awesome.

Reviews.Title: Great everything camera
Reviews.Author: Jason D. Moore
Reviews.Content: This camera does it all, although some of the picture settings are a bit nasty and don't do as expected.  A little difficult to change modes sometimes.  Works great though and performs well under stress (water, sun, activities).  Love having it to grab for those sessions with the kids!  Video is okay, although haven't figured it all out.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, but watch out for actual camera quality.
Reviews.Author: E. Ertmer
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera before a trip to Belize.  It took great snorkeling pictures. and stayed waterproof the whole time.  I never took it deeper than what I could free dive though so I can't speak to diving depths. My friends were all very impressed with the pictures I was able to take.  It was also extremely easy to use, and it was easy to change settings under water.  My only complaint is that the strap attachment is not dependable.  I had a strap attached to one of the corners and the metal piece on the corner of the camera actually broke off.  It was just glued on!  Fortunately it broke in the boat and not underwater and I was able to move the strap to a different corner.  Needless to say, I don't hold it by the strap underwater anymore as it can't be trusted.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot D10
Reviews.Author: Crazy Traveler
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for a trip to the Galapagos to take underwater pictures.  It arrived early in December when my roses were still blooming and it was snowing.  Took the camera for a test drive and when out into the snow and snapped away.  Great macro shots, not as much zoom as my Canon S5IS but more than adequate.  Next test was using the movie mode to record my granddaughter's violin recital.  Adequate pictures but next time will use a tripod.Glad I purchased this camera and will be using it soon on my trip of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: Eco-Tour
Reviews.Author: Oswald Hall "Turtles"
Reviews.Content: This camera is used with our eco-tours & works well in and out of the water during our trips. It's small, light & takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: John Huang
Reviews.Content: Owned camera for 6 months now. I bought this camera because I go outdoors a lot and encounter water situations.I have yet to drop this camera, but have tested it in clean water, salty water and even muddy and nasty water. It holds up to the waterproofness test no problem. I love how I can just wash/soak the crap off! The picture quality is excellent. To compare, I own a Canon Rebel XTi and I love this camera. I have bought Olympus waterproof camera and returned it.The only complaint I have for this camera is that I receive error "Lens stuck. Restart" error too many times. I had sent this back to Canon twice before the problem seems to be fully resolved. If others encounter this situation on the field, just take out the battery and perhaps even the memory card for at least 10 minutes, reinsert and this will be a quick fix. However, as mentioned, Canon did replace my PCM board (1st time), and did a cleaning (2nd time) for the final resolution. Only loss on my part is shipping to Canon and downtime without my camera. Luckily, I have another backup.Overall, I would recommend this camera. Even if you are unlucky and received a bad unit like I did, Canon's warranty covered everything gracefully.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: This camera was perfect. We took it on a trip to Turks and Caicos - lots of snorkling - and tons of pictures in (and under) the water. It was great to have a camera that could get wet and not have to worry about it. It is a little bulky to fit into a pocket - but not too bad. The picture quality is outstanding, and the facial recognition is great. Very easy to use, great addition to our stuff to pack for vacation!

Reviews.Title: Great Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Ayala "glitch in the spreadsheet"
Reviews.Content: Based on some reviews, we tested this camera before leaving for our honeymoon by submerging in water in the sink for several hours and taking several pictures.  We repeated this twice and it worked fine.  We took this camera to Australia and New Zealand and tried it in many different situations: Bondi Beach (Sydney), underwater snorkling in Great Barrier Reef, rain and beach on Kangaroo Island, Apollo Beach, rain and ice at Franz Josef glacier, beach at Wanaka lake and  Lake Tekapo, white water rafting in Rangitata Gorge (Peel Forrest) etc.  It worked great in every setting.  The pictures it took underwater (once I put it in underwater mode) were phenomenal.  Great colors and even handled lots of moving fish (and my shaky hand).  Worked great out of water too.  At 12.1 MP it just took great shots that we've become accustomed to with Canon cameras.  Battery lasted longer than expected and as easy to use as our other Canon P&S.;Only con I would say is that the form factor is a little bulky and unattractive, but I quickly got over that.  Also, the wrist strap, while secure, was a pain when trying to insert and remove from protective case.  Sometimes I would switch which corner it was on to make it easier to remove but then it would be awkward taking pictures.  Mildly annoying but really not that bad.We have 3 other Canon cameras and they have all performed admirably and this is just another example of a great Canon product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera....Great Price
Reviews.Author: S. Sheckler
Reviews.Content: I've just had this camera for about 1 month and so far, so good.  No problems, easy to use & excellent picture quality !!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with my purchase
Reviews.Author: Jophie "jophie"
Reviews.Content: Initially I was hesitant to purchase this camera because of the bad reviews on the shape and size of the camera.  I have to say I'm glad I went ahead and purchased it.  By far, it has the best features compared to all other waterproof cameras.  I'm not in love with the shape of the camera (it's submarine looking)however, I can't commplain when it comes to the functionalities and features.  Overall, I am happy with this product.  I bought it specifically for my trip to Jamaica and I was quite pleased with its performance.  I would however recommend that you buy one of those plastic covers to protect the screen.  I already scratched mine =(.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: L. Pinkus "lynne8s"
Reviews.Content: have had several other canons so I felt quite comfortable picking up this camera and starting to use it.  A little bulky for my pocket but really not bad as the last camera I had was just as big (had bigger camera to get larger zoom).  I love not having to feel like I have to keep this camera wrapped in foam in my purse- I am rough on things and that is why I got this camera, and so far I love it though really haven't had it that long.

Reviews.Title: Point and Shoot Underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Gary S. Dickinson "Gary D"
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot digital camera.  Takes nice underwater photos. Takes nice dry land photos.The accessory pack is a great addition.  You get a nice rubber (think wet suit material) case and a bit assortment of lanyards that you can use to attach the camera to your body or other equipment.  The lanyards are great for snorkeling, hiking and skiing.My only complaint is with battery life.  It is a little short.  I got about 100 shots on the first few charges.

Reviews.Title: It works great!
Reviews.Author: Junjie
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a snorkeling trip in Palawan, Philippines. The underwater shots were great and it was so easy to use.  At first I was worried that it might be leaking because I was seeing some small bubbles coming from the camera but everything was okay.  One thing I noticed was that taking pictures from underwater to above the water, the pictures stayed clear, there were no streaks on the picture that could have come from water on the lens.

Reviews.Title: I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who is looking for an all around great camera.
Reviews.Author: Daniel P. Ryan
Reviews.Content: We are on our third day of vacation in Cancun, Mexico.  After the kids used the camera almost all day for the last three days, we just had to switch to a new battery.  Three days of fun and no worries about the battery being low.  Picture quality is fantastic even using the 3x zoom.  Underwater photos came out great! Kids are having a blast with it.  Using the camera on the bumpy ride in a golf cart to the beach, not one photo came out blurry.  Shake proof really works!  After a last minute decision to purchase, we definitely don't regret spending the money.  This is an all around awesome camera.  To everyone who is looking for a good camera, you've found it.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT VACATION  WATERPROOF CAMERA / CAMCORDER
Reviews.Author: OILMAN "OWEN"

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo25PB0OI0HIK8TcurrentClick) { return cv_mo25PB0OI0HIK8TcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:18 MinsI purchased this camera based on all the excellent reviews, I"ve read on Cnet and Amazon........I think this is a wonderful camera for my upcoming cruise vacation..............as my Nikon D300.........will not work for snorkeling........and going to the beach...........while this very atractive pint sized performer.........will fill the bill........I find you have to make sure that the battery hatch cover is closed tightly and properly........it kind of makes a woosh noise........when closed properly......I have taken some test fotos..........and I must say that once you set the menu up...........such as setting you pictures on the vivid mode for a little extra color pop........its.very ,very nice..and lets not forget that this camera is a 12.1 megapixel........with the Canon Advanced Digic processor.........Anyway I will report back when I return from my cruise vacation..and post some of the pictures and videos I will take....so far I think this is a teriffic performer.and I highly reccomend it............Well I have returned from my cruise vacation........the Canon D 10 performed flawlessly......I shotbeautiful fotos as well as excellent Underwater video in the Caribbean Sea........at Sting Ray City.........One thing I Would Reccomend is once your done shooting in salt water.Soak the d 10 in a sink of Fresh Water.for about 30 min. to clean the camera and remove any salt residue..............to prevent the salt water from harming the seals on the camera

Reviews.Title: Great camera - but artifacts in bright sunlight
Reviews.Author: JSP
Reviews.Content: Portability and use, all point and shoot - easy and classic Canon.  Issue I have is with the artifacts in bright sunlight in video mode.  It seems that the sensor calibration is such that, for example, when you are taking video at the pool and the sunlight reflects off the water, you get vertical artifacts at the points of reflection.  The first camera I received was so bad, I had to return it for a second - which was not as bad, but still had the problem.  That said, I decided to keep the camera because its other features were so useful.  We've taken it to the beach and nothing beats being able to take it into the water (even with its issues) and then just washing off the sand.  For its price point, a good, useful camera - but if you like to take a lot of video in bright sunlight, beware.

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera
Reviews.Author: Robbie "Robbie"
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera on my cruise vacation.  It performed great.  From candid shots to snorkeling.  It was great. The only con is it has trouble in doors with poor lighting.

Reviews.Title: Great pics, Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: S. Rudolph
Reviews.Content: Super easy to use, good pictures both in and out of the water. Liked having the video underwater as well. My 6 and 7 yr old nieces loved taking pictures and videos of each other under the water.I wish the zoom was a bit more powerful. My old canon was 4x and this is 3x and I noticed the difference.My camera was lost while on vacation, I took the opportunity to re-check the other underwater cameras and am coming back to get this one! We are snorkelers and the underwater capability is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: Adventure Camera
Reviews.Author: Edgar "birdduke"
Reviews.Content: I really like this little camera but it does have a few minor flaws.  When in wet environment the lens with reflect light and you don't realize it until you can enlarge picture and or see it not in full sun.  We were Kyaking and got several badly fogged pictures.  This is probably just a learning problem.  I am disappointed in how hard to erase a picture--again learning curve.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: N. Whitlock
Reviews.Content: This camera has great clarity and flash/zoom ability, I can take a pic in a completely dark room and it looks as if all the lights are on. Still getting the features down cause when I took an underwater pic it came out fuzzy like it was reflecting the water. However I am still learning to use it so I prolly had it on the wrong setting.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I ever had!
Reviews.Author: Sven Enterlein
Reviews.Content: I am definitely not much of a camera connoisseur but I have had a few digital cameras so far. I bought this camera for our wedding trip to Hawai'i. It was the best purchase ever! We took it snorkeling (100% water proof!), took pictures of sunsets,  a glow-in-the-dark minigolf place, lots of plants, shot videos and so on... Not a single time did the camera let us down! It was like new after every time we washed off the sand and other dirt. The pictures are fantastic and there is a preset for almost every situation. You might want to look around for bundles though since they are not much more expensive than the camera itself; unfortunately, I didn't think about that before I bought the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for underwater
Reviews.Author: D. Kincaid
Reviews.Content: We recently had the opportunity to visit Hawaii and this little Canon performed beautifully.  We took over a thousand pictures with the camera, both above and below the water.  It never skipped a beat.  Did not have to worry about pampering this camera while in the water.  Very durable.  Great in the surf, on the beach and at the water park.Pros:  Excellent pictures both above and below the water  No leakage in any of the latches  Standard battery lasted most of the day on the beach  Size was good for my hands  (male 6'2")  Good night time photos (on par with my three Sony Digital cameras)  Excellent underwater photos, even in non-pristine conditions of the North shore  Excellent day time photos  Great lanyard with multiple attachment points.Cons:  Cycle time between pictures feels slow and can be reduced via menu options  Bigger battery reserve would be helpful.  Comes standard with a 1000 mah.

Reviews.Title: The Greatest Camera I ever Owned
Reviews.Author: Liat Vashdi-bonanno "Liat"
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing camera ever!  I bought it for my vacation and was able to capture such amazing shots with it.  To all of the others who complain about the way the camera works - you just have to know how to press the botton correctly (i.e. see the manual for directions but its not hard).  With a small child who loves to take pictures, this camera is very durable.  The fact that there is no lense cover does not make a difference.  You just have to wipe the water from it here and there when taking "dry" photos.

Reviews.Title: Review of my new Canon Powershot D10..
Reviews.Author: Bonnie J. Heidler
Reviews.Content: I love this new camera! It takes beautiful pictures...in water or out of water. I bought it to take pictures of places we go on our SeaDoo's mostly. I have tried it underwater for some shots...and they were very clear. I also took some outdoor wedding pictures..and they turned out great! I was worried about dropping my new camera when I was on my SeaDoo at the lake...so I put one of those boat key floats on the strap...and also a "croakie" that I had on hand for my sunglasses. Between the 2 of them...my camera now floats...which was a big concern to me. When you are on a Sea Doo...there is not a whole lot of room to avoid dropping the camera in the water..now, I am not worried about it...my camera will float..."just in case"..I had a few smudgy pictures where I had put BullFrog sun block on...and then pulled out my camera while on the water from its case..so I will be careful next time I use it to wipe the smudges off the lense after re-applying BullFrog. I only used it for the first time last week...but so far, am very pleased with it and the quality of pictures it takes. I almost bought the Olympus 550...but am so glad I paid a bit more for this Canon. Gorgeous pics!  Can hardly wait to use it some more!

Reviews.Title: Awesome pictures!!
Reviews.Author: Mary Lou Brink
Reviews.Content: This Canon PowerShot takes GREAT pictures underwater.  I have enjoyed it in our pool! It also takes great pictures out of the water as well!! I love it!!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot D10
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for active people or anyone who is just a little clumsy.It has all the regular features of a Canon PowerShot with the added advantage of being very sturdy!It is a little bulkier than other PowerShot models, but it's worth it to me to have a waterproof and shock resistant camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: H. Gent
Reviews.Content: I got compliments all week long on my new camera. Took it to a family vacation on the lake. We all went off a rope swing and it was great to get action shots from the water. I love not having to worry about getting it wet. Not only that, but the picture quality is perfect and the screen is very big. I love my new camera!

Reviews.Title: Leak in shallow water
Reviews.Author: Tree hugger
Reviews.Content: This camera leaked the second time I used it. This first time, I took it snorkeling and it worked perfectly. The second time out we were tubing in a river and it leaked in no more than three feet of water. I followed all the directions in the instruction manual to the letter and it stilled leaked. Now we have no pictures from the trip of a life time. Cannot recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot D10
Reviews.Author: Shoua T.
Reviews.Content: The main reason I purchased this camera was for its underwater capability. I purchased mine from Amazon in summer 2011. The D10 has stood up to everything I've put it through with only very minor cosmetic scratches, and hasn't had any water leakage.After spending the last three summer swimming with this baby, here's my verdict on the performance:Pros:- Underwater colors are beautiful; vibrant colors and warm skin tones- Takes clear photos (in and out of the water)- Durable body- Easy to use- Removable wrist-strap can be placed on one of the four corners of the camera- Battery life is decent but I highly recommend buying more- Has a good grip/feels good in the hand (my hand at least); the camera's bulkiness is not an issue for me because I keep it in my bag when not in useCons:- Shutter lags in-between flash photos (underwater)- Flash occasionally blurs the subject (underwater) by trying to focus on the closest subject, which are the bubbles- Remembering to switch out of underwater setting when out of the water, otherwise you'll end up with people with orange skin (and vice versa)- Buttons are almost flushed against the body so they can be a little tricky to press if you like having long nailsOverall, it's a great camera and it definitely lived up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Walten P Owens
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because i wanted a go anywhere waterproof shockproof camera and it has better optics than the olympus. I soon realized why the optics were better when I saw the dimensions. its huge! not to mention its ugly. Canon thinks they are making it tough by removing the edges but all they are doing is making it so you cant set is down on a flat surface to take a time delay picture. Also they allow you to attach the dangly thing on any edge. why would you ever attach it to the bottom? well i guess you can't sit it upright anyway. Also its not waterproof. water resistant ok but niot waterproof. first time i took it to the ocean it autoshut off and i had to dry it out. second time the lense filled with water. the only redeeming quality was that it did take good pictures for what it was. Moral of the story: Buy an OLYMPUS if you want a waterproof shockproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Holds to promise and easy to use
Reviews.Author: K. Liberti
Reviews.Content: As soon as I got this camera I filled up the sink and threw it in, it works perfect! We bring it hiking since it's easy to use, durable and lightweight.  So far it's done everything we've expected, pics are clear.

Reviews.Title: Camera Failure!
Reviews.Author: Sun Wukong
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about two and a half years now and have taken it on several trips on which the camera has been immersed or been in a very wet environment.  In that time period, I've not had major issues with the camera.  The pictures were fine for my purposes (mostly shots of my kids playing in the pool), however the camera response/focus time is rather slow but I figured this was a trade off for the waterproofing and its ruggedness.The death knell for this camera went as such:  I went to a pool party.  At first the camera worked fine as usual.  Then I began to notice some sort of strange artifact with the LCD viewfinder.  I turned the camera off and noticed there was condensation.  This was not a good sign.  I had never seen it before.  And then I looked at the front of the camera and there was water under the outside lens/cover.  I took the camera out and open the ports.  No water in either the battery compartment or the USB compartment.  Luckily the SD card was intact and I could eventually pull the files onto my computer's hard drive when I got home.Obviously a seal failed somewhere. I did not dive or have any sort of impact with the water, and did not take it deeper than 10 feet.  I was just wading around taking pictures during a birthday party for kids.  Since the camera is over 2 years old, I'm not sure what Canon will do with it, if anything.  It'll probably be a write off but I'll give them a call after the weekend.  I usually don't buy extended warranties for electronics but if I do purchase a "waterproof" camera again, it might be worth it.

Reviews.Title: Camera Leaked First Time in Water
Reviews.Author: Kevin H.
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in December 2011 as a Chrismas gift and it was taken to the Virgin Islands as a snorkel camera in January 2012.  On the very first entry into the water (1 foot), it took one picture and then the screen went black.  The camera was useless - is useless.  Web research found this water leak/dark screen is a problem with the Canon D10.  Poor engineering or construction/assembly.  I advise a no buy - go with Olympus or Nikon - I have both and like them very well.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for water/outdoor activities
Reviews.Author: hahvahdsquah
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year and have used it for multiple outdoor activities in a wide variety of conditions - underwater in pools, freshwater lakes, and saltwater snorkeling; as well as cold/icy/snowy conditions while skiing. It has definitely lived up to the "waterproof" claim as I haven't had a single issue with it. The image quality is great. I know this camera has a handful of one-star reviews for people claiming that it leaked on the first use and was irreparably damaged but I've had it underwater dozens of times and haven't had any issues, so my best guess is that a lot of those people didn't make sure all the seals were properly closed before going underwater (although I guess there's some chance that a percentage of the cameras are actually defective and I just got lucky).

Reviews.Title: mexico snorkeler
Reviews.Author: mexico snorkeler
Reviews.Content: this camera is awesome.. went to mexico and snorkeled everyday under water with this camera. very simple to use and switch between modes. I recorded lots of underwater video's with ease. I didnt read the directions of the book.. just dove right in with it. LOVE IT! Only thing that could be improved is the zoom capabilities... but hey its not your typical digital camera... takes great photo's!! AWESOME PURCHASE!

Reviews.Title: Underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Nadeem Anis
Reviews.Content: We took pics during parasailing, snorkeling and scuba and they turned out great. Would recommend it to a friend. Easy to use with one hand, feature becomes important during sports.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Vacations!
Reviews.Author: Tina Kitty "Tom"
Reviews.Content: We no longer have to be concerned about the camera getting wet.  The freedom to take shots ANYWHERE is great.  Our only negative is while you zoom-in taking video the camera does not focus.  Therefore close-up shots are blurry.  However, there are many settings available which may fix this problem.  Otherwise, we're very pleased with this camera.Update 11/2012: While we have created many memories with this camera there is one very annoying problem that's becoming worse.  For some reason the camera has trouble connecting to fully charged batteries.  When we attempt to turn on the camera it says "Change the battery pack." We use the primary and a spare and get the same reaction.  This seems to be a VERY common problem.  There are two reasons for this: the metal contacts can get dirty and the 3 metal "spring-like" contacts in the camera tend to get pushed back each time the battery is inserted.Solution: Using a q-tip we cleaned the metal battery contacts in the camera and on the batteries with a little rubbing alcohol.  Then we used a long needle to gently pull the metal contacts inside the camera out.  Using the pointy edge of the needle we gently inserted it under the metal contacts and gently pushed them up a little.Update 9/2013:  Well, the "Change the battery pack" has become too much of an issue.  In fact a friend is now going through the same situation.  Our solution doesn't really work anymore.  Therefore we decided to retire this camera.  Rather than go with the next model the D20 and possibly encounter similar problems we bought the less expensive Fujifilm XP60 which has worked great so far.

Reviews.Title: otello
Reviews.Author: otello
Reviews.Content: Amazing quality! I bought my first Waterproof Canon three years ago, and have no complains whatsoever. Then it's been stolen, and I got the second Canon. This camera never leaks, gives a fantastic quality of video and photo.

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: Diemc20
Reviews.Content: Excelent Digital Camera!!!Photos and videos under water are perfect.Smart and very easy to use.Canon is the best!!!I recomend...

Reviews.Title: No way to force the flash
Reviews.Author: S. Peterson "Photo Pete"
Reviews.Content: This camera does a good job on land, on sea, and under sea. The pics are quite sharp. Until you get into a difficult lighting situation where the camera can't decide whether or not to use the flash. Then at least half of the time when it should use the flash it does not. In this case the pictures come out very noisy. There needs to be a way to set the flash to fire when you want it to. There is no setting for that, there is only auto or off. So if you find that you take a lot of pictures indoors or around dusk, then you might want to consider another camera. Also there is quite a long lag for focusing. This is not a camera to use for a spur of the moment shot. I am happy with the way it performs under water and in wet conditions though. I bought this mainly for that and it does a good job there. I was hoping it would also be a good backup camera, but alas, it was not to be.

Reviews.Title: Fat Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon Eastman
Reviews.Content: I've had it a few days and so far I like it.  BUT, I was a bit surprised by the size and shape and you might be too.  If you are thinking "about the size of a deck of cards" or "a little bigger than an Altoids can", then you are going to be amused to learn that it is much more like a medium sized potato in size, shape, weight, and heft.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!
Reviews.Author: Diane Lorentson "Greyk9s"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo172EBRDZ94KAG', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo172EBRDZ94KAGloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf";
