} cv_mo172EBRDZ94KAGpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo172EBRDZ94KAGpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81pQl6eAMhS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo172EBRDZ94KAGpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo172EBRDZ94KAGcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo172EBRDZ94KAGcurrentClick) { return cv_mo172EBRDZ94KAGcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:12 MinsI bought this camera early in the summer for a trip to Mexico in October. I used it in the pool, lake, and on land to test it and get familiar with it.We got back from Mexico monday and I have 1000+ Amazing photos and 100+ videos. This is them most versatile/fun/portable/waterproof camera I could have ever asked for. The photos are crisp and true. We had a blast snorkeling and playing in the water taking pix and video.Follow the directions and rinse in freshwater. I bought a pen-type lens cleaner (it does get hazy in the saltwater with sunscreens and oils) and it was perfect. I was cautious to make sure the battery/SD Card cover was set properly before using it each time I opened it.An extra battery made certain that we had a full charge each day since it was in constant use.If you're thinking about it, don't wait. This was the best investment for memories that we could hoped for.

Reviews.Title: Definitely more than I wanted or needed.
Reviews.Author: Robert Santiago
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, because we had planned a cruise and I wanted a camera we could use at the beach. This camera is great in the water and we got a lot of great shots with it. After we got back from the cruise, I ended up using the camera all the time, because I always drop things and this camera can withstand some pretty good bumps. I love this camera and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good Product but has some issues - can't be your only camera
Reviews.Author: mbaldwin
Reviews.Content: The Canon D10 malfunctioned once with the error message of "Lens Error". We read some reviews online that had the same problem. Some of the reviewers returned the product while others just waited for the error to disappear. Since this is not our only camera, we just waited till the next day. We removed the battery overnight. The next day we replaced the battery and it worked. We have not gotten that error message again but we rarely use it. I hope it works when we need it to take that breath-taking picture :)Canon PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD

Reviews.Title: Failed after 1 week, filled with water
Reviews.Author: Mark Alsip
Reviews.Content: This was such a wonderful performer for the first week of use that I felt like I'd lost a friend when the seals failed and the camera flooded with water in the second week.  The fact that it happened during a vacation in French Polynesia, that I'd saved for for 2 years and built around snorkeling photography, was enough to sour me on this camera and I could not recommend it.  It is one of 3 underwater cameras that I've purchased (the other two are Pentax and one of those also flooded) and FEELS better built than the other 2.I believe the weakness is in the control buttons -- in my experience you CANNOT apply any real pressure to the buttons and must use the absolute minimum pressure necessary to trigger the shutter, change menu functions, etc.  My camera failed as I excitedly mashed the shutter button when a Moray eel popped out of a hole in front of me, in less than 5 feet of water just off Tatakoto Atoll in FP.  When I say "mashed", I mean the amount of pressure you'd apply to the button on a DSLR like a Nikon D70 -- certainly in no way an abusive or excessive amount of pressure.  Just a "Hey!  Oh, I gotta get this WOW!" amount of pressure from that little adrenaline burst that tells you you're taking a winning photograph.  In my situation, there was a little flicker of the view screen on the back of the camera, and then darkness.  When I surfaced, there was a sickening spread of cloudy water growing across the INSIDE of the rear-body display.  Later, looking at the front of the camera, I noticed a dirty spread of water/slime across the INSIDE of the lens.I really, really hate returning this camera but back it must go before the 30 day Amazon return policy expires.  It's just too expensive to fail so easily.  I'm going to take the recommendation of [...] (who gave this camera a good review in the single-body category) and buy a normal digital camera and a separate waterproof case, on the theory that the small amount of water that destroyed the Canon D10 would possibly be noticeable as a leak in the separate case and give me at least a CHANCE of saving my camera by quickly surfacing.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera !
Reviews.Author: Bykergus "bykergus"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have some BIG cameras. Canon 5d, Canon 20d, Canon 10d, F-1, AE-1, A-1, well, allot of cameras. Nikon underwater rig. Wow. I have a bunch of cameras.I'll tell ya. This one does not have all the features of my other cameras, even some of my other powershots by canon .. but .. it takes great pictures at 30 feet of water (rated to 33 feet, but, I don't want to push it).I bought my wife and my daughter bought one for herself.The pictures are great.I can use it in PROGRAM mode, which most of you will NOT do, and I can get the shots I want anddesire and need. Because I'm needie.I can go to movie mode in a quick push of a button.I can do so much with this camera.The buttons are big, easy to use, even under water (I'm a certified SCUBA instructor).I gotta tell ya. I've but aside my other powershots and cameras, and, aside from taking out my 5d on special ocassions and stuff, my wife and I both have this camera now and use them.Just shot some great pictures of Paul McCartney using these cameras.You'll love it too.By the way. I bought this from Amazon .. I buy most things from Amazon. Not sure why.

Reviews.Title: Best Ever
Reviews.Author: Lucinda Pinder "Lucinda Pinder"
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I ever owned. I live in The Bahamas and use this camera all the time. In the boat on fishing trips and it takes great pictures. Easy to use and durable.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!!
Reviews.Author: Mr. A. Guillen-bayarri "Antonio"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes excellent pics, it is agreat value. It works perfectly both underwater and outside, in fact i would say pics outsude are better.

Reviews.Title: leaked
Reviews.Author: none
Reviews.Content: picture quality was pretty good but leaked after second use, the disposable cameras take nearly as good picture quality and I have never had one leak. Hopefully cannon will take care of it under warranty.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon user
Reviews.Content: Had bought it before and it got stolen from my car so I bought the same camera again, love the fact that its waterproof and the quality of the images is just amazing, plus there's a couple fun effects you can use. It's worth the price!

Reviews.Title: great pictures but clunky
Reviews.Author: mike C
Reviews.Content: The camera takes awesome pictures in all environments, but its clunkiness is pain because you cant just slip it into your pocket for normal events.

Reviews.Title: Great product and fast delivery
Reviews.Author: D. Cells
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the Canon Power Shot. Battery lasts forever and it is great for a guy like me that is somewhat rough on his equipment. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: It might be water proof... but don't use it for anything else.
Reviews.Author: vac
Reviews.Content: So this may or may be a good underwater camera... if that is all you are going to use it for then disregard this review.  I didn't take enough underwater pictures to give it a fair shake at that.  I did use it for a weekend and it fails badly as a general point and shoot camera.  The picture quality was awful and not at all up to what I expect from a cannon (my previous camera was a powershot A620, and I ended up buying a PowerShot SX20 after returning this).  I really like cannon products and maybe this is a good rough and tumble camera, but you will have to take time to line up every shot and make sure your lighting is great... otherwise... the picture wont be worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: Best consumer underwater camera.
Reviews.Author: B. Phelan "Nokeone"
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera since October of 2010. I use it mainly for taking underwater shots while snorkeling. Because I live in Hawaii and spend 3-6 hours a week using the camera it probably gets more underwater use than the average consumer underwater camera.The Canon D10 I just bought at Amazon is the 3rd Canon D10 I've purchased. I would have given this camera 5 stars in terms of how it performs. The reason I didn't is that I've had problems with the LCD screen getting moisture in it after a short while. However, Canon customer support has been amazingly responsive to my problems. When they couldn't fix my problem they sent me a new camera. They've done this for me 3 times. The directions say to soak the camera for a couple of hours after using it in salt water. I used to do this. I stopped doing this when I kept ending up with the condensation problems. I now rinse the camera under cold water and carefully dry it. It's been much better since making this change.It is important to close both of the compartments on the camera very carefully. I now always test those before going in the water. Sometimes they are closed and don't show red, but are not fully closed. This has helped with the issue of condensation. I wish they had this explained more emphatically in the directions.The D10 has an underwater setting that brings in some of the reds that are often lost in underwater shots. This makes a huge difference in producing shots have the full color spectrum, rather than the normal blue/green hue you often find with consumer underwater cameras.The settings are easy to use and fairly intuitive. The LCD screen is also bright and easy to see while underwater. One thing I would like to see on a future version of the camera would be the option to zoom while shooting video.Despite the down side to this camera that I've mentioned. I absolutely love using this camera. I wouldn't have purchased 3 of them despite the problems if I didn't.If you would like to see underwater shots taken with the D10 in Hawaii, visit "Hawaiian Art Photography dot com"To be fair I must say that I do some darkroom type adjustments to the photos to bring out the depth of color. But what is amazing is that the color is there to be brought out. This is not the case with all consumer underwater cameras. I've tried others and ended up sending them back for this reason.On a final note, if you do have any problems with the camera, I can't say enough nice things about Canon Customer Support. They are polite and knowledgeable and very responsive to customer needs!

Reviews.Title: Not very submersible...
Reviews.Author: Boxer fan
Reviews.Content: I kayak alot and was hoping to purchase a camera I could get wet and that would take great pictures. After getting this one wet a couple of times somehow water got inside. I never submerged more than 6 inches. Now when ever we go out the inside of the lense develops steam or condensation. As a result the pictures come out foggy.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof?
Reviews.Author: Jaap-Jan de Greef
Reviews.Content: The opinions of people seem to be divided on who had a bad underwater experience and who says it takes great underwater pictures. I am with the disappointed crowd. Nice looking camara, and after reading several reviews of this and other camaras decided on this one. It took OK pictures on land. However when I was in Guatemala in 1 foot of water it took one blurry shot and the next picture the whole screen went grey. After taking it out of the water, it started working again the next day with a large condensation spot inside.  Don't know what to do here, because in reading reviews of almost any other camara,it seems to be the same toss-up regarding waterproofness.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Nicole Koter
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera late last year after going through several underwater cameras that just didnt stay waterproof! After losing nearly 4 days of vacation pictures due to our old camera's seal breaking I looked into this one and havent (knock on wood) had any issues since!It is a bit bulky, but its because everything is enclosed in a case and has no moving parts that are exposed to water. It takes crystal clear pictures even under water! It also has many settings that you can use for different lighting and is very user friendly!

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD CAMERA NOT GOOD AT NIGHT TOUGH
Reviews.Author: Coca "Coca"
Reviews.Content: Very nice picture you can take on this camera, the only bad thing is night pictures, they look very darkI

Reviews.Title: Water Leaked In... Canon didn't support
Reviews.Author: Kivanc
Reviews.Content: The camera had leaked in to the case about a 15 months after my purchase. There was no physical damage or hit. Canon US hasn't offer any solution other than reapair cost around at camera's original price... The funny apart is Canon Turkey offered a repair price around $500 where the camera was $200.DO NOT spend money to this camera or for Canon.. there are better more customer centeric brands.

Reviews.Title: Suffers Canon's longstanding lens error
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: THE GOODPicture quality from this camera is EXCELLENT; both above and under water. While I'm used to using DSLR cameras on full manual to extract the best possible picture quality, the automatic scene modes on this camera do a great job at taking excellent photos. Great job Canon.The lanyard that comes with the camera attaches via a bayonet mount to any of four corners of the camera with a metal to metal connection. This is wonderfully convenient feature and facilitates tying the camera to your wrist, backpack or piece of clothing in whatever why would make it most convenient to use. Another great job Canon.THE BADAfter using this camera for about a week, doing light snorkeling in warm water in the Caribbean, it simply stopped turning on. All the usual remedies were tried - remove and replace batteries and memory cards and so forth. Nada.Well within the warranty period (it was a few weeks old), Canon replaced the camera. I promptly sold the new camera.THE UGLYThere is a large body of literature online pointing to a longstanding problem with Canon point-and-shoot camera; Google "Canon E18 error". That and similar errors indicate a mechanical lens error that prevents the camera from starting up and/or shutting down. This goes back YEARS and affects multiple camera models. I had a very old Canon Powershot A60 that did the same thing. I chalked that up to just an old camera wearing out, despite being babied. Not so, apparently - bad on you Canon.I won't be buying a Canon point and shoot camera again.

Reviews.Title: Camera had to be replaced 3 times!
Reviews.Author: Venetia
Reviews.Content: After the third underwater outing the camera leaked in spite of the fact that I was very careful to make sure everything was sealed and washed it in fresh water afterwards as per instructions. I sent it back to Canon and they replaced it with a new one - but I had the same problem. That time they refused to refund my money and sent me a refurbished one which seems OK so far, but I have only used it twice. I have 2 Canon SLR's which I am really happy with - but when this one leaks I will not replace it and I would not recommend it to anyone.I also found customer service poor.

Reviews.Title: Had it just over a year and now it doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: I am looking for another underwater camera and I usually like Canon products but not this time  - very very disappointed - after market service is so important.  You need a dependable camera if you are going on vacations -- was not able to use it on my last one to Las Vegas so I had to use my phone camera.  You should not have to buy a new camera every year esp at these prices.

Reviews.Title: Don't use under water
Reviews.Author: M. Hunter
Reviews.Content: This camera is great above water in the rain, etc. But the first time that I used it snorkeling it leaked and ruined the camera. I only had it about 2 feet under water. By that time, my warranty had expired, so I am out of luck!

Reviews.Title: Leaked water
Reviews.Author: Phillip Griffith
Reviews.Content: I went all the way to the Island of St. John...only to have the camera leak and self destruct on the second use. The little red warning bar indicating the battery door is unlocked is barely visible...especially with all the snorkel gear on..what a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: GREAT - - Then a let down
Reviews.Author: Brett "Avid movie fan, loves tools, tech toys...
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in 2010. It has worked well up to know, but it has two issues that have been present since i bought it.1) when it is wet, in low light, or has in a, not fully charged battery, it does not focus well.2) At night using the flash, the battery does not stand up well. We usually have to take a spare battery AND a second camera to any night activities.HOWEVER, now I have noticed water seeping in by the battery compartment, I have dried it out many times and it still worked. Until this week, it is now not functioning and therefore not much use.So I am in the market for another waterproof camera. I might buy this model again, but will look around before I make a hasty decision.UPDATEbought another one and within 6 months, it stopped working, will not be buying this again.

Reviews.Title: Priceless
Reviews.Author: Mungia "JM"
Reviews.Content: I first used the disposable camera and some pictures came out great and other did not. Also could not delete what you did not want. So I saw the digital waterproof camera and at first did not want to pay that much for a camera. After lots of research I thought I give it a try. Not only did the pictures turn out great inside water and out but the cameras never stopped working. We took it to the Virgin Island where we went snorkeling and parasailing. I do recommended after every use to rinse it with fresh room temapture water. Best camera I have ever had and very easy to use. I also uploaded pictures for proof.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME little point & shoot
Reviews.Author: B-Mon30
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I literally waited until the day we were to leave for our vacation to learn how to operate this camera and didn't have a problem, so it's very easy to learn. (I do photography on the side w/ a DSLR, but admittedly, I am not the best when it comes to being tech savvy... I'm more the creative type.)We took this on our trip to Jamaica and I was absolutely impressed with the capability of this little p&s;!  The beach shots were incredible and it somehow managed to not blow out anything even though the sun was incredibly bright. We used it underwater and the pics turned out pretty darn good, too... anywhere from good to acceptable quality.In low light, with no flash, it operates as pretty much expected for a p&s; - not especially well. But if you're not concerning yourself with your photos being technically "correct", it's not a big deal. I mean, if all you want is to make sure you get a shot of your spouse at a dinner or something, it's fine.With flash in low light, it does okay, but you have to watch the red eye. Ended up with quite a few red eye pics of my hubby who has blue eyes, but it wasn't a big deal because I have the software to correct it.Overall, I am giving this camera 5 stars because it did take some excellent photographs, some acceptable photographs, and has great underwater capability. No leaking or damage to report here.

Reviews.Title: Canon underwater camera
Reviews.Author: runner
Reviews.Content: I have tried underwater cameras in the past.  This is by far the best.  This is my second one; so that when we dive, my wife and I can each take pictures.  I bought it for underwater pictures but usually use it for pictures on land.  12x zoom with great clarity, easy to use, great pictures.  I am out walking a lot and I do not always worry about the weather.  It is great to have a camera that I do not have to worry if it's raining or not.  I take good pictures while everyone else in the group worries about getting their cameras wet.I do not know about technical details, so go to other reviews.The camera is fast enough for my purposes.  It is great for close ups and distance pictures.

Reviews.Title: Problematic (Lens Error repaired, immediate leakage)
Reviews.Author: J. Benjamin
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera. I used it for a few months and kept getting the dreaded 'lens error'. I sent it back to Canon, who fixed it. Unfortunately, I put it away for the winter and by the following summer, when I got it in the sea, it leaked immediately at 3m water depth. Unlucky I guess, but now I have a flooded, dead camera (mind, it appears to have flooded through the power button, not either the battery or av seal; at least my memory card was dry and salvageable). Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Most fun I've had with a camera
Reviews.Author: Cinnamon Kid
Reviews.Content: ProsIt many ways this is the camera I have had the most fun with. I bought this camera as soon as it came out as I was doing some outdoor activities and wanted a tough camera to take with me. It's not an SLR, so don't compare picture quality or focus speed against one. But the D10 went places my SLR will never see. On a ski slope. In a raft or a canoe. In a pool. On a boogie board.I shot video of a white water rafting trip and showed it a scout meeting. People were blown away. The action was up-close, the conversations were clear. Everyone felt like they were in the raft with us. Shooting video in the ocean while doing boogie boarding was great too.I paid a lot more than the current price and think it was worth it.ConsI wish it fit in my pocket like the Nikon AW100.The neck strap configuration, which looks like a great convenience, is an extra and is priced excessively. Highway robbery by Canon if you ask me.Towards the end--my wife lost the camera this summer--the zoom wasn't working while recording video. That wasn't good.I've basically sworn off of Canon point and shoots because of recurring dead pixel problems on the LCD--"scratch" lines give way to a dime-size gray circle, which are annoying although picture quality is not affected.  Canon apparently has a systemic problem and won't address it for customers. I did not have that issue with the D10, but Canon's LCD failures have scarred me. I'm leaning towards the Panasonic or Nikon cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: lauranathan
Reviews.Content: We love this camera. It takes great underwater pictures (been underwater for many uses now-2 years worth-with no issues) but we use it for everything else too. It takes much better pics than my sony powershot. Highly recommend this camera!!

Reviews.Title: diappointing image quality + it's leaking + it's big
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera as a gift (I have a Rebel XSi and SD850), and I've been generally disappointed by the quality of indoor pictures, taken with flash or without. The pictures come out very soft, with halos around brighter objects, and appear very lifeless and flat. My expectation was to see quality comparable to the SD series (digital elph), but unfortunately, the IQ of D10 is much worse.P.S. The camera leaked, then was repaired and leaked again. Such a disappointment!!

Reviews.Title: another great camera from canon
Reviews.Author: Alexander Miltenov "miltenoff"
Reviews.Content: I love this CANON camera.Canon never makes bad camera!!!I did some research before I had chosen this one cause I wasin need for waterproof camera. I got it 2 months ago and,of course, I dropped it first time I took it out, it rolled overrocks for few yards-it got some scratches, but works perfect.Image Stabilizer is very useful, especially whenyou digitally zoom in, your shots are rarely out of focus andI find smart you can move the mount of your strap. Still haven't triedit on night mode, though. but overall- totally worth everysingle dollar you had payed for it. oh, did I mentioned battery's long life?

Reviews.Title: It died the first day
Reviews.Author: Angela C. Goble "justwent2Maui!"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera on the 3rd of July to test it out before our trip to Hawaii next week.  It stopped working after a few hours.  I am really bummed out because it seemed like a good camera.  We took it in a friends pool and at first it stopped showing the picture on the screen, and then it just stopped working.  I was going to return to Amazon for another one, but looks like they are backordered.

Reviews.Title: so simple
Reviews.Author: Schertz Tx Patron
Reviews.Content: Just received my Canon D10 a couple of days ago and I took it to the river today. I got to play with it in the water some but since it was fairly cloudy and the water wasnt as clear as normal I didnt really attempt many underwater shots. The camera is so easy to use. Figuring out the settings is extremely simple. It will be a great camera for us to use on our vacation or anytime we go to the river or lake or water park. I am only giving it 4 stars right now because I havent used it for its intended purpose. We plan on going on a snorkeling trip to Jamaica and thats the main reason we bought the camera. I will update my review after I use it snorkeling and see how well it holds up to the salt water. So far though I am very impressed.

Reviews.Title: lifechanging
Reviews.Author: tpeach
Reviews.Content: I love being able to videotape my daughter learning how to swim!! It was worth every penny because to me that is priceless!

Reviews.Title: Save yourselves $300 and buy a Nikon!
Reviews.Author: Alicja
Reviews.Content: I never leave bad feedback, but this one really bugs me. The camera broke on the first trip! Lens error. There is nothing more frustrating than a non-working camera when you are on vacation!!! Send it to Canon for repair, they fixed it under warranty. Used it 3 more times. Lens error came back, but warranty had already expired and Canon wanted me to pay $160 to fix the same darn problem. Why couldn't they fix it the first time around, I have no idea. On top of that - quote from Canon repair center "With a camera like the D10, you want to be careful about how you seal it.  Even a few grains of sand that are cleaned off can affect the way the lens works.  Perhaps that would be helpful to consider for futureuse". You've got to be kidding me!!! Definitely my last piece of Canon equipment!

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT D10
Reviews.Author: XYZ
Reviews.Content: DO NOT LIKE THE LOCATION OF THE MENU BUTTON.  WHEN HOLDING THE CAMERA UNDERWATER (WITH 1 HAND) YOUR THUMB TENDS TO HIT THE MENU BUTTON.  BAD LOCATION FOR THIS BUTTON.

Reviews.Title: This guy takes a beating!
Reviews.Author: Water Happy!
Reviews.Content: My last camera broke because I dropped it, so I bought this one partially because it's shockproof (I've already dropped it from about 4 feet).The other reason was a a trip to Central America. I've taken it snorkeling, swimming, to the top of a volcano and through the jungle. It withstands even salt water really well (just make sure to rinse it out). The one thing I might change -- the strap is designed to attach to multiple corners of the camera. However, after the first dip into the ocean, the attachment got stuck, so I haven't been able to change it around. But other than that, I love this camera! I love not having to worry about destroying it (beach, rain, etc)and I love the photo quality of Canon powershots.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Julie "toy expert"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after several months of looking for a good replacement for my Pentax W30. I had a Pentax W10 before I got the W30 and loved both of them. My W30 was stolen and I was SO disappointed. I looked at reviews on numerous websites to see what camera I would get to replace my w30. The reviews for the newer Pentax cameras were worse than the older models so I decided to upgrade to a different brand. I found the best reviews on this camera and after several months I finally bought it. I was very disappointed. I have read the manual cover to cover and there are still things on the camera I can't figure out. There are way too many settings. I can't just take a picture. I have to change the settings every time. The shutter speed is way slower than any camera I have had in the past and I am very disappointed with the size. For a compact camera it is huge and awkward. I have to constatly wipe off the lens to get a decent picture. I understand there is no lens cover but with my W30 there wasn't either and I hardly ever had to wipe off the lens to that camera. I keep wishing I would have spent the money on the w30 instead of buying this one. I think the picture quality is very similar to the Pentax, but all the functions and features and the build are just not worth it. Get the Pentax.

Reviews.Title: alright but not for me
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I can't say there was anything really wrong with it but it just wasn't for me - too small and uncomfortable to hold -I usually use a Canon Rebel XT so I need something with a little more bulk

Reviews.Title: disappointed - will go back to Nikon
Reviews.Author: NBO
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time Nikon digital owner/user.  I've seen some fabulous Canon SLR cameras, so when I was looking for a "pocket" digital that I could take into the wilderness without too many concerns, this D10 looked to be the ticket.  The strong reviews only reinforced my decision to give it a try.  Big mistake.  Let's start with the "big" part.  This is not really a pocket camera.  You can sort of tell by the pictures of the camera, but it's bulky (even more so when you see and hold it) and won't easily fit in a normal shirt pocket.  I like to carry a camera when hunting, but this thing is so bulky that you have carry it in a fanny pack or some sort of additional carrier.  The biggest disappointment though is the image quality.  As others have mentioned, the images are grainy even for a camera with half the pixel density.  Add to that the exposures (typically a Canon strength in their SLRs) which are almost ALWAYS overexposed, and you get the picture so-to-speak.  I hunted for the disk that included Canon's DPP software thinking I could adjust exposures after the fact using raw digital image files.  No such luck.  I don't believe this camera will record in raw mode, and DPP software is not included.  If you MUST have a waterproof camera (and even that is suspect if the reviews are read carefully and thoroughly), then this camera might be OK.  Otherwise there are many better options out there (Nikon and others) for less money and better image quality.  Overall, very disappointed.  I'll go back to Nikons.

Reviews.Title: 1 problem and its with the order
Reviews.Author: Stuart
Reviews.Content: Everything arrived as scheduled, but i payed for my item to be gift wrapped and that was not the case. So with my experience paying for items to be gift wrapped, my advice is to save your money and wrap it yourself if needs be.

Reviews.Title: leaked, now a brick
Reviews.Author: Doug Spriggs "doug"
Reviews.Content: Well I will try again, seems the moderators here wear panties so I can use any offensive language describing what i'd ;like to to with the camera regarding tocanon engineers.Camera took nice pictures until it leaked. After two years it it now no good. Will never by canon again.............Never went below 3 feet with it.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera, but not waterproof
Reviews.Author: M. Allen
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled to get this camera recently, but like others found it wasn't waterproof.  It takes good pictures, is rugged, but the display died within a minute of it's first submersion into water (and yes, I checked the gaskets carefully before going in).  I pulled it out right away, and then spent the next week drying it by opening it up and leaving it in the refrigerator.  I got lucky, and it now functions again, but I almost lost my brand new camera.  So, now I have to treat it as a water resistant camera... which means it's quite overpriced.  Bummer!  ~Micah

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera, but...
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: Make sure you order a memory card (SD) when you order the camera. It doesn't come with one and there is no internal memory. Great camera otherwise.

Reviews.Title: LCD DIED, NOT REALLY WATERPROOF!!  Bring a back up!
Reviews.Author: Joe Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly for our yearly vacation. I tested it a few times before we left for our vacation, mainly in the sink and in the rain. It worked fine every time I used it, but the first time I took it to the beach and went swimming with it, the LCD went out. So I couldn't see what I was shooting, or if it was working. The next day after the camera was dry, the LCD went back on and the photos and videos that I took after the LCD died were there. I thought maybe it was just a glitch. That day we took it to our hotel pool and LCD died again, but the camera still worked. Also the inside of the LCD became foggy and moist. It's been about a month now since we've been back and the LCD still doesn't work, but it still takes pics and video, you just can't see them at the time they're taken. As far as this camera being waterproof up to 33 feet, it wasn't waterproof at 3 feet.PICTURES: The pics come out fine, not the best I've seen, a little soft around the edges but still pretty good. Nice functions, and the auto scene select is a nice touch and works good. The underwater pics came out better then the non-under water pics, although using the flash somethimes makes it too bright and I couldn't make out the fish in the pics. I took some photos of some coral and it came out nice and colorful (without the flash). When using this camera indoors, the flash is way too bright and tends to over-expose.VIDEO: When taking Videos underwater there is a constant clicking noise. Other then that, the videos came out nice and clear and are fun to watch. It does get pretty fuzzy and grainy when using the zoom though.OVERALL: The camera still takes photos and video, but I can't see what I'm shooting and that's a real pain. I do not recommend this camera; I feel ripped off after paying $300.00 for it. I really expected it to work as advertised, especialy being a Canon camera. If you are buying this, and are taking it on vacation, bring a backup. You don't want to miss out on the memories.

Reviews.Title: waterproof?
Reviews.Author: Natacha
Reviews.Content: Good day, I am Brazilian  and  I bought a Canon D10 in August 11, 2010, a friend  who  brought  me  to  the  U.S., but  the machine that is waterproof, water came, and now  is not working, I wonder how I proceed, I entered  contact  the  authorized  canon  of Brazil and said no way, but they are not looked at the machine, as I do? Do you have  warranty? how to  proceed?

Reviews.Title: Very Hot Camera
Reviews.Author: Iyad Al Nounou "iyadnn"
Reviews.Content: this camera was from the best cameras that i bought, i recommend others to buy it

Reviews.Title: Broke in Aruba
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Palmer
Reviews.Content: I borrowed this camera from my best friend.  They had taken it to Hawaii with them and came back with some pretty great photos.  My new wife and I went on our 10 day honeymoon to the Caribbean.  Our first stop was in Aruba.  Four wet shots later and it stopped working.  So, I am ordering a new one for my friend; but, I would not recommend this to most other people.  The unit is too sensitive to shocks.

Reviews.Title: very good photo quality- but not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Vivid Delight
Reviews.Content: After one day being under the water- the next day the camera shuts off after a little while and says to change battery pack! The battery was full and it constantly did that after one day! The photo quality is unbelievable and it's really not as bulky as a powershot g7. But for the price of the camera- I expect it to last past one day.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: This is the worst canon camera, I try to take some pics in the sea then screen and len went full of water and camera stop working, now I don't have warranty because they don't give one if you buy by amazon and live outside USA and CANADA.Please don't buy this camera!!

Reviews.Title: lost in the sea
Reviews.Author: JJ Takeo "john doe"
Reviews.Content: Don't buy any waterproof camera until they figure out how to make it float. Had camera for a couple months now and it's somewhere on the reef. Lost in mild 1-3 surf while taking action shots.Had that poorly manufactured Olympus floating strap on when plastic clip clipped off in wave. Lost camera , all pictures and out $270......wasn't even able to view pics on computer to give accurate rating....

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: Shelly553
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! Mt aunt had it but she lost it. The memory card was misplaced I guess because it didn't come with the camera. There is a box that everything (not including memory card) you need is in. I have just been testing the camera out but as far as I am concerned it is great. The 4 stars is for the memory card misplacement, everything else is fine. My one piece of advise is to follow the instructions that I know nobody wants to read but they are really helpful.

Reviews.Title: underwater camera
Reviews.Author: G. Glaser
Reviews.Content: Takes good photo's.  Best outside.  Easy to use. A little larger than most underwater cameras. Should be priced a little lower.

Reviews.Title: Camera great - no Windows 64-bit support though
Reviews.Author: C. Rueby
Reviews.Content: Camera works great - happy with that. However, when I tried to load the software disk on a Windows XP-64bit machine it immediately fails, saying it is not supported. I contacted Canon, who said that they have no drivers for any 64-bit machines. Connecting the camera via USB did partially work - it mounted up as a drive so I could manually transfer the files. However, none of the applications that came with the camera would install. Pretty bad, considering that 32-bit apps run fine on a 64-bit machine, its mainly drivers that have to be special. When I asked Canon about the application loads, they kept replying that I should use a card reader to transfer files. I could not get them to answer about the applications.Bottom line: great camera unless you have a 64-bit machine (which are becoming very common these days - Dell/others are selling them by the truckload!)

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Ruth Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed about the merchandise I received.  I had ordered 2 identical Canon Cameras and received 2 different cameras.  One was the Canon I ordered and the 2nd one was an Olympus camera which is a totally other brand and different camera.  Again, I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: help
Reviews.Author: E. Gentle
Reviews.Content: Can anyone tell me how this camera does at night time out of the water taking pictures?

Reviews.Title: Don't get it wet.
Reviews.Author: Homeschool Mom
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pics, and is easy to use, but the printed waranty excludes water related damages. We took ours swimming (not diving) and the display stopped working. We let it dry out over a heat vent for several days then returned it (it was dead anyway). Canon repaired it and noted water damage, but did not charge us. Yeah Canon! We now use it when taking pics around the water, but no longer take it swimming, which was half the fun.Spend your money, take your chances.

Reviews.Title: Good for the Bathtub, not for Surfers!
Reviews.Author: T. Perez "Surf Nut"
Reviews.Content: 2nd time in the water, FAIL! I followed the directions to the Letter in regards to soaking it and cleaning it right after having it in salt water. The Pics were fuzzy to take, not to good when you're in DEEP SURF trying to survive and take pics. Second time out, the cheaply made leash it came with SNAPPED and BOTH SEALS were rendered useless by the Pacific Ocean, which Zapped the Camera. I don't understand how some reviewers can say a product like this is going to be good, but anticipate having to change seals on the camera in the future. I got mine New and the seals were bad, so now I'm out a camera, and memory card. That $100 EXTRA pack SHOULD COME STANDARD with the camera as well, not some Cheap Leash. I guess if you are going to just go snorkeling and take still photos with this camera, it's gotten enough good reviews for that, just DON'T BUY this if you think it's a rugged camera that can take a beating. Because it CAN'T!ALL THAT GLITTERS ISN'T GOLD!And btw, I like that it's a "big" camera, I have "big" hands, not small tiny bony girl hands, like the rest of the competition makes. And before you haters say "Get A Go Pro" I have friends that have been ripped off by that cheap POS garbage camera.

Reviews.Title: USED ONCE AND DONE
Reviews.Author: Craig Fellner
Reviews.Content: MY DAUGHTER IS DOING CHARITY WORK IN AFRICA AND SHE BOUGHT THIS CAMERA WHEN SHE WAS HOME AT CHRISTMAS. ONE OF THE THINGS SHE DOES IS WORK WITH WHALE SHARKS AND WANTED TO GET PHOTOS.  SHE USED IT ONCE AND IT WON'T WORK ANY MORE.  SINCE THAT HAPPENED I'VE READ OTHER REVIEWS THAT TALK OF THE LENS JAMMING AND CAMERA DISPLAYING E-18.  VERY BUMMED OUT SINCE IT COSTS 1/2 OF HER MONTH'S SALARY AND SHE WAS SO EXCITED TO HAVE IT.  CAN'T MAIL IT BACK TO THE STATES BECAUSE ALL OF THE MAIL GETS TORN OPEN AND THINGS OF VALUE STOLEN..LESSON TO BE LEARNED IN THERE SOMEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Accessory Kit OVERPRICED
Reviews.Author: R. Baker

Reviews.Title: missing parts  --- strap mount
Reviews.Author: hiccno1 "hiccno1"
Reviews.Content: The D 10 is a nice little camera with one major flaw . The way the wrist and neck strap connect to the camera is by way of a very special wrist strap mount. Without the mount there is no way to safely use the camera as intended. Another problem is that the additional straps coast $130 --- That's right $130 for a couple of neck straps .My camera arrived without the special mount . When I called Canon I was told the part was backordered 4-6 weeks. I returned the camera . A week later the mount arrived in a box big enough for two cameras. The special mount is an unnecessary complication and does not add any functionally to the D 10. I will not purchase another D 10 because of this design "innovation"

Reviews.Title: Would look elsewhere next time...
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Mallard Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera sight unseen.. I needed a compact waterproof camera that took magazine quality shots.. I love the product.. A bit more rugged frame would make it a 5-star.. However, I am not happy with the seller.. For starters the packing was poor and the box came dented.. Very little attention was paid to packaging what should be considered a delicate product.. There was also no warranty card in the box even though the specs said it was part of the package.. This makes me wonder what I got? Several emails and a few weeks have passed with no action on teh part of the seller.. I will not buy from them again as I fear that I have bought a grey market, refurbed, or something else??? I gave them 3 weeks to resolve this and nothing.. Terrible service...

Reviews.Title: Wanted to buy, but this camera is not good enough
Reviews.Author: Bob Van Epps
Reviews.Content: I waited patiently for the Canon D10 to arrive. Canon makes great cameras and something on par with their best point and shoots that is waterproof sounds wonderful. The problem is that Canon dumbed down this camera so much that is is not much of a camera at all. I am sure that it will take great snapshots but for $300+, I expected much more.The zoom range is not very useful, there are no manual control options and leaving out HD video... what were they thinking. I am sure that the powers that be at Canon decided that the best plan was to make their first waterproof camera basically idiot-proof and then follow it up with hardened versions of their more avanced cameras down the road. Well, they succeded with the idiot-proof goal. The problem is that the price that this camera commands is way to high, based on its capabilities.I wanted a waterproof camera to take with me on my kayak while fishing in the kelp beds off of San Diego. I release most of my fish so the photo I take is often the only thing that proves I was on the water and not at the bar. After finally getting my hands on the D10, I opted to pick up a very reasonably priced Panasonic ZS1, (not waterproof), at Costco for about $100 less.The ZS1 is a much better camera for the money. While I would have preferred a waterproof camera, for the time being, I will just have to resort to keeping the Panasonic in a plastic bag while out fishing.I am a big Canon fan and am certain that one of these days they will release a waterproof camera that befits the Canon name. The D10 is just not a very good effort.

Reviews.Title: fisherprice enters the waterproof camera scene
Reviews.Author: Michael E "Michael E"
Reviews.Content: Felt like a beer can in my pocket and looked like fisher price designed this camera for a 3yr old.Sorry folks, this is not ergonomically designed is any way shape or form. Images were alright. Actual use was mostly simple. Point and hope with the usual controls.  Like a relic from a time capsule when compared to most other cameras on the market. But in all fairness, sometimes simple people need simple cameras. And rather than cursing the darkness, I'll light a flame, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS1 is amazing.

Reviews.Title: DIDNT INCLUDE STRAP MOUNT!!
Reviews.Author: Volleyball Chick
Reviews.Content: Everything about this camera is fantastic EXCEPT for one little thing...when we opened the box the srtap mount (the peice that attaches the strap to the camera)was missing. Now,tell me how are you supposed to use a UNDERWATER camera without a stap. Now we have to buy the 128.00 acessory kit in order to be able to use it on lur trip. I am very dissapointed that this wasnt there. Although, from what i have seen so far it is a good camera that is easy to use and is not "dummie proof". :)

Reviews.Title: No Lens Cover: Major Design Flaw
Reviews.Author: Just Me
Reviews.Content: are you kidding me? this camera is marketed for rugged outdoor use, but canon let the most delicate part of the camera unprotected. major design flaw.update: i thoroughly tested this camera, and i can honestly say that it deserves a 1-star.  what really kills it is the auto mode.  in auto mode, there is considerable auto focus lag.  it gets annoying when you are trying to take a picture and the screen keeps going from blurry to clear as the camera is trying to auto focus--which sometimes takes more than 1-second.  secondly, every single picture that i have taken in auto mode has a yellow hue to it. i am not sure if this is due to the camera picking an ISO that is too high/low.

Reviews.Title: Camera had a bad sensor, I will never buy from Amazon again
Reviews.Author: tweaks
Reviews.Content: This camera was intended for a special shoot for my daughter, and it came in defective, with a bad sensor.  Amazon doesn't even have a phone number to contact, at least not one that is visible!  I will NEVER buy from Amazon again, this is ridiculous.  No wonder they are tanking.

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality poster-size prints
Waterproof to 33 feet, cold resistant from 14-104 degrees (F) and shockproof up to 4 feet
DIGIC 4 Image Processor; evolved Face Detection Technology plus Face Detection Self-timer
Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper settings
Compatible with SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Canon PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD
